Headlines: Adverse Event Reporting for Cancer Therapy Needs Revision
Teaser: The Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events was developed to standardize language for reporting adverse events that occur in NCI-sponsored clinical trials, but it is unable to adequately code the subacute adverse events that occur with new targeted therapies.

Headlines: Respiratory Compromise, Death May Be Linked to Botulinum Toxin
Teaser: An ongoing FDA safety review of Botox, Botox Cosmetic (botulinum toxin type A), and Myobloc (botulinum toxin type B) has shown systemic adverse reactions resembling botulism.

Headlines: FDA Takes Action to Stop Marketing of Unapproved Colchicine Injection
Teaser: The US Food and Drug Administration has received 50 reports of adverse events with colchicine injection, including 23 deaths, related to product use.

Headlines: Two Studies Describe Approaches Shown to Reduce Obstetrical Errors
Teaser: Yale teaching hospital cut its obstetrical error rate in half after implementing changes; a single change by a Pennsylvania hospital also showed improvement in patient safety.

Headlines: Varenicline May Be Linked to Risk for Serious Symptoms
Teaser: Patients given varenicline should be monitored for strange thoughts/behaviors, depressed mood, and suicidality.

Headlines: Antiepileptic Drugs Linked to Increased Risk for Suicidality
Teaser: Patients taking certain drugs for epilepsy or other indications should be carefully monitored for behavioral changes.

Headlines: Heparin Recall
Teaser: Nine lots of the antithrombin have been recalled because of a higher-than-expected rate of allergic reactions.

Headlines: Adverse Drug Events More Than Doubled Between 1998 and 2005
Teaser: Serious adverse drug events reported to the US Food and Drug Administration's Adverse Event Reporting System increased 4 times faster than did the total number of outpatient prescriptions during this period.

Headlines: CF Patient Death May be Linked to Colistimethate Inhalation Therapy
Teaser: Inhalation solution should be used immediately to reduce the risk for pulmonary toxicity, according to the FDA.

Headlines: Isotretinoin May Decrease Depression in Adolescents With Acne
Teaser: Treatment of moderate-severe acne either with conservative therapy or with isotretinoin was associated with a decrease, not an increase, in depressive symptoms.

Headlines: FDA Safety Labeling Changes: Vesanoid, Kaletra, Axid, Enbrel
Teaser: The FDA has approved revisions to the safety labeling for tretinoin capsules (Vesanoid), lopinavir/ritonavir capsules and oral solution (Kaletra), nizatidine 75-mg tablets (Axid AR), and etanercept (Enbrel).

Headlines: Clozapine, Olanzapine May Increase Risk of Insulin Resistance
Teaser: A cross sectional study suggests that compared with risperidone, use of these drugs is associated with a significantly higher risk of developing insulin resistance.

Headlines: Beta-Blockers May Be Underused
Teaser: No increase in depression risk was seen, but there was a small risk of fatigue and sexual dysfunction.

Headlines: Estrogen Replacement May Negate the Benefits of Growth Hormone
Teaser: In a preliminary study, researchers have found evidence that boosting production of growth hormone can reduce body fat and help maintain levels of functioning in elderly men and women.

Headlines: Rotigotine Patch Recalled Due to Drug Crystallization
Teaser: Drug crystallization can hamper absorption; healthcare professionals are advised to begin down-titrating patients according to product guidelines and should not initiate rotigotine therapy in new patients.

Headlines: Rubber Chemical Found in Daptomycin Infusion Pumps
Teaser: Healthcare professionals are advised to avoid the use of daptomycin with ReadyMED elastomeric infusion pumps.

Headlines: Exubera Gets Lung Cancer Warning
Teaser: Cases occurred in prior smokers and are too few to establish a causal role for the product.

Headlines: Transparency in Adverse Event Reporting Pleases Patients
Teaser: A new survey reveals that hospitalized patients are informed of less than half of all adverse events that they experience.

Headlines: Tegaserod Maleate Restricted to Emergency Use Only
Teaser: FDA must approve requests for tegaserod maleate and must authorize shipments from the manufacturer.

Headlines: Study Data Link 2 NRTIs to Increased MI Risk
Teaser: The FDA recommends that healthcare professionals discuss potential risks and benefits of abacavir (Ziagen) and didanosine (Videx) therapy, including myocardial infarction, with HIV-infected patients.

Headlines: Diabetic Ulcer Gel Linked to Increased Cancer Deaths
Teaser: Healthcare professionals are advised to discuss risks and benefits of becaplermin gel (Regranex) with patients.

Headlines: Asthma Medication Evaluated for Possible Link to Mood Changes,  Suicidality
Teaser: The FDA has issued a MedWatch Safety alert informing doctors and patients that it is investigating a possible link between use of montelukast and changes in mood and behavior as well as suicidality and suicide.

Headlines: More Heparin Recalls in Europe and US
Teaser: The latest countries to recall heparin products are France, Italy, and Denmark, and the affected material has been traced to four Chinese suppliers. Another US manufacturer has also recalled some heparin products.

Headlines: Heparin Contaminant Identified
Teaser: The contaminant found in samples of heparin that had been linked to an increase in adverse reactions has now been identified as oversulfated chondroitin sulfate.

Headlines: Tiotropium Linked to Possible Increased Risk of Stroke
Teaser: On the basis of an ongoing safety review, MedWatch reports a possible increased risk of stroke with use of tiotropium.

Headlines: Serious Skin Reactions Reported With TNF-alpha Antagonists
Teaser: Safety reviews of infliximab, etanercept, and adalimumab identified rare cases of erythema multiforme, Stevens-Johnson syndrome, toxic epidermal necrolysis, and other skin reactions.

Headlines: Black Box Warning Issued for Etanercept Regarding Infections
Teaser: A black box warning to be included on etanercept's prescribing information states that tuberculosis has been observed with TNF-blocking agents and that tuberculosis may be caused by reactivation of latent tuberculosis infection and by new infection.

Headlines: Heparin Contaminant Traced to China
Teaser: The FDA has also issued an import alert requiring all heparin products be tested for the contaminant.

Headlines: New HIV Drug Linked to Risk for Hepatitis
Teaser: Liver enzymes should be monitored during treatment with ritonavir-boosted darunavir.

Headlines: Cough Medicine Dosing Errors Linked to Patient Deaths
Teaser: Patients should not take hydrocodone plus chlorpheniramine extended-release suspension (Tussionex) more often or at higher doses than recommended.

Headlines: Heparin Contaminant
Teaser: The FDA is requesting all heparin manufacturers to test products for this contaminant. Increased rates of adverse reactions have now also been reported in Germany with heparin not made by Baxter or its supplier, Scientific Protein Laboratories.

Headlines: What Your Patients Are Reading
Teaser: Hormone replacement therapy may result in a higher risk for breast cancer, both hysterectomy and uterine artery embolization can help treat uterine fibroids, tendonitis may be a result of statin use, obese children have more surgical complications than children of a normal weight, a change in selective serotonin reuptake inhibitors in conjunction with cognitive behavioral therapy may be adequate t

Headlines: Antiviral Drug Labels Get Warnings for Neuropsychiatric Changes
Teaser: Patients with influenza should be closely monitored for signs of abnormal behavior during treatment with Tamiflu and possibly also Relenza.

Headlines: Natalizumab May Cause Significant Liver Injury
Teaser: Natalizumab (Tysabri) should be discontinued in patients with jaundice or other signs of liver injury.

Headlines: Byetta Linked to Acute Pancreatitis
Teaser: Exenatide therapy has been linked to 6 new cases of hemorrhagic or necrotizing pancreatitis.

Headlines: FDA Warns About Injection Site Reactions With Naltrexone
Teaser: Injectable, extended-release naltrexone, used for the treatment of alcohol dependence, has been linked to adverse injection-site reactions, some requiring surgery.

Headlines: HPV Vaccine Deemed Safe and Effective, Despite Reports of Adverse Events
Teaser: Questions over the safety of the human papillomavirus vaccine have been raised by consumers, parents, healthcare professionals, and others. But having analyzed the available data, the CDC and FDA offer reassurance.

Headlines: FDA Releases List of Genomic Biomarkers Predictive of Drug Interactions
Teaser: Quarterly updates of the table by the US Food and Drug Administration should help keep clinicians and patients informed about potential drug response and risk for adverse reactions.

Headlines: Genetic Screening Recommended Before Abacavir HIV Therapy
Teaser: Screening for a particular allele can decrease the risk for abacavir hypersensitivity reactions by 60%.

Headlines: Herceptin Vials to Be Checked for Damage, FDA Warns
Teaser: Breakage and other damage may compromise sterility and pose infection risk to patient.

Headlines: FDA Advisory Members Agree AEDs Pose Suicidality Risk, Nix Black Box
Teaser: Antiepileptic drugs pose an increased risk of suicidality, but the data do not warrant a black-box warning, advisory committee members told the FDA.

Headlines: Fluoroquinolones Earn Black Box Warning for Tendon-Related Adverse Effects
Teaser: The magnitude of reported adverse events related to fluoroquinolone use necessitates stronger warnings regarding the risk for tendonitis and tendon rupture.

Headlines: Local and National Legislation Banning Phthalates and BPA Considered
Teaser: A bill has been introduced to Congress to prohibit the use of bisphenol A in all food and drink containers; the Senate is considering expanding the proposed ban to include toys and other children's products.

Headlines: Use of rhBMP in Cervical Fusion Linked to Serious Adverse Events
Teaser: Healthcare providers should use approved alternative treatments or enroll in approved clinical trials.

Headlines: CellCept Labeling Changes Reflect PML Risk
Teaser: Healthcare providers should include progressive multifocal leukoencephalopathy in the differential diagnosis of immunosuppressed patients presenting with focal neurologic symptoms.

Headlines: Probe of Erythropoiesis-Stimulating Agents
Teaser: The preliminary work suggests that erythropoietin might have an effect not only on red blood cells but on tumor blood vessels as well. It is a provocative hypothesis that is generating fervent debate.

Headlines: Diabetic Ulcer Gel Gets Black Box Warning
Teaser: An FDA safety review showed a 5-fold increased risk for cancer mortality in patients exposed to 3 or more tubes of becaplermin gel.

Headlines: Five Deaths in the UK Related to Rimonabant
Teaser: But only one of these deaths was due to psychiatric disorders (suicide), which is the major concern with this drug. Sanofi-Aventis has stressed that no causal link between any of the deaths and rimonabant has been established.

Headlines: FDA Investigates Link Between TNF Blockers and Pediatric Cancer
Teaser: Thirty cases of cancer have been reported in children and young adults receiving tumor necrosis factor blockers for arthritis, Crohn's disease, and other conditions.

Headlines: Transplant Drug Linked to Risk for Fetal Harm
Teaser: Women of childbearing age should be required to use 2 forms of birth control before, during, and after treatment with mycophenolate mofetil and mycophenolic acid.

Headlines: FDA Backpedals on Echo-Contrast Labeling
Teaser: Warnings and contraindications imposed late last year have been softened after the agency heard from the medical community.

Headlines: Etanercept Gets Black Box Warning for TB Risk
Teaser: Patients should be both screened for latent tuberculosis before initiation of etanercept therapy and monitored for infection during and after treatment.

Headlines: Enoxaparin Contaminant
Teaser: Some countries have recalled affected batches, although no increase in adverse reactions has been seen.

Headlines: Anticholinergic Drugs May Increase Cognitive Decline
Teaser: A new study finds that use of drugs with anticholinergic activity is associated with a more rapid decline in cognitive performance.

Headlines: Panel: Toughen Dermal Filler Warnings
Teaser: An FDA panel wants stronger warning labels on dermal fillers like Restylane and Juvederm injected into the face for wrinkles.

Headlines: Bevacizumab Significantly Increases VTE Risk
Teaser: The risk of venous thromboembolism was increased by 33%, compared with controls, concludes a new meta-analysis of 15 cancer trials.

Headlines: No Link Between Bisphosphonates and Atrial Fibrillation, FDA Says
Teaser: The agency is advising healthcare professionals not to alter their prescribing patterns for bisphosphonate therapy.

Headlines: Five Generic Ethex Products Recalled Because of Overdose Risk
Teaser: Oversize tablets may contain up to double the amounts of the active ingredient.

Headlines: Rimonabant Suspended in Europe
Teaser: European regulators say rimonabant's benefits no longer outweigh its risks. Its manufacturer, however, says it remains committed to the drug and hopes to provide evidence to support its reevaluation in the future.

Headlines: Postmarketing Surveillance for Biologic Agents
Teaser: Biologics are a rapidly growing class of drugs, but many of their associated safety problems are not identified until after receiving approval from regulatory agencies.

Headlines: Boxed Warning Highlights Risk for Infection With Raptiva
Teaser: Postmarketing reports indicate an increased risk for opportunistic infections in patients receiving efalizumab injection.

Headlines: Preliminary Data Suggest Spiriva Not Linked to Increased Stroke Risk
Teaser: Findings contradict recently published findings that tiotropium bromide increases the risk for mortality and/or cardiovascular events.

Headlines: High-Dose Epogen/Procrit Linked to Deaths
Teaser: Adverse events in other epoetin-alfa clinical trials should be monitored to ensure that the potential benefits outweigh the risks to patients.

Headlines: Tarceva Linked to 2 Fatal Cases of Hepatotoxicity
Teaser: Patients with hepatic impairment should be closely monitored during treatment with erlotinib.

Headlines: Particulate Matter Found in Ammonul Injection
Teaser: Filters must be used during the admixture process because particulate matter may not be visible to the naked eye.

Headlines: Company, Investigator Disagree on Reporting of Epoetin Alfa Trial
Teaser: Ortho Biotech announced that preliminary data from a trial of epoetin alfa in stroke patients show higher mortality among treated patients than those on placebo and that it had informed the FDA. The lead investigator of the trial, though, says the statement is inaccurate as it stands and that the increase in mortality was limited to patients who received both tissue plasminogen activator and epoet

Headlines: Phosphocol Linked to Risks for Malignancy and Radiation Injury
Teaser: Postmarketing cases of lymphocytic leukemia have been reported with intra-articular use; intraperintoneal use has been linked to local necrosis and fibrosis.

Headlines: Rituxan Linked to Fatal PML Case
Teaser: Clinicians are advised to consider progressive multifocal leukoencephalopathy in rituximab-treated patients presenting with new-onset neurologic manifestations.

Headlines: 20 Drugs the FDA Is Watching
Teaser: The first new quarterly report identifies adverse drug effects that are under FDA investigation.

Headlines: Patient Deaths Spark Stronger Warnings for TNF Blockers
Teaser: Patients should be monitored for signs and symptoms of fungal infection both during and after therapy.

Headlines: Effects of Sunitinib in Renal Cell Cancer Patients
Teaser: Researchers describe adverse dermatologic effects in the scrotal and inguinal areas in 5 of 40 patients taking sunitinib for renal cell carcinoma.

Headlines: Cialis, Viagra Labels to Note Amnesia
Teaser: Rare reports of transient global amnesia have been added to the Cialis and Viagra labels; the condition is already on the Levitra label.

Headlines: New PML Cases Reported With Tysabri Monotherapy
Teaser: Natalizumab monotherapy is still believed to be safer than combination treatment with other immunomodulatory agents.

Headlines: Taxanes Increase Risk for Psychologic Symptoms
Teaser: Patients who receive taxane-based chemotherapy have delayed emotional recovery and a higher rate of probable clinical depression than patients on similar regimens without taxanes.

Headlines: FDA Safety Changes: Norditropin, Rozerem, Zomig
Teaser: The FDA has approved revisions to the safety labeling for somatropin [rDNA origin] injection (Norditropin), ramelteon (Rozerem), and zolmitriptan (Zomig).

Headlines: FDA Safety Changes: Apidra, Ontak, Raptiva
Teaser: The FDA has approved revisions to the safety labeling for insulin glulisine [rDNA origin] injection (Apidra), denileukin diftitox (Ontak), and efalizumab (Raptiva).

Headlines: FDA Safety Changes: Celexa, Erbitux, ACE Inhibitors
Teaser: The FDA has approved revisions to the safety labeling for citalopram HBr tablets and oral solution, cetuximab intravenous infusion, and certain angiotensin-converting enzyme inhibitors.

Headlines: FDA Safety Changes: Clolar, Precedex, Treanda
Teaser: The FDA has approved revisions to the safety labeling for clofarabine injection (Clolar), dexmedetomidine HCl injection (Precedex), and bendamustine HCl injection (Treanda).

Headlines: FDA Warns That Tinzaparin Increases Mortality Risk in Elderly Patients
Teaser: A clinical study indicated that tinzaparin may lead to an increased risk for death in all renal-impaired elderly patients receiving tinzaparin.

Headlines: Prolonged Empiric Antibiotics May Increase Risk for NEC in Certain Infants
Teaser: In extremely-low-birth-weight infants, prolonged initial empiric antibiotics should be used with caution because they may be associated with an increased risk for necrotizing enterocolitis or death.

Headlines: AES 2008: Valproate Should Not Be Used in Women Who May Become Pregnant
Teaser: Investigators say clinicians should rethink their use of valproate in women in what some researchers are calling a practice-altering finding.

Headlines: Elderly Often Use Prescription and Nonprescription Medications Together
Teaser: A study of community-dwelling older adults showed that nearly 1 in 25 individuals were potentially at risk for a major drug-drug interaction.

Headlines: FDA and Diabetes Drugs
Teaser: The recommendation that diabetes drugs must show cardiovascular safety is included in a new guidance document issued this week by the agency and emerges after concerns have been raised about drugs in this field. More than 100 letters have been sent to drug companies informing them of the new recommendations.

Headlines: FDA Requires Warnings About Suicidality Risk With Antiepileptic Drugs
Teaser: The US Food and Drug Administration will require the manufacturers of antiepileptic drugs to add a warning to their labeling that use of the drugs increases risk for suicidal thoughts and behaviors.

Headlines: New Case of PML with Natalizumab Monotherapy
Teaser: Biogen Idec and Elan reported to the SEC that another case of PML has been seen with natalizumab therapy in a patient with MS. The case was found through surveillance, the companies note, and the patient is stable.

Headlines: Adverse Event Reporting Systems May Need Improvement
Teaser: A national survey evaluated the present status of US hospital-based adverse event reporting systems and suggested needed improvements in reporting processes.

Headlines: Oral Sodium Phosphate Products Linked to Acute Phosphate Nephropathy
Teaser: The use of oral sodium phosphate products has been tied to acute phosphate nephropathy.

Headlines: FDA Panel Urges Restrictions on 2 Asthma Drugs
Teaser: Experts urged the FDA to communicate to doctors that Serevent and Foradil inhalers should not be used alone.

Headlines: FDA Panel Asks: Are Asthma Drugs Safe?
Teaser: Serevent, Symbicort, and Foradil are the focus of a triple FDA panel meeting investigating their safety.

Headlines: Panel Disputes FDA Finding on Antiepileptics and Risk for Suicide
Teaser: The methodology of meta-analysis is flawed, a panel says, and the decision will have unfortunate consequences for patients and the future of AED clinical trials.

Headlines: CDC Provides Details on Heparin Investigation
Teaser: A new paper tells the story of how the CDC, after identifying oversulfated chondroitin as the plausible culprit contaminant, linked products containing the contaminant to the clinical symptoms of patients treated across 21 facilities in 13 states.

Headlines: More Research Urgently Needed on Off-Label Use of 14 Drugs
Teaser: A quantitative analysis identified particular concerns regarding safety of off-label use of antipsychotic and antidepressant drugs.

Headlines: FDA Investigates Genetic Link to Phenytoin Skin Reactions
Teaser: Clinicians should avoid the antiepileptic drugs phenytoin and fosphenytoin as alternatives to carbamazepine therapy in patients positive for the HLA-B*1502 allele.

Headlines: Higher Mortality, CHF With Rosiglitazone
Teaser: A retrospective analysis of Medicare beneficiaries found all-cause mortality to be increased by 15% in patients taking rosiglitazone, while congestive heart failure hospitalizations were 13% higher. Stroke and MI, however, were no different between the treatment groups.

Headlines: Boxed Warning Added to Metoclopramide-Containing Drugs
Teaser: The FDA says that a boxed warning about the risk for tardive dyskinesia during long-term or high-dose use must be added to the drug labels of metoclopramide-containing drugs.

Headlines: More Caution Needed for Warfarin Use in Chronic Kidney Disease
Teaser: A prospective study suggests that warfarin may need to be started at a lower dosage and monitored more closely in patients with moderate or severe chronic kidney disease vs the general population.

Headlines: Antiepileptic Drug Linked to Metabolic Acidosis
Teaser: The FDA recommends that healthcare professionals measure serum bicarbonate before initiating therapy and during treatment with zonisamide (Zonegran), even when symptoms are absent.

Headlines: Drug Linked to Deaths From Progressive Multifocal Leukoencephalopathy
Teaser: Three deaths from PML and a possible fourth case have been reported in patients taking the immunosuppressant drug efalizumab, according to the FDA.

Headlines: Certain Skin-Related Adverse Drug Events May Have Genetic Basis
Teaser: In the first initial data released by the Food and Drug Administration in conjunction with the International Serious Adverse Events Consortium, the genetics associated with drug-induced serious skin rashes, such as Stevens-Johnson syndrome and toxic epidermal necrolysis, are described. The data are expected to help better predict an individual's risk of developing these reactions.

Headlines: Long-Term Use of Popular Inhalers May Increase Risk for Pneumonia in COPD
Teaser: Inhaled corticosteroid use for at least 24 weeks in patients with chronic obstructive pulmonary disease was associated with a significantly increased risk for serious pneumonia but not for death.

Headlines: FDA Safety Changes: Promethazine and Codeine Oral Solution, Ranexa, Ethyol
Teaser: The FDA has approved revisions to the safety labeling for promethazine HCl and codeine phosphate oral solution, ranolazine extended-release tablets, and amifostine injection.

Headlines: FDA Safety Changes: Selzentry, Triglide, Neulasta
Teaser: The FDA has approved revisions to the safety labeling for maraviroc tablets, fenofibrate tablets, and pegfilgrastim.

Headlines: FDA Continues to Investigate Bleeding Risk for Xigris
Teaser: The Food and Drug Administration announced today that is continuing to evaluate the incidence of serious bleeding events and death in patients who receive drotrecogin alfa activated, a recombinant human activated protein C indicated for the treatment of severe sepsis.

Headlines: Clopidogrel and PPIs
Teaser: The findings support suspicions that the drug combination diminishes the beneficial effect of the antiplatelet therapy and increases the risk of future events, say researchers.

Headlines: Generics Manufacturer Suspends More Than 100 Products
Teaser: A unit of KV Pharmaceutical has stopped manufacturing and selling more than 100 products, including antianginal nitrates and calcium-channel blockers.

Headlines: FDA Safety Changes: Cordarone and Exjade
Teaser: The FDA has approved revisions to the safety labeling for amiodarone HCl tablets and deferasirox tablets for oral suspension.

Headlines: Loop Diuretic Use Linked to Higher Fracture Risk in Postmenopausal Women
Teaser: After adjustment for confounding variables, a study shows no significant association between ever-use of loop diuretics and changes in bone mineral density, falls, and fractures.

Headlines: COGENT 1 Scrapped; Sponsor Bankrupt
Teaser: The trial was testing a single-pill combination of clopidogrel and omeprazole to reduce the incidence of GI side effects.

Headlines: FDA Safety Changes: Prevacid NapraPAC 500, Prezista, Arixtra
Teaser: The FDA has approved revisions to the safety labeling for lansoprazole delayed-release capsules and naproxen tablet kit, darunavir tablets, and fondaparinux sodium injection.

Headlines: FDA Safety Changes: Atrovent and Atripla
Teaser: The FDA has approved revisions to the safety labeling for ipratropium Br nasal spray (Atrovent) and for efavirenz/emtricitabine/tenofovir disoproxil fumarate tablets (Atripla).

Headlines: Tainted Weight Loss Drugs
Teaser: The expanded list ups the number of contaminated products from 28 to 69. Many of these "natural" or "herbal" products contained sibutramine, phenolphthalein, and even rimonabant.

Headlines: WSJ on Rosiglitazone
Teaser: A report by the Wall Street Journal reveals that GlaxoSmithKline had similar concerns about rosiglitazone as the researchers who first raised alarms about the diabetes drug.

Headlines: FDA Pilot Program
Teaser: The FDA is to launch a pilot program to help promote the safety of drugs and active pharmaceutical ingredients produced outside the US, with around 100 voluntary applicants to be selected for participation.

Headlines: Sidney Wolfe Joins FDA Safety Committee: WSJ
Teaser: Dr Sidney Wolfe was appointed to the FDA Safety and Risk Managemnet Committee in August 2008, according to the WSJ.

Headlines: Online System May Help Identify Patterns of Adverse Surgical Events
Teaser: A study suggests that a user-friendly, Web-based system to track morbidity, mortality, and near-misses should be used by surgery departments to identify quality improvement opportunities.

Headlines: Zoledronic Acid Infusion Effective for Bone Loss Linked With Glucocorticoid Use
Teaser: In a randomized trial, a single 5-mg intravenous infusion of zoledronic acid was more acceptable to patients vs 5 mg of oral risedronate daily to prevent and treat glucocorticoid-related bone loss.

Headlines: Tadalafil or Sildenafil Not Linked to Visual Effects With 6 Months of Daily Use
Teaser: In a randomized trial of medications for erectile dysfunction, no abnormalities in electroretinography or visual function and no treatment-related findings suggestive of drug toxicity were observed.

Headlines: FDA Safety Changes: Toprol XL, Revlimid, Fludara
Teaser: The FDA has approved safety labeling revisions for metoprolol succinate extended-release tablets (Toprol-XL), lenalidomide (Revlimid), and fludarabine phosphate intravenous infusion (Fludara).

Headlines: Combined Oral Contraceptive Use Linked to Risk for Systemic Lupus Erythematosus
Teaser: Ceftriaxone can now be administered concomitantly with calcium-containing products in patients older than 28 days, updating a previous recommendation contraindicating this combination in all age groups.

Headlines: Ceftriaxone Can Be Administered With Calcium-Containing Products in Certain Patients
Teaser: The new labeling changes for lopinavir/ritonavir include warnings and precautions regarding QT/QTC interval and PR interval prolongation.

Headlines: FDA Issues Safety Labeling Changes for Kaletra
Teaser: FDA Safety Changes: Luvox/Luvox CR, Altace, Capozide, Monopril/Monopril HCT, Furadantin

Headlines: FDA Safety Changes: Luvox/Luvox CR, Altace, Capozide, Monopril/Monopril HCT, Furadantin
Teaser: The agency said that saxagliptin does not pose a cardiovascular risk to diabetes patients, effectively recommending the drug for approval, while liraglutide was turned away by the advisory panel because of an increased risk of cancer observed in animal studies.

Headlines: Saxagliptin Gets Favorable FDA Panel Review, While Liragutide Not Recommended for Approval
Teaser: The FDA has approved revisions to the safety labeling for bosentan tablets, esomeprazole injection, esomeprazole magnesium delayed-release capsules and oral suspension, and tigecycline injection.

Headlines: FDA Safety Changes: Tracleer, Nexium, Nexium IV, Tygacil
Teaser: Over a four-year period, the rates of cancer-associated adverse events and the proportion of all reported adverse events related to cancer were less than event rates observed with other potent cholesterol-lowering medications.

Headlines: FDA Postmarketing Surveillance Data Show No Cancer Risk With Ezetimibe
Teaser: The FDA has approved revisions to the safety labeling for various selective serotonin and serotonin-norepinephrine reuptake inhibitors; multiple electrolytes injection, type 1; and telbivudine.

Headlines: FDA Safety Changes: Antidepressants, Plasma-Lyte 148, Tyzeka
Teaser: Watson Pharmaceuticals has recalled one lot of propafenone HCl 250 mg packed in 100-count bottles it said was shipped to customers between October 15, 2008 and November 26, 2008.

Headlines: Watson Pharma Recalls One Lot of Propafenone 225 mg
Teaser: Insulin pens and cartridges should not be used in multiple patients because of the risk for transmission of blood-borne pathogens.

Headlines: FDA Warns Against Sharing Single-Use Insulin Pens, Cartridges
Teaser: The FDA has approved revisions to the safety labeling for hydrocodone bitartrate and homatropine methylbromide, benazepril, benazepril plus hydrochlorothiazide, and cefdinir.

Headlines: FDA Safety Changes: Hycodan, Lotensin, Lotensin HCT, Omnicef
Teaser: The FDA has approved revisions to the safety labeling for celecoxib capsules (Celebrex), indinavir sulfate tablets (Crixivan), and isoniazid plus pyrazinamide and rifampin tablets (Rifater).

Headlines: FDA Safety Changes: Celebrex, Crixivan, Rifater
Teaser: The FDA has approved revisions to the safety labeling for anastrozole tablets (Arimidex), carvedilol tablets and extended-release tablets (Coreg, Coreg CR), and alglucosidase alfa injection (Myozyme).

Headlines: FDA Safety Changes: Arimidex, Coreg/Coreg CR, Myozyme
Teaser: A study shows that antibiotic use in the first year of life is linked to a small risk for the development of asthma and that the risk increases with the number of courses of antibiotics prescribed.

Headlines: Antibiotic Use in First Year of Life Linked to Risk of Developing Asthma
Teaser: Certain transdermal patches containing even small traces of aluminum or other metals in the adhesive backing can cause skin burns if worn during magnetic resonance imaging.

Headlines: Medicated Patch Can Cause Burns During MRI, FDA Warns
Teaser: The FDA has approved revisions to the safety labeling for ipratropium bromide and albuterol sulfate inhalation aerosol, quinine sulfate capsules, and sacrosidase oral solution.

Headlines: FDA Safety Changes: Exjade and Extraneal
Teaser: The FDA has approved safety labeling revisions for deferasirox tablets for oral suspension (Exjade) and icodextrin peritoneal dialysis solution (Extraneal).

Headlines: Propylthiouracil Linked With Risk for Serious Liver Damage, Death
Teaser: The FDA has issued a safety alert about the risk for serious liver damage, including liver failure, or death with propylthiouracil compared with methimazole.

Headlines: Proton-Pump Inhibitors Increase Risk for Hospital-Acquired Pneumonia
Teaser: In a large, prospective, hospital-based pharmacoepidemiologic cohort, acid suppressive medication use was associated with 30% increased odds of hospital-acquired pneumonia.

Headlines: FDA Safety Changes: Remicade and Doribax
Teaser: The FDA has approved safety labeling revisions for infliximab intravenous infusion (Remicade) and doripenem intravenous infusion (Doribax).

Headlines: FDA Safety Changes: Advair Diskus, Orap, Rocephin
Teaser: The FDA has approved safety labeling revisions for fluticasone propionate and salmeterol xinafoate inhalation powder, pimozide tablets, and ceftriaxone sodium injection.

Headlines: Cancer Drug Erases Man's Fingerprints
Teaser: A traveler was temporarily denied entry into the U.S. because of a side effect of Xeloda.

Headlines: Postdischarge Adverse Events Are Common
Teaser: The timing and type of follow-up of older discharged patients might need to change, according to a new study.

Headlines: Cholinesterase Inhibitors Linked to Serious Adverse Events in Older Adults With Dementia
Teaser: A population-based cohort study suggests that the risks for syncope, bradycardia, pacemaker insertion, and hip fracture must be weighed carefully against the generally modest benefits of cholinesterase inhibitors.

Headlines: Tamsulosin Use Linked to Serious Ophthalmic Adverse Events After Cataract Surgery
Teaser: Use of tamsulosin within 14 days of cataract surgery, but not of other alpha-blocker medications used to treat benign prostatic hyperplasia, was significantly associated with serious postoperative ophthalmic adverse events.

Headlines: FDA Safety Changes: Zithromax, Frova, Lexiscan
Teaser: The FDA has approved safety labeling revisions for azithromycin tablets and oral suspension (Zithromax), frovatriptan succinate tablets (Frova), and regadenoson injection (Lexiscan).

Headlines: Merck Defense Begins in Oz
Teaser: Lawyers for Merck began their defense this week in the rofecoxib class-action lawsuit that is ongoing in Australia. They will have to counter many astonishing allegations that have been made in court in Melbourne over the past few weeks.

Headlines: FDA Safety Changes: Visicol, OsmoPrep, DiaBeta, Raptiva
Teaser: The FDA has approved safety labeling revisions for sodium phosphate monobasic monohydrate and sodium phosphate dibasic anhydrous tablets (Visicol and OsmoPrep), glyburide tablets (DiaBeta), and efalizumab subcutaneous injection (Raptiva).

Headlines: FDA Safety Changes: Axert, Tarka, Macrobid, Macrodantin
Teaser: The FDA has approved safety labeling revisions for almotriptan malate tablets (Axert), verapamil HCl/trandolapril tablets (Tarka), and nitrofurantoin monohydrate/macrocrystals capsules (Macrobid and Macrodantin).

Headlines: Hydroxycut Recall Due to Liver Injuries
Teaser: FDA says people should stop using the diet products immediately.

Headlines: Antibiotic Use in Childhood Not Linked to Type 1 Diabetes
Teaser: Contrary to what several other studies have shown, the results of a nationwide study of Danish children suggest that antibiotic use does not affect the development of type 1 diabetes.

Headlines: FDA Safety Changes: Sporanox and Novothyrox
Teaser: The FDA has approved safety labeling revisions for itraconazole (Sporanox) and levothyroxine sodium tablets (Novothyrox).

Headlines: FDA Safety Changes: Epzicom, Trizivir, Tracleer
Teaser: The FDA has approved safety labeling revisions for abacavir sulfate and lamivudine tablets (Epzicom), abacavir plus lamivudine and zidovudine tablets (Trizivir), and bosentan tablets (Tracleer).

Headlines: New Electronic Medication Intervention Appears to Decrease Potential Adverse Drug Events
Teaser: A computerized medication reconciliation tool and process redesign was associated with a decrease in unintentional medication discrepancies with potential for patient harm.

Headlines: FDA Safety Changes: Zantac, Zithromax, Noxafil
Teaser: The FDA has approved safety labeling revisions for ranitidine HCl, azithromycin, and posaconazole.

Headlines: FDA Safety Changes: Comtan, Stalevo, Tasmar, Symmetrel, Xenical, Casodex
Teaser: The FDA has approved safety labeling revisions for entacapone tablets, levodopa/carbidopa/entacapone tablets, tolcapone tablets, amantadine HCl syrup and tablets, orlistat, and bicalutamide.

Headlines: FDA Safety Changes: Chantix, DiaBeta, Aralen
Teaser: The FDA has approved safety labeling revisions for varenicline tartrate tablets (Chantix), glyburide tablets (DiaBeta), and chloroquine phosphate tablets (Aralen).

Headlines: FDA Safety Changes: Strattera, Aptivus, CellCept
Teaser: The FDA has approved safety labeling revisions for atomoxetine HCl capsules; tipranavir capsules and oral solution; and mycophenolate mofetil capsules, tablets, injection, and oral suspension.

Headlines: FDA Updates Warnings for TNF Blockers and Cancer Risk
Teaser: The FDA is requiring stronger warnings regarding the risk for cancer associated with tumor necrosis factor blockers.

Headlines: FDA Safety Changes: Rocephin, Amaryl, Prandin
Teaser: The FDA has approved safety labeling revisions for ceftriaxone sodium injection (Rocephin), glimepiride tablets (Amaryl), and repaglinide tablets (Prandin).

Headlines: FDA Safety Changes: Aristospan, Videx/Videx EC, Coreg/Coreg ER
Teaser: The FDA has approved safety labeling revisions for triamcinolone hexacetonide, didanosine oral solution and delayed-release capsules, carvedilol tablets, and carvedilol extended-release tablets.

Headlines: Benefits of Intensive Methotrexate Treatment Outweigh Adverse Events in Early Rheumatoid Arthritis
Teaser: A study of methotrexate in patients with rheumatoid arthritis shows a higher occurrence of adverse events but better clinical efficacy with intensive treatment vs conventional treatment with the drug.

Headlines: Methylphenidate, Amphetamines Show Cardiac Risks in Children With ADHD
Teaser: In a retrospective study, use of methylphenidate and amphetamines shows a similar risk for cardiac emergency department visits in children and adolescents with attention-deficit/hyperactivity disorder.

Headlines: Omalizumab May Be Linked to Cardiovascular Adverse Events
Teaser: Results of an interim analysis suggest that omalizumab (Xolair) may be associated with a disproportionate increase in the incidence of certain cardiovascular adverse events.

Headlines: FDA Safety Changes: Reglan and Prometrium
Teaser: The FDA has approved safety labeling revisions for metoclopramide tablets, orally disintegrating tablets, and injection (Reglan); and progesterone capsules (Prometrium).

Headlines: Drug-Induced Acute Liver Failure Very Rare, but Can Be Fatal
Teaser: A study shows that acetaminophen is the most common cause of drug-induced acute liver failure, accounting for nearly half of cases in adults, but other drugs can also be responsible.

Headlines: Methylphenidate Well Tolerated by Childhood Cancer Survivors
Teaser: In childhood cancer survivors, overall tolerability of methylphenidate was good, but a subgroup was at increased risk for adverse effects that may need close monitoring or prescription of a lower dose.

Headlines: Famotidine Prevents Peptic Ulcers, Esophagitis in Patients Taking Aspirin
Teaser: Famotidine is effective in preventing gastric and duodenal ulcers, and erosive esophagitis in patients taking low-dose aspirin for vascular protection, a phase 3 study reveals.

Headlines: Ketamine May Be Useful for Intubation in Critically Ill Patients
Teaser: A randomized controlled, single-blind trial shows that ketamine is a safe, valuable alternative to conventional etomidate to use as a sedative during intubation in critically ill patients.

Headlines: Insulin Glargine Potentially Associated With Increased Cancer Risk
Teaser: The increased risk has been seen in 3 of 4 observational studies, but these findings warrant further follow-up studies to confirm an association, according to the FDA.

Headlines: Chantix and Zyban to Receive Boxed Warnings for Serious Neuropsychiatric Symptoms
Teaser: Varenicline and bupropion are receiving boxed warnings regarding the risks for changes in behavior, hostility, agitation, depressed mood, suicidal thoughts and behavior, and attempted suicide.

Headlines: FDA Safety Changes: Prevpac, Arava, Treanda
Teaser: The FDA has approved safety labeling revisions for a prepackaged regimen of lansoprazole, amoxicillin, and clarithromycin tablets; leflunomide tablets; and bendamustine HCl intravenous infusion.

Headlines: Contrast-Induced Nephropathy May Be Linked to Long-Term Adverse Events
Teaser: After adjustment for baseline comorbidities and risk factors, the  incidence rate ratio for adverse events was twice as high in those with CIN defined stringently.

Headlines: FDA Safety Changes: Kerlone, Meridia, Stromectol
Teaser: The FDA has approved safety labeling revisions for betaxolol HCl tablets (Kerlone), sibutramine HCl monohydrate capsules (Meridia), and ivermectin tablets (Stromectol).

Headlines: FDA Safety Changes: Minipress, Letairis, Coly-Mycin M Parenteral
Teaser: The FDA has approved safety labeling revisions for prazosin HCl capsules (Minipress), ambrisentan tablets (Letairis), and colistimethate injection (Coly-Mycin M Parenteral).

Headlines: FDA Safety Changes: Sarafem, Mavik, Cordarone
Teaser: The FDA has approved safety labeling revisions for deferasirox tablets for fluoxetine HCl (Sarafem tablets), trandolapril (Mavik tablets), and amiodarone HCl (Cordarone tablets).

Headlines: Neuron 070 Delivery Catheters Recalled Due to Kinking
Teaser: Delivery catheters are being voluntarily recalled by their manufacturer because of kinking and/or ovalization of the catheter lumen; 4 injuries possibly associated with this defect have been reported.

Headlines: FDA Issues Risk Communication Plan for Providing Public Health Information
Teaser: A new FDA plan issued today outlines how information on FDA-regulated products will be disseminated to the public.

Headlines: FDA Safety Changes: Zyprexa, Geodon, Lariam, Merrem IV, Primaxin
Teaser: The FDA has approved safety labeling revisions for olanzapine, ziprasidone, mefloquine HCl tablets, meropenem, and imipenem/cilastatin.

Headlines: New Study Helps to Characterize Heparin-Induced Skin Lesions
Teaser: A new prospective study has found the incidence of heparin-induced skin lesions to be around 7.5%. Women, the obese, and those on heparin therapy for longest are most at risk.

Headlines: Hormone Replacement Therapy Linked to Risk for Death From Lung Cancer
Teaser: In an analysis of data from the Women's Health Initiative, hormone replacement therapy with use of estrogen and progestin was associated with increased risk for death from lung cancer.

Headlines: Septic Shock from Surgical Mesh for Pelvic Organ Prolapse
Teaser: The case of a 61-year old woman presenting with septic shock 6 weeks after transvaginal placement of polypropylene mesh for pelvic organ prolapse highlights problems with FDA notification.

Headlines: FDA Issues Early Communication Regarding Deferasirox Safety in MDS
Teaser: Patients receiving deferasirox who have myelodysplastic syndrome may be at greater risk for adverse events such as kidney failure, gastrointestinal hemorrhage, and fatalities.

Headlines: Sitagliptin Linked to Acute Pancreatitis, FDA Warns
Teaser: The FDA is revising prescribing information for sitagliptin (Januvia) and sitagliptin/metformin (Janumet) after cases of acute pancreatitis, some severe, surfaced in postmarketing reports.

Headlines: Potential Dosing Errors With Oseltamivir in Children
Teaser: US clinicians usually prescribe liquid medicines in milliliters (mL) or teaspoons, but Tamiflu is dosed in milligrams (mg), and the dispenser is marked only in 30, 45, and 60 mg.

Headlines: Natalizumab Associated With Ongoing Cases of PML
Teaser: Rare but ongoing cases of PML continue to be associated with the use of natalizumab, according to the FDA.

Headlines: FDA Safety Changes: Metronidazole Injection, DexFerrum, INFeD, Tasigna
Teaser: The FDA has approved safety labeling revisions for metronidazole injection, iron dextran injection (DexFerrum and INFeD), and nilotinib HCl monohydrate capsules (Tasigna).

Headlines: FDA Adds Boxed Warning to Injectable Promethazine
Teaser: Intravenous administration of promethazine can cause severe tissue injury, including gangrene, requiring fasciotomy, skin graft, and/or amputation, according to the FDA.

Headlines: Depot Medroxyprogesterone Acetate and Fracture Risk in Young Women
Teaser: Prolonged depot medroxyprogesterone acetate contraceptive use is associated with an increased risk for fractures in women, but socioeconomic confounders might be clouding the findings.

Headlines: Budesonide for 12 Months Not Linked to Pneumonia  Risk in COPD Patients
Teaser: Budesonide treatment for 12 months did not increase the risk for pneumonia in patients with chronic obstructive pulmonary disease during that time and was safe for clinical use in such patients.

Headlines: FDA Safety Changes: Actonel, Gardasil, Myfortic
Teaser: The FDA has approved safety labeling revisions for risedronate sodium tablets, human papillomavirus quadrivalent [recombinant] vaccine, and mycophenolic acid delayed-release tablets.

Headlines: Hormonal Therapy for Breast Cancer May Affect Contralateral Cancer Risk
Teaser: Long-term tamoxifen use was linked to a lower risk for contralateral estrogen receptor–positive breast cancer but a 4.4-fold increased risk for contralateral estrogen receptor–negative breast cancer.

Headlines: Q&As on Cancer Risk With TNF Blockers in Children
Teaser: The FDA announced yesterday it has posted supplemental Q&As on the increased risk for lymphoma and other cancers in children and adolescents receiving the tumor necrosis factor (TNF) blockers infliximab (Remicade), adalimumab (Humira), certolizumab (Cimzia), etanercept (Enbrel), and golimumab (Simponi).

Headlines: FDA Revises Warning for Etravirine
Teaser: The FDA has issued an alert to warn of severe skin reactions and possible life-threatening adverse events in patients who use etravirine.

Headlines: FDA to Investigate Liver-Related Adverse Events Seen With Orlistat
Teaser: The FDA has warned healthcare professionals about the potential for liver-related adverse events with the weight-loss drug orlistat.

Headlines: Accusure Insulin Syringes Voluntarily Recalled
Teaser: Accusure insulin syringes distributed nationwide from January 2007 through June 2008 are undergoing voluntary recall because of the detachment of needles from the syringes.

Headlines: Medroxyprogesterone Helpful for Hot Flushes in Men Receiving Hormone Therapy
Teaser: In a randomized trial, medroxyprogesterone was the best treatment of hot flushes in men undergoing hormone therapy for prostate cancer.

Headlines: Potential Benefits of Shock Wave Lithotripsy May Outweigh Risks
Teaser: A white paper from the American Urological Association states that the potential benefits of shock wave lithotripsy outweigh the foreseeable risks.

Headlines: Acetaminophen Use During Pregnancy May Not Increase Asthma Risk in Offspring
Teaser: In a prospective study, acetaminophen use during pregnancy was not associated with an increased risk for asthma in the children.

Headlines: Patients and Doctors Differ When Reporting Adverse Events
Teaser: Although clinician and patient reporting of treatment-related adverse effects differ from each another, together they are complementary and provide a more complete picture.

Headlines: Certain Genzyme Products for Rare Disorders Potentially Contaminated
Teaser: Certain Genzyme products may be contaminated with stainless steel particles and other foreign matter, and the FDA recommends careful visual inspection of the products before use.

Headlines: Infusion of Local Anesthetic Linked to Postsurgical Chondrolysis
Teaser: Chondrolysis has been reported in patients receiving continuous intra-articular infusions of local anesthetics with elastomeric infusion devices to control postsurgical pain.

Headlines: FDA Safety Changes: DepoDur, Neoral, Lexiva
Teaser: The FDA has approved safety labeling revisions for morphine sulfate extended-release liposome injection, cyclosporine capsules and oral solution, and fosamprenavir calcium tablets and oral suspension.

Headlines: More Suicidal Ideation With Nortriptyline vs Escitalopram Among Men, but Both Drugs Decrease Adverse Effects
Teaser: Men treated for depression with nortriptyline had almost a 10-fold increase in suicidal thoughts at 5 weeks vs men treated with escitalopram, but both drugs effectively reduced suicidal ideation.

Headlines: FDA Safety Changes: Ultram, Ultracet, Sustiva, Kayexalate
Teaser: The FDA has approved safety labeling revisions for tramadol HCl tablets, tramadol plus acetaminophen tablets, efavirenz capsules and tablets, and sodium polystyrene sulfonate powder.

Headlines: Thiopurine for IBD Linked to Risk for Lymphoproliferative Disorders
Teaser: In a prospective observational cohort study, patients receiving thiopurines for inflammatory bowel disease had an increased risk for the development of lymphoproliferative disorders.

Headlines: Event Rates and Trial Results
Teaser: The low event rate in the RECORD trial of rosiglitazone has led some to question the validity of the results.

Headlines: Nontramadol Opioids Should Not Be Routinely Used for Osteoarthritis
Teaser: : In a review, small to moderate benefits of nontramadol opioids were outweighed by large increases in risk for adverse events; these should not be used routinely even if osteoarthritic pain is severe.

Headlines: FDA Safety Changes: Symbyax, Zoladex, INOmax
Teaser: The FDA has approved safety labeling revisions for olanzapine/fluoxetine HCl capsules (Symbyax), goserelin acetate implants (Zoladex), and nitric oxide for inhalation (INOmax).

Headlines: SLCO1B1 Gene
Teaser: Carriers of the SLCO1B1*5 allele are at a twofold increased risk of mild statin-induced side effects, and the majority of these individuals had normal creatine-kinase levels.

Headlines: Certain Prophylactic Medications Reduce Risk for Breast Cancer but May Increase Other Risks
Teaser: A systematic review shows a reduced risk for primary breast cancer but an increased risk for thromboembolic events (tamoxifen, raloxifene), endometrial cancer (tamoxifen), or stroke (tibolone).

Headlines: New-Onset Breast Tenderness During Hormone Therapy Linked to Breast Cancer Risk
Teaser: In a randomized controlled trial, new-onset breast tenderness during conjugated equine estrogens plus medroxyprogesterone therapy was associated with increased breast cancer risk.

Headlines: FDA Warns Against Use of Zanamivir With Nebulizer
Teaser: The FDA and GlaxoSmithKline are reporting the death of a person with influenza after receiving zanamivir inhalation powder (Relenza) that had been dissolved and administered with a nebulizer.

Headlines: ACEIs More Likely Than Other Antihypertensive Drugs to Cause Hyperkalemia
Teaser: However, in nondiabetic patients with hypertensive chronic kidney disease treated with angiotensin-converting enzyme inhibitors, the risk for hyperkalemia is small.

Headlines: FDA Safety Changes: Arixtra, Sulfonylureas, Tobramycin
Teaser: The FDA has approved safety labeling revisions for fondaparinux sodium, glipizide and glipizide extended-release tablets, micronized glyburide, glipizide/metformin, glyburide, and tobramycin.

Headlines: Thiazolidinediones Linked to Bone Fracture Risk
Teaser: In a UK database study, nearly one and half times as many fractures occurred when people were taking thiazolidinediones than when they were not taking these drugs, after adjustment for age.

Headlines: Antidepressants May Permanently or Reversibly Affect Fetal Brain Development
Teaser: The timing of antidepressant exposure during pregnancy may determine whether the effects on fetal brain development are permanent or reversible.

Headlines: Statin "Preconditioning" Effect Blunted by COX-2 Inhibitor in Volunteers
Teaser: The COX-2 inhibitor celecoxib completely abolished the beneficial preconditioning effect of rosuvastatin in a small mechanistic study in human volunteers.

Headlines: GlaxoSmithKline Fires Back
Teaser: In its response, the company states it has been "proactive in investigating the safety data" of rosiglitazone and is critical of the Senate report that ignores other data, including DREAM, ADOPT, and RECORD.

Headlines: Thiazolidinedione Use Linked to Increased Fracture Risk in Women
Teaser: A study shows that thiazolidinedione use is associated with an increased risk for fractures in women, particularly in those older than 65 years.

Headlines: Saquinavir and Ritonavir: Arrhythmia Risks
Teaser: Preliminary data suggest that the combination of saquinavir and ritonavir may cause prolongation of the QT and PR intervals, leading to an increased risk of torsades de pointes and heart block, respectively.

Headlines: FDA Studying 27 Drugs, Drug Classes for Potential Safety Issues
Teaser: A medication's appearance on the list does not mean physicians should stop prescribing it.

Headlines: FDA Mandates New Safety Controls for Long-Acting Beta Agonists
Teaser: Once asthma control is achieved, patients should be switched from combination corticosteroid-LABA therapy to a corticosteroid or another long-term asthma controller medication without a LABA.

Headlines: New Boxed Warning for Deferasirox
Teaser: The prescribing information for deferasirox has been updated to describe risks for kidney and liver failure and gastrointestinal hemorrhage and includes a new black box warning.

Headlines: FDA Warns of Maalox Mix-up Danger
Teaser: The agency says some consumers are confusing Maalox antacids with a product called 'Maalox Total Relief.''

Headlines: HRT With Estrogen Alone Increases Risk for Asthma Onset After Menopause
Teaser: Estrogen-only hormone replacement therapy has been found to be linked to an increased risk for the development of asthma after menopause, according to a large cohort study of postmenopausal women.

Headlines: Avandia Raises Heart-Failure Risk in RECORD Randomized Trial
Teaser: The secondary finding from the controversial trial is consistent with an interim analysis conducted several years ago.

Headlines: Deaths From Methadone Overdose Disproportionate to Number of Prescriptions
Teaser: A national review of opioid-related deaths finds that methadone plays a larger role than other drugs.

Headlines: PML Risk Increases With Repeated Natalizumab Infusions: FDA
Teaser: The Food and Drug Administration released new safety information gleaned from the 31 cases of PML to date, but still conclude the clinical benefit for patients outweighs the risks.

Headlines: Didanosine Associated With Noncirrhotic Portal Hypertension
Teaser: Postmarketing reports of noncirrhotic portal hypertension, including 4 deaths, have resulted in an update of the didanosine label.

Headlines: Quitting Smoking, Increased Calcium May Lower BMD Loss Linked to DMPA Use
Teaser: Quitting smoking and increasing calcium intake may reduce the risk for higher bone mineral density loss associated with use of depot medroxyprogesterone acetate.

Headlines: Recommendations for Prescribing NSAIDs in the Primary Care Setting
Teaser: A review article provides recommendations for prescribing nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs in the primary care setting.

Headlines: Intravitreal Triamcinolone May Slow Diabetic Retinopathy Progression
Teaser: Because adverse effects include cataract formation and glaucoma, the investigators did not recommend this treatment merely to reduce progression of proliferative diabetic retinopathy.

Headlines: Low-Dose Aspirin During Pregnancy Has No Adverse Impact on Preterm Infants
Teaser: Aspirin may actually reduce neurobehavioral issues, according to a recent study.

Headlines: High-Dose Inhaled Steroids for Asthma May Increase Risk of Fetal Malformations
Teaser: The congenital malformation rate for pregnant women who used more than 1000 micrograms per day was much higher than that seen in nonusers and in users of no more than 1000 micrograms per day.

Headlines: Suicide Warning on Epilepsy Drugs Intensifies Clinical Responsibility
Teaser: New warnings on antiepileptic drugs unambiguously state the need to screen for psychiatric disorders and will have medical-legal implications for clinicians.

Headlines: FDA Safety Changes: Lotrel
Teaser: The FDA has approved revisions to the safety labeling for amlodipine besylate plus benazepril HCl capsules.

Headlines: Medication Side Effects in Depressed Outpatients Often Go Undetected
Teaser: New research shows clinicians only pick up a fraction of the side effects related to antidepressant medications, a finding that highlights the need for better monitoring experts say.

Headlines: FDA Safety Changes: Caduet
Teaser: The FDA has approved revisions to the safety labeling for amlodipine besylate plus atorvastatin calcium tablets.

Headlines: Discharge Clopidogrel Delay ups Events
Teaser: One in six patients do not immediately fill their initial prescription for clopidogrel after hospital discharge, and such a delay is associated with an increased risk of adverse outcomes, a new study shows.

Headlines: Similar Adverse Effects for Epilepsy Patients on Monotherapy or Polytherapy
Teaser: A new study suggests fear of increased toxicity with multiple drugs may not be warranted.

Headlines: FDA Adds Boxed Warning to Propylthiouracil
Teaser: The new warning includes a postmarketing data review of cases of severe liver injury and acute liver   failure, some fatal, as well as information on whether to use the drug in pregnancy.

Headlines: Common UTI Antibiotic Risky in Warfarin Setting
Teaser: Urinary-tract infections are one of the most common infections in older patients taking warfarin; now new research shows that the most commonly used antibiotic may quadruple the risk of upper-GI bleeding.

Headlines: FDA Tightens Approval Process for Radiotherapy Devices
Teaser: The agency continues its war against equipment problems and operator errors that result in radiation overdoses.

Headlines: Flu Shot Without Skin Testing May Be Safe for Egg-Allergic Patients
Teaser: A study suggests that patients without anaphylaxis to egg may safely receive the influenza vaccine in a 2-dose, graded fashion without a vaccine skin test.

Headlines: Hormone Therapy for Menopause Reviewed
Teaser: A review states that women must be informed of benefits and risks of all treatment options and should receive individualized care for menopausal symptoms.

Headlines: Antepartum Antiviral Treatment of H1N1 Influenza Not Linked to Adverse Outcomes
Teaser: In a retrospective cohort study, there was no evidence of an association between antepartum antiviral exposure and adverse maternal or neonatal outcomes.

Headlines: Antipsychotic Drugs May Boost Pneumonia Risk in Elderly Outpatients
Teaser: A case-control study finds the association was dose dependent, occurred with both atypical and typical antipsychotics, and appeared to be most pronounced during the first week of treatment.

Headlines: FDA Reviewing Data on Possible Increased Prostate Cancer Risk With Stalevo in PD
Teaser: The agency stresses their review is ongoing and no new conclusions or recommendations are being made at this time.

Headlines: Overall Mortality in Type 2 Diabetes May Be Similar With Some Sulfonylureas
Teaser: Risk for overall mortality was similar in patients with type 2 diabetes receiving glipizide, glyburide, or glimepiride monotherapy, but glimepiride was preferred in those with coronary artery disease.

Headlines: Femur Fractures Rare With Bisphosphonate Use
Teaser: In an analysis of 3 trials, fractures of the subtrochanteric or diaphyseal femur were very rare, even in women treated with bisphosphonates for up to 10 years.

Headlines: PPIs May Help Reduce Hospitalizations for Gastroduodenal Bleeding
Teaser: Concurrent use of proton pump inhibitors in patients with serious coronary heart disease treated with clopidogrel was associated with fewer hospitalizations for gastroduodenal bleeding.

Headlines: High-Dose Simvastatin Associated With Increased Risk for Myopathy, FDA Warns
Teaser: A simvastatin dose of 80 mg is associated with an increased risk for myopathy compared with lower doses and other statins, according to an FDA review of clinical trial and other data.

Headlines: Oral Contraception May Not Increase Long-Term Mortality Rate
Teaser: In a large UK cohort, oral contraception was not associated with an increased long-term risk for death but was actually associated with a net benefit.

Headlines: Norepinephrine and Dopamine in Treatment of Shock
Teaser: Although there was no significant difference in death rates between patients treated with dopamine and those treated with norepinephrine, dopamine was linked with twice as many adverse events.

Headlines: Regular Analgesic Use May Increase Risk for Hearing Loss
Teaser: Regular use of aspirin, acetaminophen, and nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs may increase the risk for hearing loss in men, particularly those younger than 60 years.

Headlines: High-Dose B Vitamin Therapy May Not Be Helpful in Diabetic Nephropathy
Teaser: In a randomized trial in diabetic nephropathy, high doses of B vitamins vs placebo resulted in a greater decrease in glomerular filtration rate and an increase in vascular events.

Headlines: FDA Warns Against Use of 3 Recalled IV Medications
Teaser: The agency's announcement about the potential contamination risks for metronidazole, ciprofloxacin, and ondansetron follows a recall of metronidazole from Sagent Pharmaceuticals.

Headlines: FDA Adds Risk for Severe Liver Injury to Orlistat Label
Teaser: The agency notes, however, that it has not yet established a cause-and-effect relationship between orlistat use and liver damage.

Headlines: FDA Warns of Suicide Risk for Tramadol
Teaser: The agency also is advising physicians that the opioid may be sought by patients with drug abuse and addiction problems or those with criminal diversion in mind.

Headlines: Proton Pump Inhibitors May Increase Fracture Risk, FDA Warns
Teaser: Physicians should consider whether a lower dose or a shorter duration of PPI therapy would adequately treat gastroesophageal reflux disease and other indicated conditions.

Headlines: FDA and NIH Launch Safety Reporting Web Site
Teaser: The new Safety Reporting Portal will deal with food safety, while MedWatch will remain focused on drugs and devices; the 2 Web sites will eventually merge.

Headlines: Long-Term Metformin Treatment Linked to Vitamin B12 Deficiency
Teaser: Long-term treatment with metformin increased the risk for vitamin B12 deficiency, which may be preventable, and increased homocysteine concentrations in patients with type 2 diabetes.

Headlines: Dermatologic Use of Retinoid Drugs Not Linked to Increased Fracture Risk
Teaser: A case-control study shows that patients treated for acne, psoriasis, or another skin condition with vitamin A analogues are not at increased risk for fracture.

Headlines: Tapentadol Sometimes Better Tolerated, But Opioids Still First Line
Teaser: A new post hoc analysis of 1-year safety data for tapentadol extended release in low back pain or osteoarthritis shows that the drug has a good safety profile.

Headlines: Hyaluronidase Product Recalled Because of Contamination
Teaser: A voluntary recall has been issued for all lots of Baxter's hyaluronidase human injection because of the presence of particulate matter.

Headlines: Sagent Pharmaceuticals Recalls Metronidazole Injection
Teaser: The voluntary nationwide recall of the antibiotic follows the discovery of 2 lots that were not sterile.

Headlines: Promacta Study Halted Due to Increased Risk for Portal Venous Thrombosis in Liver Disease Patients
Teaser: In the ELEVATE study, 4% of patients receiving eltrombopag and 1% of those receiving placebo developed portal venous thrombosis.

Headlines: FDA: Don't Swallow Benadryl Gel
Teaser: The agency warns of serious side effects in people who mistakenly swallow Benadryl Extra Strength Itch Stopping Gel.

Headlines: High-Dose PPIs May Be No More Effective Than Lower Doses for Bleeding Peptic Ulcer
Teaser: Compared with non-high-dose proton pump inhibitors, high doses did not further reduce rates of rebleeding, surgical intervention, or mortality after endoscopic treatment of bleeding peptic ulcer.

Headlines: PPI Use Not Linked With Hip Fractures, but Modestly With Other Types of Fractures
Teaser: In postmenopausal women, use of proton pump inhibitors was, however, modestly associated with clinical spine fractures, forearm or wrist fractures, and total fractures.

Headlines: Proton Pump Inhibitor Use Linked to Clostridium Difficile Infection
Teaser: A study shows a 74% increase in Clostridium difficile infection with daily use of proton pump inhibitors; a second study shows a 42% increased risk for recurrence with proton pump inhibitors.

Headlines: Management of Serotonin Syndrome Reviewed
Teaser: A review for family physicians describes prevention, diagnosis, and management of serotonin syndrome.

Headlines: Naltrexone Extended-Release Prescribing Information Strengthened
Teaser: Naltrexone extended-release injectable suspension has been associated with injection-site reactions based on postmarketing data; the prescribing information has been updated to reflect these data.

Headlines: Long-Term Pulmonary Problems After HSCT for Leukemia
Teaser: Hematopoietic stem cell transplantation (HSCT) often cures leukemia, but the grueling treatment can have a long-term adverse effect on the lungs.

Headlines: Risk for Low-Dose Aspirin-Associated Peptic Ulcer Higher in Elderly Women
Teaser: A study shows sex differences in the clinical features and risk factors for low-dose aspirin-associated peptic ulcer.

Headlines: Coumadin Samples Recalled in US
Teaser: BMS has voluntarily recalled a number of blister packs of Coumadin 1 mg provided as samples in the US, because they may not contain the right amount of an additive, isopropanol. There is little clinical risk from this situation, the company says.

Headlines: Iron Dextran Has Highest Adverse Effects Rate of All IV Iron Products
Teaser: Reported rates of adverse effects from iron dextran in Europe and North America over a 6-year period were much higher than for other intravenous (IV) iron products.

Headlines: Psychotropic Medications Linked to Serious Adverse Drug Reactions in Children
Teaser: Psychotropic medications were associated with almost 10% of the adverse drug reactions reported in all children in Denmark (from the age of birth to 17 years) between the years 1998 and 2007.

Headlines: 13 Drugs on Latest FDA List for Safety Monitoring
Teaser: Physicians should not stop prescribing these medications because the agency has yet to establish a causal relationship with the health risks in question.

Headlines: Increased CV Events Halts Testosterone Trial in Older Men
Teaser: A study to assess testosterone treatment in men 65 years and older who have limitations in mobility has been stopped prematurely because of an increased risk for cardiovascular adverse events.

Headlines: Hip Fractures Linked to Thiazolidinedione Use Higher Than Expected in Men
Teaser: Fractures associated with the use of rosiglitazone and pioglitazone occur in both women and men; however, middle-aged men have a 2-fold increased risk for hip fracture from thiazolidinedione use.

Headlines: Endocrine Society Issues Position Statement on Menopausal Hormone Therapy
Teaser: A new Endocrine Society scientific statement evaluates benefits and risks for postmenopausal hormone replacement therapy, now known as menopausal hormone therapy.

Headlines: Vaginal Isosorbide Mononitrate Does Not Decrease Time to Vaginal Delivery
Teaser: The addition of vaginal isosorbide mononitrate to oral misoprostol for cervical ripening and labor induction did not reduce time to vaginal delivery and was associated with a greater incidence of headache.

Headlines: Digoxin Use Linked to Mortality in End-Stage Renal Disease
Teaser: In a retrospective cohort, digoxin use in patients receiving hemodialysis was associated with increased mortality rates, especially among patients with low predialysis potassium levels.

Headlines: SSRIs, Amantadine May Affect Vision in Elderly
Teaser: SSRI antidepressants and amantadine have been linked to cataracts and corneal damage, respectively.

Headlines: FDA Committee Votes in Favor of Current Safety Monitoring for Most Drugs
Teaser: The committee to the FDA did not have changes to safety monitoring for any of the drugs evaluated except for desflurane.

Headlines: Gemtuzumab Voluntarily Withdrawn From US Market
Teaser: Based on discussions with the FDA, Pfizer has announced a voluntary withdrawal of gemtuzumab in the United States. Reasons cited are lack of benefit and safety concerns.

Headlines: EPINEPHrine Shortage May Result in Dangerous Medication Errors
Teaser: A shortage of EPINEPHrine prefilled syringes may cause serious medication errors, with 1 death reported from an overdose of EPINEPHrine.

Headlines: Selective COX-2 Inhibitors Cause Less GI Irritation Than NSAID Plus PPI
Teaser: A selective COX-2 inhibitor provides more gastrointestinal (GI) safety than a nonselective nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID) plus a proton pump inhibitor (PPI) in patients with arthritis.

Headlines: Cardiotoxicity Echo Study
Teaser: Myocardial longitudinal strain and cardiac troponin plasma concentrations may help identify patients in whom anthracyclines and trastuzumab are cardiotoxic.

Headlines: FDA Conducts Safety Review of Antihypertensive ARB Olmesartan
Teaser: There were cautionary signals in two placebo-controlled hypertension trials; still, the agency says, it believes the benefits of the drug, marketed by Daiichi Sankyo as Benicar, "outweigh its potential risks."

Headlines: ARBs, Primarily Telmisartan, Linked to 25% Increased Risk of Lung Cancer
Teaser: Angiotensin-receptor blockers have been associated with a modest increased risk of developing cancer in a new meta-analysis. Specifically, there was a significant 25% increased risk of lung cancer with these agents. The results, while concerning, must be considered preliminary, say the researchers, who call for the FDA to further examine the issue.

Headlines: Pfizer Slow to Share Lipitor Adverse Event Reports With FDA
Teaser: The 12-page letter documents increasing numbers of adverse-event reports that are not being shared with the FDA within the stipulated 15-day window, including adverse reactions to the company's blockbuster statin, Lipitor.

Headlines: Valproic Acid in Pregnancy Linked to Several Congenital Malformations
Teaser: A large Swedish observational study confirms link to spina bifida and 5 other malformations.

Headlines: Interactions With New Anticoagulants
Teaser: At present, there are few documented interactions with the new drugs, including dabigatran, rivaroxaban, and apixaban, but considering the extensive food and drug interactions with warfarin, caution should be taken with the new agents, according to researchers.

Headlines: Valproate Reduces 2 Key Proteins, Leading to Bone Loss
Teaser: A new study shows that the long-term use of valproate, a drug commonly used to treat epilepsy and bipolar disorder, may decrease the production of both collagen and osteonectin.

Headlines: Mipomersen in Hypercholesterolemia
Teaser: The drug significantly lowered LDL-cholesterol levels in hypercholesterolemia patients, but questions about the drug's effect on the liver are still unanswered.

Headlines: TZDs May Increase Fracture Risk in Postmenopausal Diabetic Women and in Some Men
Teaser: A study shows that both rosiglitazone and pioglitazone are associated with fractures in postmenopausal women and in a subset of men and that fracture risk is increased with dose.

Headlines: Cardiotoxicity of Childhood Cancer Treatments Affects Adult Survivors
Teaser: Potentially cardiotoxic cancer treatment during childhood may have long-lasting, subclinical cardiovascular effects in young adults, new research suggests.

Headlines: FDA Again Warns Against IV Administration of Nimodipine
Teaser: The FDA urges healthcare professionals to advise their patients who spray the drug on their forearm to keep children and pets from coming into contact with the medicated area of skin.

Headlines: Exposure to Estradiol Transdermal Spray Risky for Children and Pets, FDA Says
Teaser: In 7 cases reviewed by the FDA, patients developed eosinophilic pneumonia 2 to 4 weeks after starting daptomycin treatment.

Headlines: Daptomycin May Be Linked to Eosinophilic Pneumonia
Teaser: Only newer AEDs with high potential of causing depression were linked to increased suicide risk in a new study.

Headlines: Not All Antiepileptics Have Excess Risk for Suicidality
Teaser: Within 3 days after receipt of the diphtheria-tetanus-acellular pertussis vaccine in early childhood, there was no increased risk for seizures.

Headlines: DTaP in Early Childhood Not Linked to Increased Seizure Risk Within 3 Days
Teaser: Enrollment in the controversial study assessing the cardiovascular effects of long-term treatment with rosiglitazone or pioglitazone has been stopped at the FDA's request.

Headlines: TIDE Enrolment Suspended
Teaser: Dr David Capuzzi earned $14 750 as a member of the company's speaker's bureau, but received the money related to talks about Lovaza and not for rosiglitazone. Dr Abraham Thomas received a few thousand dollars for speaking on behalf of pioglitazone, Avandia's rival.

Headlines: Capuzzi, Thomas, and Avandia
Teaser: A joint statement from 3 specialty groups stresses that patients on the controversial medication should keep taking it unless instructed otherwise by their healthcare provider.

Headlines: Patients With Diabetes Have Alternatives to Rosiglitazone, Experts Say
Teaser: A practical, simple method of identifying elderly inpatients at increased risk for an adverse drug reaction may be useful in clinical practice and in research.

Headlines: Simple Tool May Identify Patients at Increased Risk for Adverse Drug Reaction
Teaser: The US FDA has become the latest regulatory agency to say it will investigate a possible link between angiotensin-receptor blockers and cancer.

Headlines: US Agency Will Review ARBs for Possible Cancer Risk
Teaser: Near the end of two days of exhaustive, often-polarized debate, 12 panel members said the drug should be withdrawn, with no other choice getting as many votes. But the other 20 votes were spread across three out of four other options, all suggesting that the drug could stay on the market, with certain provisions.

Headlines: FDA Advisory Committee Sends Mixed Message to FDA
Teaser: A marathon of 11 hours of presentations has likely left the joint Endocrinologic and Metabolic Drugs and Drug Safety and Risk Management Advisory Committees reeling in confusion. Day two promises more time for questions and reflection before the all-important vote.

Headlines: Day-One Data Deluge at FDA Rosiglitazone Meeting
Teaser: More cases of this adverse event prompted the agency to strengthen an existing warning on the label for the rheumatoid arthritis drug.

Headlines: FDA Adds Boxed Warning to Leflunomide for Severe Liver Injury
Teaser: The agency has received reports of gas or air embolisms after the administration of hemostatic drugs and biological products with sprayers pressurized by gas and air.

Headlines: Use Fibrin Sprayers Correctly to Avoid Embolisms, Warns FDA
Teaser: A new analysis of the ONSET/OFFSET study with ticagrelor, which prospectively assessed the side effect of dyspnea and whether this affected cardiac and pulmonary function, provides reassurance that this adverse effect, while common, is generally mild and self-limiting, say the investigators.

Headlines: "Reassuring" Prospective Data on Dyspnea With Ticagrelor
Teaser: Treating such cramps with quinine is an off-label use with potentially serious adverse effects, the agency says.

Headlines: FDA May Revise Bisphosphonate Labels in Light of Possible Fracture Risk
Teaser: A new expert panel report states that clinicians should not prescribe bisphosphonates for patients with a low risk for osteoporosis-related fractures and should consider other drugs for spinal osteoporosis.

Headlines: More Evidence Sedatives May Raise Risk of Premature Death
Teaser: "Small but significant" increase in mortality risk seen among anxiolytic and hypnotic drug users in a Canadian study.

Headlines: FDA Rosiglitazone Bias?
Teaser: Two employees of the FDA have raised questions about members of a previous advisory panel who had already voted to keep rosiglitazone on the market being invited to the recent review meeting to decide the future of the drug.

Headlines: Optimal Antiemetic Therapy Remains Elusive for Pediatric Cancer Patients
Teaser: Data are limited, and information about the most effective antiemetics to prevent chemotherapy-induced nausea and vomiting in children is incomplete and imprecise.

Headlines: Two Hepatitis C Drug Candidates on Hold Because of Adverse Events
Teaser: An elevated liver function test for 1 patient appears to be related to gallstones, according to the chief medical officer of Idenix.

Headlines: British Said Rosiglitazone Should Be Withdrawn; Europeans Discuss
Teaser: It has emerged this week that UK experts recommended the withdrawal of the diabetes drug rosiglitazone from the British market in July, although this recommendation was not made public at the time.

Headlines: Use of Postnatal Corticosteroids in Bronchopulmonary Dysplasia Reviewed
Teaser: The American Academy of Pediatrics has issued a policy statement on use of postnatal corticosteroids to prevent or treat bronchopulmonary dysplasia.

Headlines: Sibutramine and Increased Risk for Nonfatal Vascular Events in Preexisting CVD
Teaser: Subjects with preexisting cardiovascular disease given sibutramine treatment had an increased risk for nonfatal myocardial infarction and nonfatal stroke but not cardiovascular or all-cause death.

Headlines: Tigecycline Linked to Increased Mortality Risk
Teaser: The increased mortality risk is most evident in patients treated for hospital-acquired pneumonia, and particularly ventilator-associated pneumonia, which is an unapproved indication.

Headlines: Several Factors Increase Fracture Risk With Androgen Deprivation for Pro...
Teaser: A Canadian study has identified several readily available clinical factors that help determine the risk of fractures in men with prostate cancer undergoing androgen deprivation therapy (ADT).

Headlines: FDA's Oversight Board Sees Growing Range of Drug Safety Issues
Teaser: In the 5 years since the FDA's Drug Safety Oversight Board was formed, the topics discussed have evolved from a single drug or drug class to much broader drug safety issues.

Headlines: Certain Octagam Lots Recalled After Reports of Blood Clots, Embolisms
Teaser: The immune globulin G intravenous (human) 5% liquid preparation is used to treat primary immune deficient diseases.

Headlines: Thiazolidinediones Compared: Comparable CV Risk
