Teaser: Get ready to answer patients' questions about Afrezza, a new inhaled-insulin product.

Headlines: With  Methotrexate Tx, Noninvasive Tests to Avoid Liver Biopsy
Teaser: Noninvasive testing may be useful for spotting potential hepatotoxicity and confirming the need for liver biopsy in psoriasis patients on methotrexate sodium, according to Irish researchers who say more studies are needed.

Headlines: EMA Panel Recommends Approval for Flutemetamol in AD
Teaser: The PET tracer received a positive opinion from the CHMP for detection of amyloid-beta neuritic plaques in the brain in diagnosis of patients suspected of having Alzheimer's disease.

Headlines: EU Panel Gives Nod to Triple Combo Pill for HIV (Triumeq)
Teaser: The EU’s Committee for Medicinal Products for Human Use has given a positive opinion for marketing of Triumeq, a once-daily combination of the antivirals dolutegravir, abacavir, and lamivudine.

Headlines: T-DM1 Now Preferred for Progressive HER2 Breast Cancer
Teaser: T-DM1, a successor to trastuzumab, should be the preferred choice for HER2-positive breast cancer that has progressed despite multiple lines of treatment, new research shows.

Headlines: Omega-3 Fatty Acids Plus Inositol Promising in Pediatric BPD
Teaser: In this pilot double-blind RCT, combined treatment with omega-3 fatty acids and inositol reduced symptoms of mania and depression in young children with bipolar spectrum disorders.

Headlines: Anticholinergic Nasal Spray Eases Rhinorrhea in Parkinson's
Teaser: Rhinorrhea is common in Parkinson's disease but not well recognized or studied; anticholinergic nasal spray eases symptoms.

Headlines: FDA Panel Votes Against Accelerated Approval for Olaparib
Teaser: An FDA advisory committee recommends waiting for phase 3 data before considering approval for olaparib as maintenance therapy for recurrent ovarian cancer.

Headlines: Ibrutinib in CLL: Indication Expanded, Benefit Confirmed
Teaser: The FDA has extended the use of the drug to also cover use in patients with chronic lymphocytic leukemia (CLL) with a chromosome 17p deletion.

Headlines: Whistleblower Case Against Celgene Can Proceed, Says Judge
Teaser: A former employee alleges that Celgene engaged in unlawful marketing of thalidomide and lenalidomide and downplayed risks before the drugs were approved to treat cancer.

Headlines: Oral Hepatitis C Drugs Helping Patients Coinfected With HIV
Teaser: Results from TURQUOISE-1 and PHOTON-2 show that interferon-free regimens are achieving impressive response rates with few adverse events in patients coinfected with hep C and HIV.

Headlines: Type 1 Diabetes: No Delay With Low-Dose Otelixizumab
Teaser: Low-dose otelixizumab was safe but did not preserve beta-cell function in patients with newly diagnosed type 1 diabetes in a phase 3 trial; GSK has started a new dosing study.

Headlines: Botox Helps Overactive Bladder Beyond 2 Years
Teaser: In the first long-term study of Botox for overactive bladder, efficacy and safety persisted for a median of 2.4 years with no additional safety issues, report researchers.

Headlines: HDL-Raising Drugs: No Value in the Statin Era?
Teaser: In the era of widespread statin use, investigators say studies testing fibrates, niacin, and CETP inhibitors do not support raising HDL         pharmacologically to reduce clinical outcomes.

Headlines: Real-World PrEP Use Protects Against HIV
Teaser: An extension trial shows the uptake of pre-exposure prophylaxis (PrEP) is high and effective, even without daily adherence.

Headlines: Mifepristone in Cushing's Disease: Long-term Results
Teaser: Tumor progression rate lower than expected after a median 11-month treatment with the glucocorticoid receptor antagonist to control hyperglycemia,         report study authors.

Headlines: African Americans With Cancer Pain More Likely to Receive Morphine
Teaser: African Americans with cancer pain are more likely than similar white patients to receive morphine, with 3- and 6-glucuronide neurotoxic metabolites that accumulate in chronic kidney disease (CKD), and less likely to receive oxycodone.

Headlines: Mislabeling Prompts Recall of Ibuprofen and Oxcarbazepine Tablets
Teaser: American Health Packaging recalls 1 lot of ibuprofen and 1 lot of oxcarbazepine in 100-count cartons distributed to US hospitals nationwide.

Headlines: Sleep Deprivation Mimics Psychosis
Teaser: After being kept awake for 24 hours, healthy, sleep-deprived individuals exhibit response deficits that are key markers of schizophrenia.

Headlines: Mental-Health Risks of Diabetes Underrecognized
Teaser: Despite the increased risk for depression, anxiety, and eating disorders among diabetic patients, few clinics offer even basic mental-health screening with     diabetes treatment.

Headlines: Inhaled Steroids May Suppress Growth in Children With Asthma
Teaser: Inhaled corticosteroids may suppress growth in the first year of treatment in children with asthma, but lower doses may minimize the effects, according to 2 Cochrane reviews.

Headlines: ADHD Drugs Not Tested for Safety, Efficacy Over Time
Teaser: A review of ADHD clinical drug trials shows the majority of studies were too small and too short to effectively assess long-term safety and efficacy of the agents or detect rare adverse events.

Headlines: CLARINET Results: Lanreotide First Line for Metastatic NETs
Teaser: The somatostatin analogue lanreotide has shown antitumor benefits in many types of metastatic neuroendocrine tumors (NETs), including intestinal tumors.

Headlines: HPS2-THRIVE: As Niacin Fails, HDL's Role Is  Debated Anew
Teaser: UPDATED // Given the negative results from AIM-HIGH and HPS2-THRIVE, as well as other negative studies, the cardiovascular research community is grappling with the     future of managing HDL-cholesterol levels to reduce clinical risk.

Headlines: Another Injectable Treatment for Diabetes on the Horizon
Teaser: Enticing findings with fibroblast growth factor in mice suggest an insulin-sensitizing role, independent of mitogenic effects, with the potential to     normalize blood glucose with few side effects.

Headlines: IL-17 Inhibition May 'Change Paradigm' of Psoriasis Treatment
Teaser: The selective interleukin-17 (IL-17) inhibitor secukinumab (Novartis) produced rapid, robust and, with continued treatment, long-lasting relief of moderate to severe plaque psoriasis in two phase 3 studies.

Headlines: Novel Tamoxifen Gel Could Reduce Adverse Effects
Teaser: A tamoxifen gel applied directly to the breast produces antiproliferative effects similar to those produced by oral tamoxifen, but with fewer systemic effects.

Headlines: No Evidence, Yet ADT Often Used in Localized Prostate Cancer
Teaser: Androgen-deprivation therapy (ADT) is not associated with improved survival in men with localized prostate cancer, yet it is frequently used.

Headlines: Antipsychotics Linked to Acute Kidney Injury
Teaser: Use of atypical antipsychotic medications may increase the risk for acute kidney injury in elderly patients, causing researchers to call for their use in this population to be reevaluated.

Headlines: Sclerosis: Autologous Cell Transfers May Help Patients
Teaser: A new study has found that injections of adipose-derived stromal cells into the fingers of patients with systemic sclerosis decreased pain and increased function.

Headlines: Dairy Saturated Fats Lower Type 2 Diabetes Risk
Teaser: In a new study, the incidence of type 2 diabetes was found to differ depending on the type of saturated fatty acid consumed. Dairy fats appeared to be     protective.

Headlines: Getting a Good Day's Sleep
Teaser: Melatonin may extend daytime sleep in night shift workers and certain stimulants may increase alertness, a new review shows.

Headlines: Retina Specialists Report Problems With Ocriplasmin
Teaser: Many patients suffer adverse effects after treatment with ocriplasmin for vitreomacular adhesion, a survey of specialists finds.

Headlines: Stigma Is a Side-Effect of HIV-Prevention Medicine
Teaser: Truvada is a drug that can help people who are not infected avoid contracting the virus that causes AIDS. But some patients are worried the medical community is not up to speed.

Headlines: Switching Antiretrovirals May Not Enhance HIV Treatment
Teaser: Changing treatment when the viral load is suppressed can increase the risk for subsequent virologic failure, new research shows.

Headlines: Gamma Knife Brain Surgery Promising for Severe OCD
Teaser: Gamma ventral capsulotomy, a type of ablative brain surgery, for intractable obsessive-compulsive disorder shows promise according to results from the first randomized, double-blind trial.

Headlines: Best Treatment for Shoulder Pain?
Teaser: Physical therapy is just as effective as corticosteroid injections in alleviating pain and disability and improving quality of life, and may be less costly.

Headlines: Obesity Drug Safety Debate Escalates in Medical Journal
Teaser: Arguments and accusations fly as physicians and others debate the FDA's wisdom in approving lorcaserin and phentermine-topiramate.

Headlines: FDA Expands Approval of Pompe Disease Drug
Teaser: On the basis of new data available since the approval of Lumizyme, the FDA has expanded approval to include patients younger than 8 years, as well as eliminating the REMS program attached to the drug.

Headlines: Post-Beta-Blocker Flap, New CV Guidance for Non-CV Surgery
Teaser: The ESC/ESA and ACC/AHA issue new recommendations for the cardiovascular management of patients undergoing noncardiac surgery, including how to use     beta-blockers in the post-DECREASE era.

Headlines: Treatment for CLL: Change Aplenty, More Coming
Teaser: A new review looks at what clinicians should be doing right now in the management of chronic lymphocytic leukemia (CLL).

Headlines: FDA Clears Olodaterol (Striverdi Respimat) for COPD
Teaser: The once-daily inhaled long-acting beta-agonist is for long-term maintenance treatment of airflow obstruction in patients with COPD, including chronic bronchitis and/or emphysema.

Headlines: US Cigar Smoking Doubles, Variety of Products Available
Teaser: In the United States, cigarette consumption declined during 2000 to 2011, but consumption of cigars more than doubled during the same period, according to the CDC.

Headlines: One-Dose Antiemetic Eases Chemo-Induced Nausea, Vomiting
Teaser: A single oral dose of netupitant plus palonosetron at the beginning of a chemotherapy cycle prevented nausea and vomiting for most cancer patients.

Headlines: Teenagers With Cancer at Risk for Severe Menstrual Bleeding
Teaser: Cancer treatment can put teenage girls at high risk for heavy menstrual bleeding, so new guidelines suggest that gynecologists should be involved in their care.

Headlines: Musculoskeletal Pain on Stopping Imatinib: Should We Worry?
Teaser: A first report on a withdrawal syndrome documents patients with chronic myelogenous leukemia with musculoskeletal pain after imatinib withdrawal.

Headlines: Apremilast Shows Promise for Inflammatory Rosacea
Teaser: The oral phosphodiesterase inhibitor apremilast relieves signs of inflammatory rosacea, according to a pilot study in patients with moderate to severe disease.

Headlines: Physicians Pose Barriers to Urinary Incontinence Treatment
Teaser: In focus groups, insured women with urinary incontinence cited barriers to treatment, including fear of treatment, lack of knowledge, and physician insensitivity to the problem.

Headlines: Oral Sea Buckthorn Oil to Maintain Post-menopausal Vaginal Health
Teaser: Sea buckthorn oil taken orally can help improve vaginal atrophy in postmenopausal women, a new randomized trial suggests.

Headlines: PARADIGM-HF: Some Say, 'A New Day in Heart Failure'
Teaser: "I'm having difficulty being critical of this one," said one expert on the trial of an agent tailor-made to supplant ACE inhibitors for heart failure. But     is this just the honeymoon phase?

Headlines: IV Lidocaine an Option for Critical Limb Ischemia Pain
Teaser: Intravenous lidocaine proved better than IV morphine in alleviating pain due to critical limb ischemia in a randomized double-blind controlled trial conducted in Iran.

Headlines: Huge Decreases in LDL Cholesterol With Alirocumab: ODYSSEY
Teaser: Tested in high-risk CVD patients, heterozygous-FH patients, and patients intolerant to statins, treatment with alirocumab resulted in as large as a 60%     reduction in LDL cholesterol from baseline. Some patients even got down to LDLs of 50 mg/dL.

Headlines: COPPS-2: Colchicine Stops Postop Pericarditis, Troubles Gut
Teaser: In COPPS-2, patients taking colchicine had a high rate of adverse GI events, and this likely explains why there was no overall benefit in preventing AF     after cardiac surgery; but it was effective for pericarditis  of postpericardiotomy syndrome.

Headlines: PARADIGM-HF: New Drug Class Outclasses ACE-I in Chronic HF
Teaser: Although observers are cautious, one expert writes hopefully that the trial "may well represent a new threshold of hope for patients with heart failure."

Headlines: Wanted: 60 Volunteers to Test Ebola Vaccine in Middle England
Teaser: Fancy testing an Ebola vaccine? It may sound scary but the scientist behind the British trial of a shot that has so far only been given to monkeys sees little risk and is optimistic he will drum up enough volunteers.

Headlines: Getting Help for Postpartum Depression for Uninsured Women
Teaser: Women who lose their health insurance in the postpartum period find it hard to get mental health care for postpartum depression, new research shows.

Headlines: What's Going to Be Hot at ERS 2014
Teaser: First results from AMBITION, the large pulmonary arterial hypertension trial, will be presented along with the latest strategies for treating asthma and chronic obstructive pulmonary disease.

Headlines: TMS Improves Memory via Brain Surface Networks
Teaser: Repetitive transcranial magnetic stimulation improves memory by targeting surface regions connected with the much deeper center of memory, the hippocampus.

Headlines: Complication Rate No Higher With DBS in Older PD Patients
Teaser: Neurologists may still be reluctant to refer older patients with Parkinson's disease for deep brain stimulation for fear of surgical complications, but a new study suggests this fear is unfounded.

Headlines: Self-Monitoring and Titration of Meds Drops BP in TASMIN SR
Teaser: Twelve-month findings from a small, unblinded trial offer support for a strategy of having hypertensive patients keep tabs on their own blood pressure and     adjust their drugs as needed.

Headlines: Daclatasvir (Daklinza) for Chronic Hepatitis C Cleared in EU
Teaser: The potent oral antiviral, indicated across multiple HCV genotypes and in combination with other oral drugs, yields cure rates of up to 100%, the manufacturer says.

Headlines: WHO Calls for Strict Global Regulation of e-Cigarettes
Teaser: The WHO is calling for global regulation of e-cigarettes and similar devices as public health concerns gain momentum, especially as they affect youth and nonsmokers.

Headlines: Medical Marijuana Laws Linked to Fewer Opioid Deaths
Teaser: A new study finds lower rates of death from accidental overdose of analgesic opioids in states where laws provide access to medical marijuana.

Headlines: Ebola Therapies and Vaccines Need Priority, Support
Teaser: Editorials published this week by major infectious disease experts call for support and prioritizing development of Ebola therapies and vaccines while maintaining momentum in controlling the outbreak.

Headlines: MRSA: Experts Question the Value of Some Control Precautions
Teaser: Some European infectious disease experts have questioned the value of contact isolation and screening for controlling MRSA.

Headlines: Skin Reactions to Phenytoin Linked to Gene Variants
Teaser: Carriers of a genetic variant linked to reduced drug clearance have more than 10 times higher odds of developing adverse skin reactions to the antiepileptic drug, suggesting screening may flag risk.

Headlines: Glaucoma Drug Eyed as Novel Diabetes Treatment 'Archetype'
Teaser: An old glaucoma drug, methazolamide, improved glucose control in a small study, probably due to a distinct mechanism that the manufacturer, Verva, hopes to     pursue.

Headlines: Jury Out on Histamine-2 Receptor Antagonists for Pediatric GERD
Teaser: There is little high-quality evidence to support the efficacy and safety of histamine-2 receptor antagonists (H2RAs) for pediatric gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD), researchers said.

Headlines: Patient Expectations Largely Dictate Antidepressant Response
Teaser: Expectations about antidepressant efficacy largely dictate response to treatment in depression, as outcomes between active treatment and placebo are modest at best.

Headlines: Vitamin D Doesn't Prevent Calcium Drop After Gastric Bypass
Teaser: Sharp decreases in calcium absorption were observed even when gastric bypass patients maintained adequate vitamin D levels, with the level of decline     correlating with the percentage of weight loss.

Headlines: Generic GA Shows Equivalence on MRI Endpoints in MS
Teaser: A generic version of the MS drug glatiramer acetate looked similar to the branded product (Copaxone) in terms of reduction in MRI lesions and side effects in the GATE study.

Headlines: Adjunctive ECT Effective for Drug-Resistant Schizophrenia
Teaser: Augmenting clozapine-resistant schizophrenia with electroconvulsive therapy is a safe and effective treatment option.

Headlines: 'Most Powerful' Combo for Type 2 Diabetes Fulfills Promise
Teaser: The combination of a GLP-1 agonist and basal insulin produces remarkable results in type 2 diabetes, say the authors of a new meta-analysis and     accompanying comment. But cost remains a concern.

Headlines: First US Study of Mesenchymal Stem Cells in MS
Teaser: The phase 1 study established safety, and while it was not designed to look at efficacy, there were some 'enticing hints of benefit' in individual patients, the lead investigator said.

Headlines: Osteoporosis Drugs Lower Fracture Risk, but Best One Unclear
Teaser: There are very few head-to-head trials of pharmacologic treatments for osteoporosis; thus, reviewers are left to summarize trials and observational studies of individual drugs.

Headlines: UK's NICE: No to Nab-Paclitaxel for Pancreatic Cancer
Teaser: The draft guidance says that the benefits of nab-paclitaxel plus gemcitabine in metastatic pancreatic cancer do not outweigh its high costs.

Headlines: FDA OKs Menactra as Booster Against Meningococcal Disease
Teaser: Menactra (Sanofi Pasteur) is indicated in individuals 15 to 55 years of age for booster vaccination against meningococcal disease caused by Neisseria meningitidis serogroups A, C, Y, and W-135.

Headlines: Brief Scale Linked to Antidepressant Overprescribing
Teaser: Using brief depression symptom measures, especially the PHQ-9, may lead to overdiagnosing and subsequent unnecessary prescribing unneeded antidepressants for those at low risk for the disorder.

Headlines: Question Drug Prescribing in Advanced Dementia
Teaser: More than half of nursing home residents with advanced dementia receive medications of questionable benefit, at 'substantial' personal and monetary cost, a new study shows.

Headlines: Opioid-Induced Adverse Effects Hit Social Media
Teaser: Social media analysis reveals patients are talking about constipation and other opioid-induced adverse effects, and about lack of communication with doctors.

Headlines: Statins Don't Up Diabetic Microvascular Disease Risk
Teaser: An analysis of a large database in Denmark suggests that statin use among adults who later develop diabetes does not raise the risk for microvascular     complications and may even protect against them.

Headlines: Benzodiazepines Linked to Increased Alzheimer's Risk
Teaser: Use of benzodiazepines for insomnia and anxiety, especially over the long term, may increase the risk for Alzheimer's disease.

Headlines: French Company Carmat Fits Second Patient With Artificial Heart
Teaser: French company Carmat said on Monday it had fitted a second patient with one of its artificial hearts and would continue clinical trials on two more patients.

Headlines: The Opioid Constipation 'Disconnect'
Teaser: Doctors and patients have differing views on the impact of opioid-induced constipation and use of laxatives to relieve this adverse effect.

Headlines: Rapid Streptococcus Tests Accurate
Teaser: A metaanalysis has suggested that rapid streptococcus tests are accurate and may not need confirmation with throat culture.

Headlines: Quadruple Dosing of Doripenem Safe in Patients With CF
Teaser: High doses of the antibiotic doripenem are safe to use in patients with cystic fibrosis suffering from acute respiratory infection, report investigators.

Headlines: FDA Okays First PD Inhibitor: Pembrolizumab for Melanoma
Teaser: The first of a new class of programmed death (PD) inhibitor drugs has been approved in the United States, much earlier than expected.

Headlines: No Bladder-Cancer Risk With Pioglitazone, Says Takeda
Teaser: Takeda has submitted new data to regulatory authorities worldwide that it says show there is no bladder-cancer risk with its diabetes drug pioglitazone.

Headlines: Alemtuzumab for MS: Encouraging 4-Year Data
Teaser: Latest data continue to show low rates of relapse and new lesions, with brain atrophy said to be slowed to 'almost normal.'  But safety issues are still a concern for some.

Headlines: K-Binder Averts Hyperkalemia Over One Month: Top-Line Results
Teaser: A phase 3 trial of the potassium sequestrant ZS-9 met its primary end point by averting recurrent hyperkalemia compared with placebo, said ZS Pharma in a     short announcement.

Headlines: Single Radiation Dose for Malignant Spinal Cord Compression
Teaser: A single but higher dose of radiation preserves mobility in patients, and is cheaper and more convenient than lower doses given over several days.

Headlines: Odanacatib Efficacy Stays Strong, Side Effects Give Pause
Teaser: Results from the phase 3 LOFT trial show robust reduction in fracture risk but small yet alarming increases in stroke; atypical fractures prompt a closer     look.

Headlines: Idelalisib (Zydelig) Approved in Europe
Teaser: The first-in-class oral agent is now approved in the EU for the treatment of chronic lymphocytic leukemia and follicular lymphoma.

Headlines: Synthetic Marijuana Now a Worldwide Problem
Teaser: Consumption of synthetic cannabinoids, aka K2 or Spice, has increased all over the world - despite law enforcement and regulatory control measures, reports a new NIDA-led study.

Headlines: Probiotics Cut Autoimmunity 33% in Infants at Risk for Diabetes
Teaser: Probiotics given to infants under 3 months of age appear to reduce the incidence of islet-cell autoimmunity by one-third, according to early results from     the ongoing TEDDY trial in the United States and Europe.

Headlines: Childhood Trauma Heightens Disease Risk Into Adulthood
Teaser: Exposure to family dysfunction, abuse, and neglect as children can increase risk for most of the leading causes of death in the US, a pediatrician warns. Her practice starts with routine screening.

Headlines: In Search for Beauty, Some Find Vision Loss
Teaser: Patients injected with subcutaneous dermal fillers may be at risk for occlusion of ocular arteries leading to transient or potentially permanent vision loss.

Headlines: What's Hot at ESMO 2014
Teaser: New data promise to be practice changing, and will change the standard of care for melanoma, prostate, and lung cancer, among others.

Headlines: Early Azithromycin in Infants Risks Pyloric Stenosis
Teaser: Infants who receive azithromycin within the first days of life have an 8-fold increase in risk of developing hypertrophic pyloric stenosis, report researchers.

Headlines: First UK Volunteer Gets GSK Ebola Vaccine in Trial
Teaser: The first volunteer in a fast-tracked British safety trial of an experimental Ebola vaccine made by GlaxoSmithKline received the injection on Wednesday, trial organizers said.

Headlines: 'Real-World' Study Shows Two Drugs Better Than One for COPD
Teaser: Patients with asthma or who  were not taking long-acting anticholinergics derived especially good benefit, investigators say.

Headlines: Empagliflozin Useful Second-Line for Diabetes vs Glimepiride
Teaser: The SGLT2 inhibitor empagliflozin provided favorable results at 2 years compared with the sulfonylurea glimepiride when used as second-line     therapy after metformin in diabetes.

Headlines: Ebola Vaccine Trial Finds 'No Red Flags': U.S. Senate Testimony
Teaser: A key safety trial of an experimental Ebola vaccine manufactured by GlaxoSmithKline has injected 10 healthy volunteers since Sept. 2, and so far 'no red flags' indicating serious adverse reactions have been found.

Headlines: FDA Okays Naloxegol (Movantik) in Opioid-Induced Constipation
Teaser: Approval comes following results of 2 studies showing the drug is safe and effective.

Headlines: ASTRO Issues More 'Don't' Recommendations
Teaser: The radiation oncology organization has a new set of 5 practices that should be stopped or only used occasionally.

Headlines: Urinary Incontinence: ACP Offers Nonsurgical Options
Teaser: A new American College of Physicians guideline suggests nonsurgical treatment options for women with urinary incontinence, including Kegel exercises, bladder training, weight loss, and exercise.

Headlines: Daclizumab in MS: More Detail on Phase 3 Results
Teaser: Full final results of the DECIDE trial show 'impressive efficacy and manageable safety,' with daclizumab HYP, the lead investigator reports.

Headlines: Two Drugs Better Than One for Pulmonary Hypertension
Teaser: New data from the AMBITION trial suggest that combining ambrisentan with tadalafil cuts clinical failure in pulmonary hypertension by 50% compared with either drug alone.

Headlines: Egg-Rich Diet Not Harmful in Type 2 Diabetes
Teaser: A new Australian study explores the differences in lipid levels seen between type 2 diabetes patients randomized to a diet low in egg consumption (less     than 2 eggs per week) vs high (12 per week).

Headlines: Long Flights and Patients at Risk for Acute-Closure Glaucoma
Teaser: Patients with risk factors for acute-closure glaucoma may consider taking special precautions on long flights, researchers suggest.

Headlines: CBT Trumps Medications for Social Anxiety
Teaser: One-on-one cognitive-behavioral therapy appears to be more effective than pharmacotherapy for treating social anxiety disorder.

Headlines: Drug Reactions Largest Factor in Fatal Anaphylaxis
Teaser: Drugs, foods, and venom accounted for most deaths from anaphylaxis.

Headlines: Beta-Blockers No Use in CAD Patients With No Prior MI
Teaser: Beta-blocker use in stable CAD or in patients with CAD risk factors only had no benefits and may have increased stroke risk in CHARISMA. "We can't lump     all CAD patients together," one expert says.

Headlines: Bad News, Good News for Fibromyalgia Drug
Teaser: A new sublingual drug that targets nonrestorative sleep failed to lessen daily pain in fibromyalgia patients but did improve sleep quality and lessen overall symptomatic burden.

Headlines: FDA Okays Methylnaltrexone (Relistor) for Opioid Constipation
Teaser: The makers of Relistor announced approval of an expanded indication for this previously approved drug in treatment of opioid-induced constipation.

Headlines: Peripheral Neuropathy Treatment Taps Into Quantum Theory
Teaser: Peripheral Neuropathy Treatment Taps Into Quantum Theory

Headlines: Long-Acting Reversible Contraceptives Best Choice for Teens
Teaser: New AAP guidelines for teenaged pregnancy prevention now recommend long-acting reversible contraceptives as first-line contraception for teenagers who are  sexually active.

Headlines: New AAN Position Statement on Opioids for Noncancer Pain
Teaser: In a new position paper, the American Academy of Neurology responds to an urgent public health problem, suggesting that for many pain conditions the risks likely outweigh the benefits.

Headlines: Scientists Grapple With Ethics in Rush to Release Ebola Vaccines
Teaser: Normally it takes years to prove a new vaccine is both safe and effective before it can be used in the field. But with hundreds of people dying a day in the worst ever outbreak of Ebola, there is no time to wait.

Headlines: 'Impressive' Duration of Response With Nivolumab in Melanoma
Teaser: Preliminary data from the first phase 3 trial with the immunotherapy nivolumab show that most patients who respond continue to respond (up to 10 months).

Headlines: EU Panel Likes 4 New Cancer Products
Teaser: The EMA's CHMP has recommended a new drug for non-small cell lung cancer and one for gastric cancer, a new drug for chemotherapy-induced neutropenia, and a new imaging product.

Headlines: CHMP Backs Naloxegol (Moventig) in Opioid-Induced Constipation
Teaser: On the heels of its US approval, European regulators have recommended approval of naloxegol for opioid-induced constipation in adults who fail laxatives.

Headlines: Laquinimod in MS: Latest Safety Data 'Reassuring'
Teaser: The latest pooled data from the extension phases of the major phase 3 studies show no new adverse effects and no signal of any type of cancer.

Headlines: Metformin in Diabetes: Evidence Overwhelming, or Unclear?
Teaser: The drug is old and widely used for type 2 diabetes, but disagreement exists as to whether the data support its use; 2 experts at EASD faced off in a     lively debate.

Headlines: Diabetes Is On-Target Effect of Statins, Genetic Study Finds
Teaser: Scientists say they have found a partial explanation as to why statins might up the risk of developing diabetes and, importantly, that the diabetogenic effects may not be easily disentangled from the LDL benefits.

Headlines: Stepwise Stages Critical When Tapering Pain Meds
Teaser: Go slow, give encouragement, and consider the substantial neuroplastic changes that occur as patients break free from a pain management regimen based solely on medication, a new withdrawal approach suggests.

Headlines: Failed HCV Drug Cardiotoxic in 40% of Treated Patients
Teaser: When analyzing the 34 patients treated with BMS-986094, researchers found that 14 had some form of systolic dysfunction. Those cases of low LVEF might have     remained undetected, given that troponin and BNP levels were relatively normal.

Headlines: Most Vaccination-Onset Epilepsy Has Genetic, Structural Cause
Teaser: A new study shows that most seizures beginning after vaccination have an underlying genetic or structural cause, which should increase faith in vaccine safety, researchers say.

Headlines: Soy Isoflavones: No Evidence of Endometrial Harm at 3 Years
Teaser: A study that found soy isoflavone supplements ineffective in preventing bone loss now shows that at least they do not appear harmful over the long term.

Headlines: Solution to US Cancer Care 'Crisis' Is Less Cancer Care
Teaser: There is a need to revise the disease-centric approach that requires that all cancers be treated, regardless of age, comorbidities, and likely side effects. Overall well-being should be paramount, say a pair of reformers.

Headlines: Synthetic Marijuana Emergency Visits More Than Double
Teaser: The number of ED visits involving synthetic marijuana products has risen exponentially.

Headlines: FDA Approves Two Drugs for Idiopathic Pulmonary Fibrosis
Teaser: The US Food and Drug Administration has approved nintedanib (Ofev) and pirfenidone (Esbriet) for the treatment of idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis.

Headlines: Breathing and Awakening Trials Cut Ventilator Complications
Teaser: For patients in intensive care, ventilator-associated events can be avoided with spontaneous awakening and breathing trials, say researchers.

Headlines: Significant Retinopathy Risk With Long-Term Hydroxychloroquine
Teaser: Long-term use of hydroxychloroquine may carry a significant risk of toxic retinopathy, according to a retrospective case-control study.

Headlines: Alcohol Intake Tied to Low Sperm Quality, High Testosterone
Teaser: Men who drank 40+ units of alcohol per week had 34% lower sperm concentration than those who drank 5 or fewer units.

Headlines: Restrict Valproate, EMA Committee Urges
Teaser: A European Medicine Agency's committee recommends strengthening the restrictions on the use of valproate in women of childbearing age.

Headlines: e-Cigarettes Have Secondhand Adverse Effects
Teaser: Adverse-event reports to the US Food and Drug Administration about e-cigarettes from nonusers include respiratory complaints that could be related to nicotine toxicity.

Headlines: Intravenous Ibuprofen Reduces Childhood Fever
Teaser: Previously untested in pediatric populations, an IV formulation of ibuprofen could be an effective alternative for children who can't take oral medication.

Headlines: Conference to Headline 'Remarkable Success' in GI Medicine
Teaser: Innovations in the treatment of hepatitis C will be highlighted at the meeting.

Headlines: EMA Finds Little Evidence That Testosterone Ups CV Risk
Teaser: But the EU agency's committee still rules that labels of testosterone-containing products should be updated.

Headlines: Wide Utility of Model Predicting Troglitazone Hepatotoxicity
Teaser: What if scientists could predict adverse events of drugs in development that may not show up in animal studies or the relatively limited clinical testing     that goes on preapproval?

Headlines: Diabetic Neuropathy Pain: Mirogabalin Promising in Pilot Study
Teaser: The first serious look at mirogabalin by "top notch" investigators offers food for thought in the treatment of painful peripheral diabetic neuropathy.

Headlines: Cancer Drugs Fund in England: Plugging a Gap in Cancer Care
Teaser: The fund provides cancer patients access to targeted agents deemed too expensive by the National Cancer of Clinical Excellence, but is it really only a temporary solution?

Headlines: NSAIDs May Boost Risk of Venous Thromboembolism
Teaser: Pooled data from observational studies show a significantly increased risk of venous thromboembolism (VTE) among NSAID users versus nonusers, according to U.S. and Thai researchers.

Headlines: Promising New Drug for Migraine Prevention
Teaser: A genetically engineered antibody is showing great promise for migraine prevention.

Headlines: Fibromyalgia: Memantine Reduced Pain in Small, Blinded Trial
Teaser: Memantine, an agent primarily used to treat patients with Parkinson's or Alzheimer's disease, may provide pain relief and improve the quality of life of patients with fibromyalgia.

Headlines: 'Medical Food' Bests Ibuprofen in Chronic Low Back Pain
Teaser: Study showed theramine, an amino acid blend, alone or combined with ibuprofen is better than ibuprofen alone in patients with chronic low back pain.

Headlines: Evidence Linking Some Fluoroquinolones to Uveitis Grows
Teaser: Moxifloxacin or ciprofloxacin appear to increase the risk for uveitis; levofloxacin less so.

Headlines: Sofosbuvir/Ledipasvir Combo Effective for Relapse HCV
Teaser: Researchers have found sofosbuvir/ledipasvir to be effective for treating patients with relapsed HCV infection.

Headlines: New Psychotropic Drug Classification System Unveiled
Teaser: A newly proposed naming system for reclassifying psychotropic drugs has been unveiled in Europe with plans for a worldwide rollout in the near future.

Headlines: COX-2 Inhibitors for Rheumatological Manifestations of IBD
Teaser: The jury is out on the tolerability and safety of selective cyclooxygenase 2 (COX-2) inhibitors for treatment of rheumatological manifestations of inflammatory bowel disease (IBD), according to a new Cochrane review.

Headlines: Tiotropium Showing Promise in Pediatric Asthma
Teaser: A drug and device combination already approved for COPD and effective in adults with asthma could provide an option for children with refractory disease.

Headlines: PV-10 in Metastatic Melanoma: Rapid Responses Led to Phase 3
Teaser: The product is injected directly into cutaneous melanoma lesions, but also improves noninjected lesions by an immunologic effect.

Headlines: Japanese Mushroom Extract Could Help Treat HPV Infections
Teaser: A mushroom extract eradicated persistent HPV infection in a small pilot study, and a larger phase 2 trial is now getting underway.

Headlines: Diet Therapy Effective in Adults With Refractory Epilepsy
Teaser: A ketogenic or modified Atkins diet should be considered in adults with refractory epilepsy, a new review suggests.

Headlines: With Resurgence in Polymyxin Use, CHMP Revises Label
Teaser: As the rise in antimicrobial resistance has led to an increase in use of the half-century-old drug class, polymyxins, CHMP has recommended label revisions based on limited pharmacokinetic data.

Headlines: Metformin Neglected as First-Line Therapy for Diabetes
Teaser: While widely recommended as first-line therapy for type 2 diabetes, metformin is being neglected as an initial treatment for many, despite new data     suggesting it's a good choice.

Headlines: TARGET 3: Rifaximin Safe to Reuse for Irritable Bowel
Teaser: Retreatment with rifaximin is safe and effective, report TARGET investigators. And long-term use of linaclotide is well tolerated.

Headlines: Ibuprofen Better Option for Kids With Fracture
Teaser: For uncomplicated pediatric fracture, ibuprofen and morphine control pain equally, but ibuprofen causes fewer adverse effects.

Headlines: EU CHMP Completes Review of Ponatinib, Finalizes Warnings
Teaser: The European Committee for Medicinal Products for Human Use has now recommended strengthening its warning for ponatinib.

Headlines: Long-Acting Anesthetic Effect Achieved With Neosaxitoxins
Teaser: The novel site 1 sodium channel blocker, which belongs to the class of paralytic shellfish toxins, significantly prolonged time to partial and complete recovery.

Headlines: Initial Data on 'Pharma Grade' Cannabidiol in Epilepsy
Teaser: New data suggest that extracts of marijuana are effective for treatment-resistant epilepsy but may not be the 'miracle cure' some reports have suggested.

Headlines: No Long-Term MS Risk After Vaccination
Teaser: A new study finds no association with multiple sclerosis up to 3 years following vaccination, but it did uncover a risk for demyelinating syndromes in patients under age 50 in the first few weeks after being vaccinated.

Headlines: Anti-inflammatories May Help Ease Depression
Teaser: Results of a new meta-analysis provide preliminary support for using anti-inflammatories as an adjunctive treatment for depression.

Headlines: FDA Adds Everolimus to Watch List
Teaser: Signal for possible hypertension risk leads FDA to add kidney cancer drug everolimus to watch list.

Headlines: Serious Impulse Control Disorders With Dopamine Agonists
Teaser: Researchers 'confirm and extend' evidence for the link between serious impulse control disorders, such as compulsive shopping and gambling and hypersexuality, and all 6 dopamine agonists used to treat Parkinson's disease.

Headlines: Antidepressants Blunt Sexual Function, Feelings of Love
Teaser: Long-term antidepressant use is associated with significant 'emotional blunting' manifesting as sexual dysfunction in women and impaired feelings of love in men.

Headlines: Cure Rates Remain High With Fecal Transplant for C difficile
Teaser: High and sustained cure rates continue to be reported after fecal microbiota transplant for patients with recurrent, refractory C difficile, with a few exceptions.

Headlines: Amoxicillin Adverse Effects Underreported, Underrecognized
Teaser: Data on adverse events are missing from many clinical trial publications, according to a new systematic review.

Headlines: Lupus Nephritis: Multidrug Induction Ups Complete Responses
Teaser: A combination of tacrolimus, mycophenolate mofetil, and steroid resulted in higher remission rates than cyclophosphamide plus steroid.

Headlines: Botox, Fillers or Laser Treatments May Have Few Complications
Teaser: Side effects or complications were rare and usually temporary in a U.S. study of noninvasive or minimally-invasive cosmetic procedures.

Headlines: Bexxar for Lymphoma: Gone but Not Forgotten
Teaser: The radiolabeled monoclonal antibody was withdrawn from the market more than a year ago, but a few have not forgotten its value in advanced lymphoma, and there's hope for a comeback in generic form.

Headlines: No Clear Winner for Relief of Diabetic Neuropathy Pain
Teaser: Which is the best drug for painful diabetic neuropathy? A new systematic review has generated some interesting observations.

Headlines: 'Inactivating' NPC1L1 Mutations Protect Against CHD
Teaser: Mutations in a gene for the same protein targeted by ezetimibe may protect against CHD, a finding that comes less than a week before the world learns how ezetimibe performed in the IMPROVE-IT study.

Headlines: Amgen Psoriasis Drug Brodalumab Tops J and J's Ustekinumab
Teaser: Amgen Inc said on Tuesday that its experimental psoriasis drug, brodalumab, met all the goals of a late-stage study, clearing the rough skin patches associated with the disease more thoroughly than Johnson & Johnson's (ustekinumab) Stelara and a placebo.

Headlines: Immunotherapy for Metastatic Cancer Linked to Thyroid Disease
Teaser: Novel therapies for the treatment of metastatic malignancies show effects on thyroid function; closer monitoring of patients at risk is urged.

Headlines: Symptom Severity May Predict Antipsychotic Efficacy
Teaser: Toward the mildest end of the spectrum, patients benefit less in terms of symptom improvement yet still experience the adverse effects of antipsychotics.

Headlines: Lorcaserin and Phentermine Safe Combo in Weight-Loss Trial
Teaser: A new pilot study examines the effect of adding a new weight-loss drug, lorcaserin, to an old appetite suppressant, phentermine.

Headlines: Cognitive Therapy, Mindfulness for Menopausal Depression
Teaser: Psychotherapy and mindfulness techniques could help many women who experience depression during menopause, according to a review of existing research.

Headlines: Arthritis Affects One Quarter of US Veterans: CDC
Teaser: A CDC analysis of survey data from 2011 to 2013 showed that 25.6% of veterans had arthritis, with higher prevalence among veterans than nonveterans across most sociodemographic categories.

Headlines: FDA Panel Falls Short of Recommending Panobinostat
Teaser: An FDA advisory panel voted 5 to 2 against recommending approval of panobinostat for treating multiple myeloma.

Headlines: Marijuana for Pediatric Seizures?
Teaser: As new studies get under way, child neurologists hope to provide children with epilepsy and their anxious parents more solid information about who might benefit from medical marijuana.

Headlines: Evidence Mounting for Eliglustat in Gaucher's Disease
Teaser: Eliglustat can treat type 1 Gaucher's disease almost as effectively as enzyme replacement therapy, new research shows.

Headlines: High BPA Levels in Men Reduces IVF Pregnancy Rates
Teaser: In men, exposure to bisphenol A (BPA) has a negative effect on in vitro fertilization (IVF) rates, according to the results of a new study.

Headlines: New WHO Guidelines Recommend Expanded Access to Naloxone
Teaser: New guidelines recommending expanded access to the drug naloxone to reduce the number of opioid-related deaths globally have been released by the World Health Organization.

Headlines: Cancer Researcher to Pay USD 475,000 to US to End Fraud Lawsuit
Teaser: An expert in adverse drug effects, especially in patients with cancer, was accused of filing false expense claims against large grants from the National Institutes of Health.

Headlines: Adding CSF to Ipilimumab Improves Survival in Melanoma
Teaser: Adding the granulocyte macrophage colony stimulating factor (GM-CSF) sargramostim to the immunological improved both survival and toxicity.

Headlines: POEM: Avoid Methimazole for Graves' Disease in Early Pregnancy
Teaser: Incidence of methimazole embryopathy is high, but treatment alternatives have risks of their own.

Headlines: Top-Five Tests and Treatments to Avoid in Sleep Disorders
Teaser: The American Academy of Sleep Medicine lists five tests and procedures physicians and patients should question in its 'Choosing Wisely' list.

Headlines: Generic Antiepileptics Equivalent to Brand-Name Drugs
Teaser: FDA-funded bioequivalency studies demonstrate how brand and generic antiepileptic drugs are tightly tied pharmacokinetically.

Headlines: Positive Results With Brivaracetam, Perampanel, in Epilepsy
Teaser: Researchers are reporting positive phase 3 trials of two antiepileptic drugs, one of which

Headlines: Pharmacist Phone Call Before Physician Visit Enhances Care
Teaser: Checking medication lists and discussing adherence problems saves time and money for primary care physicians and improves patient satisfaction, say researchers.

Headlines: Novel Program Reduces Depressive Symptoms, Benzo Use
Teaser: An 8-week, community-based depression recovery program decreases symptoms of moderate depression and, fortuitously, benzodiazepine use.

Headlines: PD-1 Blockade Arrives in Hematologic Cancer
Teaser: Two programmed cell death 1 (PD-1) inhibitors have demonstrated efficacy in phase 1 studies of patients with relapsed or refractory Hodgkin lymphoma.

Headlines: Symptom Severity May Predict Antipsychotic Efficacy
Teaser: Toward the mildest end of the spectrum, patients benefit less in terms of symptom improvement, yet still experience the adverse effects of antipsychotics.

Headlines: EU Green Light for Liraglutide in Diabetes With Renal Disease
Teaser: Drugs for type 2 diabetes that can be used without dose adjustment in patients who also have kidney disease are few and far between. But trials are being     conducted, and one new option has emerged.

Headlines: First Drug for Polycythemia Vera Approved by FDA
Teaser: Ruxolitinib has become the first drug for polycythemia vera to be approved by the FDA; the drug is already marketed for use in myelofibrosis, another bone marrow disorder.

Headlines: Potassium-Binding Agent Relieves Hyperkalemia in Phase 3 Study
Teaser: Agents that sequester potassium in the intestines are advancing in clinical trials; here, one with the active ingredient zirconium cyclosilicate seemed effective and safe acutely and over 1 month.

Headlines: New Study Refutes Pioglitazone and Bladder Cancer Link
Teaser: More data on the ongoing controversy regarding pioglitazone and bladder cancer, this time from a large research consortium that employed novel methods of     analyses.

Headlines: Skin Problems Common With Cabozantinib Cancer Therapy
Teaser: Cabozantinib monotherapy leads to skin problems in most patients with metastatic, progressive urothelial carcinoma, according to new research.

Headlines: Bisphosphonates Neglected in Men on Androgen Deprivation
Teaser: Most men prescribed androgen-deprivation therapy for prostate cancer are at increased risk for bone loss and fracture but are not receiving concomitant     prophylactic bisphosphonates.

Headlines: Long-Lasting Responses With Immunotherapy in Melanoma
Teaser: An update on data from early clinical trials showed that patients are surviving for years on immunotherapy with nivolumab, ipilimumab, and a combination of the two.

Headlines: MRIs May Be Too Painful With Cochlear Implants
Teaser: Magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) may displace the magnets of cochlear implants or cause extreme discomfort for some wearers, according to a new study.

Headlines: FDA Warns of PML Risk With Tecfidera in MS
Teaser: The has FDA announced that risk for PML will be added to the label after a fatal case in a patient taking dimethyl fumarate for 4 years.

Headlines: EMA Panel Backs Exviera, Viekirax for Chronic Hepatitis C
Teaser: Exviera and Viekirax were recommended by the European Medicines Agency's Committee for Medicinal Products for Human Use for the treatment of adults with chronic hepatitis C.

Headlines: Surprising Result Shows Kidney, Mortality Benefits of Niacin
Teaser: A large observational study, in contrast to two randomized controlled trials, shows that niacin administration reduces all-cause mortality and declines in kidney function.

Headlines: FDA Clears Hydrocodone With Abuse-Deterrent Properties
Teaser: The physical and chemical properties of single-entity Hysingla ER (Purdue Pharma) are expected to make abuse difficult, the FDA says.

Headlines: Trans Fat Linked to Worse Memory
Teaser: A new study finds an association between higher consumption of foods containing trans fats and reduced word memory in men of working age.

Headlines: Juvenile Arthritis: Adverse Events Common With Biologics
Teaser: Biologics were associated with serious events in 1 in 3 patients with JIA taking them, but treatment is rarely discontinued, according to a large study.

Headlines: FDA Expands Use of Ivacaftor (Kalydeco) for Cystic Fibrosis
Teaser: The agency has approved the CFTR potentiator for use in children aged 6 years and older with cystic fibrosis who have the R117H mutation.

Headlines: More Than 50% of Antipsychotics Prescribed Off Label
Teaser: Antipsychotics are routinely prescribed for nonpsychotic diagnoses, particularly in women, older people, and the economically disadvantaged.

Headlines: Obese Women Have Unique Surgical Risks
Teaser: Gynecologic surgeons should be familiar with risks faced by obese women, such as surgical site infection, venous thromboembolism, and wound complications, to provide counsel before surgery.

Headlines: Biologic Combo Therapy Sometimes Needed for Psoriasis
Teaser: Biologic agents alone may not work in all patients with psoriasis and a combination approach may be needed, according to recommendations from the Medical Board of the National Psoriasis Foundation.

Headlines: FDA Approves Nivolumab (Opdivo) for Advanced Melanoma
Teaser: The FDA has granted a highly anticipated accelerated approval to the PD-1 inhibitor nivolumab for advanced melanoma.

Headlines: FDA OKs Combination Antibacterial Zerbaxa
Teaser: Zerbaxa combines ceftolozane and tazobactam and is indicated for treatment of complicated intra-abdominal and urinary tract infections.

Headlines: Latanoprostene Bunod for Glaucoma, Ocular Hypertension
Teaser: Latanoprostene bunod (LBN) 0.024% reduced intraocular pressure (IOP) more than latanoprost 0.005% (Xalatan, Pfizer), but with more side effects, in a study of patients with open angle glaucoma (OAG) or ocular hypertension (OHT).

Headlines: To T3 or Not: Combo Therapy in Hypothyroidism
Teaser: The new ATA guidelines on hypothyroidism have sparked controversy, with endocrinologists reacting in different ways to the recommendations regarding     thyroid-hormone-replacement therapy.

Headlines: Benzodiazepine Use Highest in Older Americans
Teaser: Despite inherent risks and questionable efficacy, long-term use of the benzodiazepines increases steadily with age among US residents and is especially prevalent among older women.

Headlines: Nitrous Oxide Explored for Resistant Depression
Teaser: A new proof-of-concept study suggests 'laughing gas' improves depression even after the drug's sedative effects wear off.

Headlines: Low-Carb, High-Fat Diets Effective for Adult Epilepsy
Teaser: Variations of low-carbohydrate, high-fat dietary plans reduce seizures at a rate similar to that of antiepileptic drugs.

Headlines: ASH Unveils Second Choosing Wisely List
Teaser: As part of the Choosing Wisely initiative, the American Society of Hematology (ASH) has released five more tests and treatments that should be questioned.

Headlines: New Algorithm for Treatment of Premenopausal Breast Cancer
Teaser: Results from the Suppression of Ovarian Function Trial (SOFT) are practice changing for a subgroup of premenopausal women with breast cancer.

Headlines: Tamoxifen Continues to Shine for Breast Cancer Prevention
Teaser: After a follow-up of as long as 22 years, tamoxifen continues to protect women with a familial or genetic increased risk from developing breast cancer, but the drug is still a hard sell for many clinicians.

Headlines: Pain Med Linked to Hypoglycemia
Teaser: Tramadol, an opioid analgesic, was associated with an increased risk for hospitalization for hypoglycemia, especially in the first month of use, in a new study.

Headlines: Minoxidil May Be Dangerous to Kids
Teaser: Minoxidil, best known as a hair-loss treatment, may cause dangerous side effects in kids who are accidentally exposed to it, say the authors of a recent case study from France.

Headlines: Antipsychotic Linked to Potentially Fatal Skin Reaction
Teaser: An antipsychotic, along with its generic counterparts, used to treat schizophrenia and bipolar I disorder has been linked to a rare but potentially fatal skin reaction.

Headlines: Breast Cancer With High TIL Levels: Skip the Trastuzumab?
Teaser: A provocative study suggests that HER2 breast cancer patients with high levels of stromal tumor infiltrating lymphocytes may not need trastuzumab (Herceptin).

Headlines: New Deadly Class of Synthetic Hallucinogens Mimics LSD
Teaser: NBOMe, a novel class of synthetic hallucinogens, which is being sold as a cheaper and more readily available substitute for LSD, is emerging as a particularly lethal drug.

Headlines: FDA Commissioner Dr Margaret Hamburg to Step Down
Teaser: Dr Hamburg is credited with advocating for safe drugs and devices while partnering with industry. Will Rob Califf take her place?

Headlines: US FDA Approves Natpara for Hypoparathyroidism
Teaser: After an additional 3 months to consider its decision, the US FDA has finally ruled on a recombinant parathyroid hormone product, Natpara, to control     hypocalcemia in patients with hypoparathyroidism.

Headlines: Aflibercept Might Be Tied to Intraocular Inflammation
Teaser: Sterile ocular inflammation following injection of aflibercept (Eylea, Regeneron Pharmaceuticals) outlined in post-marketing reports should prompt further investigation, according to researchers.

Headlines: Two Ophthalmic Drugs Receive Positive Nods in Europe
Teaser: The European Committee for Medicinal Products has recommended approval of ciclosporin drops for severe keratitis and a new indication for aflibercept.

Headlines: CHMP Says Yes to Two Antibiotics for Skin Infections
Teaser: Oritavancin (Orbactiv) and tedizolid phosphate (Sivextro) have received positive opinions from the EMA committee for acute bacterial skin and skin structure infections.

Headlines: Seniors Commonly Mix Alcohol With Meds
Teaser: Although many US adults of all ages put themselves at risk by mixing drugs and alcohol, this dangerous practice is especially prevalent in the elderly.

Headlines: New AHS Review of Acute Migraine Treatments
Teaser: The assessment, which will form the basis of new US clinical practice guidelines, represents the first update to treatment recommendations in 15 years.

Headlines: Oxytocin May Help Frontotemporal Dementia
Teaser: Intranasal oxytocin given twice daily for 1 week showed preliminary signs of improvement in apathy and loss of empathy in patients with frontotemporal dementia.

Headlines: Clinical Cancer Advances in 2014: CLL Is the Winner
Teaser: This year in its annual review of clinical cancer advances, the American Society of Clinical Oncology has, for the first time, announced a winner.

Headlines: Tapentadol Toxicity in Children
Teaser: Most pediatric patients exposed to this novel analgesic (Nucynta) had no major effects, but there were 2 cases with life-threatening events, poison center reports show.

Headlines: Biomarker May Predict Best Smoking Cessation Treatment
Teaser: A genetic biomarker may help predict response to specific smoking cessation treatments.

Headlines: PRAC Concludes Safety Review of Ambroxol, Bromhexine Meds
Teaser: The review prompted the EMA committee to recommend updating the product information on ambroxol- and bromhexine-containing medicines to include a small risk for severe allergic reactions.

Headlines: Expert Panel Final Report on Opioids in Chronic Pain
Teaser: An independent expert panel convened by NIH has published a final report identifying knowledge gaps and calling for more research into various aspects of chronic pain management and long-term opioid use.

Headlines: Long-Acting Contraceptives Safe and Effective, Yet Underused
Teaser: The levonorgestrel intrauterine system and etonogestrel subdermal implants are well-tolerated and associated with few serious adverse effects, and 88% of teenagers used them for at least 12 months.

Headlines: Metformin Label Too Restrictive on Renal Grounds, Limits Use
Teaser: Has the US label contraindicating metformin use in type 2 diabetes patients with mild renal insufficiency led to underuse of the drug? A new study suggests     this is the case, and others agree.

Headlines: New Type of Antibiotic May Be Less Prone to Resistance
Teaser: A novel antimicrobial compound effectively kills gram-positive bacteria, but showed no evidence of resistance in animal tests.

Headlines: Positive Topline Phase 2 Results for Novel Schizophrenia Drug
Teaser: A novel oral antipsychotic proves as effective as olanzapine with less weight gain in patients with schizophrenia.

Headlines: Does 'War on Cancer' Metaphor Cause Casualties?
Teaser: The metaphor of waging a war against cancer could have unintended consequences, such as hampering prevention and leaving patients who progress feeling defeated.

Headlines: MMRV Vaccine Safe, With Rare Adverse Effects
Teaser: Several of the evaluated adverse outcomes occurred rarely to not at all after vaccination with either MMR + V or the newer MMRV.

Headlines: Marijuana Promising in Rare Epilepsies, But It's Still Early
Teaser: New data are encouraging, but researchers remain restrained in their assessments, saying randomized, controlled trials are sorely needed.

Headlines: Gene Variant Linked to Increased Toxicity of Vincristine
Teaser: A previously unknown gene variant has been linked to increased risk and severity of vincristine-induced peripheral neuropathy in children with acute lymphoblastic leukemia.

Headlines: FDA Approves Panobinostat for Relapsed Multiple Myeloma
Teaser: The first-in-class agent has been granted accelerated approval, despite having been voted down by the advisory committee late last year.

Headlines: Oncologists Need to Ask About Herbs and Supplements
Teaser: A new survey shows that only 26% of US oncologists ever initiate discussions about the use of herbs and other supplements, even though they are widely used.

Headlines: Radiation Used in Too Many Men With Indolent Prostate Cancer
Teaser: American men with low-risk prostate cancer are being overtreated, primarily with radiation therapy, a population-based study has shown.

Headlines: First Proton Therapy Device Cleared in Canada
Teaser: Canada has cleared the way for the use of proton therapy in cancer patients, which offers an alternative to the conventional photon radiotherapy.

Headlines: Long-Acting Opioids Related to Unintentional Overdose Risk
Teaser: Patients receiving long-acting opioids were 2.3 times more likely to experience an unintentional overdose overall, and 5 times more likely in the first 2 weeks of treatment.

Headlines: Case Report: Fecal Transplants May up Risk of Obesity Onset
Teaser: Fecal microbiota transplantation can be effective for recurrent Clostridium difficile infection, but new-onset obesity could follow transplant of stool from an overweight donor, say the authors of a case report.

Headlines: Endocrine Societies at Odds Over Advice on T3 for Hypothyroidism
Teaser: The American Thyroid Association and American Association for Clinical Endocrinology may have to agree to disagree on whether or not to endorse use of     triiodothyronine in hypothyroid.

Headlines: Limit Hydroxyzine to Reduce Cardiac Risks, EU Regulators Say
Teaser: Clinicians should prescribe the lowest effective dose for the shortest period possible to reduce the risk for potentially fatal heart arrhythmias, an EMA committee has recommended.

Headlines: A Dissolving Film Could Replace Eye Drops for Ocular Drug Delivery
Teaser: A dissolving film in development now may someday prove more effective than eye drops in treating eye conditions, new data from mouse trials suggests.

Headlines: Some Pediatricians Don't Have Adequate Training With IUDs
Teaser: When Wendy Sue Swanson started out as a pediatrician eight years ago, it never crossed her mind to bring up the option of intrauterine devices.

Headlines: New Wave of Drugs Poised to Shake up Glaucoma Treatment
Teaser: For the first time in 20 years, patients suffering from the eye disease glaucoma may soon have new treatments as several young companies look to shake up the $5.6 billion global market

Headlines: Latest Roche-Sponsored Tamiflu Review Enters the Fray
Teaser: A meta-analysis of individual patient data from nine randomized controlled trials showed reduced symptom duration and more adverse effects, but outside experts call 'foul' -- again.

Headlines: Axitinib Shown to Be Active in Resistant CML and B-ALL
Teaser: Axitinib, a VEGFR inhibitor used in the treatment of kidney cancer, has surprisingly now shown activity in certain hematologic malignancies.

Headlines: FDA Clears Ranibizumab for Diabetic Retinopathy With DME
Teaser: Ranibizumab for diabetic retinopathy with DME had breakthrough therapy designation and was reviewed under the agency's priority review program.

Headlines: Dogs Give Love, Improve Outcomes in Cancer Study
Teaser: Man's best friend is a friend even in the worst of times.

Headlines: Modern Birth Control Could Prevent 15M Unwanted Pregnancies
Teaser: Optimal use of modern contraceptives could avert an estimated 15 million of 16.7 million unwanted pregnancies each year in 35 low- and middle-income countries.

Headlines: One in 12 Pediatric Emergency Visits Related to Medications
Teaser: Medication-related issues were to blame for 1 in 12 pediatric visits to the emergency department in a recent study; 65% of the visits were potentially preventable.

Headlines: Diquafosol Beats Hyaluronate in Treating Dry Eyes
Teaser: Diquafosol helped patients with dry eye resulting from mucin deficiency more than hyaluronate.

Headlines: Patient Voices Essential, as Docs Underreport Toxicities
Teaser: The voices of cancer patients are essential when it comes to reporting toxic effects in clinical trials because physicians tend to under-report.

Headlines: Anacetrapib Provides Large LDL-Lowering Benefit in FH
Teaser: Anacetrapib allowed significantly more FH patients to attain their LDL-cholesterol treatment goals, but researchers are urging caution with the agent     because two others in the class have failed in large clinical-outcomes trials.

Headlines: Vulvovaginal Atrophy Symptoms Improve With Prasterone Treatment
Teaser: Prasterone treatment has parallel beneficial effects on the three main symptoms of vulvovaginal atrophy (VVA), regardless of which symptom a patient finds the most troubling, a new phase III open-label study shows.

Headlines: Hepatitis E Vaccine Effective and Long Lasting
Teaser: The hepatitis E vaccine was effective, and the protection it provided lasted for up to 4.5 years after vaccination, a long-term study showed.

Headlines: ED Docs Well Placed to Give Positive Info About Vaccination
Teaser: Emergency physicians are in a position to screen children for vaccinations and counter misconceptions about vaccine safety by delivering the facts in a nonjudgmental way.

Headlines: Stimulant May Speed Antidepressant Response Time in Elderly
Teaser: Methylphenidate combined with the antidepressant citalopram significantly reduced time to depression remission in elderly patients.

Headlines: FDA Approves Nivolumab, First Immunotherapy for Lung Cancer
Teaser: Approved 3 months ahead of schedule, nivolumab is the first immunotherapy to have shown a survival benefit in non-small cell lung cancer.

Headlines: New Data Suggest Water Fluoridation Linked to Hypothyroidism
Teaser: A populationwide study suggests a link between fluoride levels in drinking water and hypothyroidism in England. Hypothyroidism was nearly twice as likely     in fluoridated areas as nonfluoridated.

Headlines: Canadians Crystallize Obesity Advice: Action Beats Inaction
Teaser: Five review articles highlight the value of obesity prevention and treatment programs for children and the benefits of modest weight loss and prevention of     weight regain in overweight and obese adults.

Headlines: GAO Report Cites Antipsychotic Overuse in Dementia Patients
Teaser: The agency urged the federal government to do more to reduce use of pharmacologic therapies; CMS has set goal to reduce prescribing in nursing homes by about half by 2016.

Headlines: Testosterone Labels Must Now Note CV, Stroke Risks, FDA Says
Teaser: The FDA will require testosterone-replacement products to clarify approved uses and cite the risk for heart attack and stroke.

Headlines: ACP Updates Guidelines on Bedsore Prevention, Treatment
Teaser: The recommendations include advanced static mattresses, protein or amino acid supplements to reduce wound size, and electrical stimulation.

Headlines: Acetaminophen Risks May Have Been Underestimated
Teaser: Acetaminophen (paracetamol) may have more risks than originally thought, but an independent expert, and even the study author, say the new data should be taken with a grain of salt.

Headlines: Novel Combination 'Encouraging' in Advanced Kidney Cancer
Teaser: An investigational antiangiogenic inhibitor of the ALK1 pathway and a VEGF inhibitor showed promising activity and a good safety profile in advanced renal cell carcinoma.

Headlines: Childhood Vaccines: Parents Often Ask Docs to Spread Them Out
Teaser: Physicians need strategies to increase the timeliness and completeness of vaccinations.

Headlines: The Opioid-Free ED: Coming Soon to a Hospital Near You
Teaser: The emergency department (ED) can sometimes be the birthplace of opioid addiction, which is reason enough to find alternative effective nonopioid analgesics.

Headlines: Combination Therapy Helpful in Refractory Alopecia
Teaser: Combination therapy with diphenylcyclopropenone (DPCP) and anthralin is more effective than DPCP alone in patients with chronic extensive alopecia areata (AA), according to Turkish researchers.

Headlines: Preconception Bariatric Surgery May Cut Risks for Mom, Fetus
Teaser: Obese women who undergo bariatric surgery before pregnancy have reduced risk for gestational diabetes and large-for-gestational-age infants, but risk for other adverse effects may be increased.

Headlines: Sublingual Immunotherapy Safe Alternative for Peanut Allergy
Teaser: Long-term sublingual immunotherapy for peanut allergy can provide a lasting benefit in some children, although the effect is not as strong as with oral options.

Headlines: Insulinlike Growth Factor Promising for Rare Autism Type
Teaser: A small pilot study suggests insulinlike growth factor holds promise for the rare Phelan-McDermid syndrome and may have treatment implications for other autism spectrum disorders.

Headlines: Defibrotide Significantly Boosts Survival in VOD
Teaser: Defibrotide significantly improved outcomes across all subgroups of patients who developed veno-occlusive disease after stem cell transplant.

Headlines: Aspirin Protection for Colorectal Cancer Depends on Genetics
Teaser: The reduced risk for colorectal cancer risk seen in people taking aspirin or related NSAIDs appears to be linked to genetic variations in two common SNPs.

Headlines: Antipsychotic Metabolic Screening in Kids Abysmal
Teaser: More than a decade after metabolic screening recommendations for children starting atypical antipsychotics were introduced, rates are nearly as low as they were at baseline.

Headlines: Ultrasound Accurate for Diagnosing Pneumonia in Children
Teaser: Lung ultrasounds may be a viable alternative to chest radiographs, especially in places with limited resources, a metaanalysis suggests.

Headlines: HCV Drugs Cost-effective, but Who Should Get Them?
Teaser: Should new drugs, which can cost $1000 per pill, be rationed by genotype, disease stage, age, or whether patients reinfect themselves? Or will drug companies eventually reduce costs?

Headlines: More Studies Support Testosterone CV Safety, Debate Continues
Teaser: Two new analyses suggest that there is no increased risk for venous thromboembolism or cardiovascular events with testosterone treatment, but experts say     the definitive trial has yet to be done.

Headlines: Oncotype DX: Usage Consistent With Guidelines
Teaser: New data show that the 21-gene recurrence score for predicting risk for metastatic breast cancer has been quickly adopted in clinical practice.

Headlines: EU Advisory Body Aims to Reduce Bone Drug Osteonecrosis Risk
Teaser: The European Medicines Agency's pharmacovigilance panel advises new product labeling and patient reminders about the osteonecrosis risk with zoledronic acid, with future plans to target other bone drugs.

Headlines: Chikungunya Vaccine Trial Shows Promise
Teaser: A live recombinant vaccine against chikungunya infection, produced by modifying the measles vaccine virus, was safe and induced a good immune response in healthy volunteers in a new study from Austria.

Headlines: EMA Panel Recommends Codeine Restriction for Cough in Kids
Teaser: A committee of the European Medicines Agency has recommended restricting the use of codeine for cough and cold in children because it can cause serious adverse effects, including breathing problems.

Headlines: Multi-State Measles Outbreak & Influenza Update, March 2015
Teaser: A multi-state outbreak of measles is ongoing; clinicians should ensure their patients are appropriately vaccinated. Influenza activity is still widespread in New Hampshire; initial symptoms of influenza and measles can be similar.

Headlines: Genetic Sensitivity to Warfarin Linked with Bleeding
Teaser: The analysis from ENGAGE AF-TIMI 48 links variants in two genes known to alter the pharmacokinetics and pharmacodynamics of warfarin with bleeding-events rates.

Headlines: FDA Okays Saphris for Pediatric Bipolar Disorder
Teaser: The FDA has approved another atypical antipsychotic for the treatment of pediatric patients with bipolar 1 disorder.

Headlines: Heart Failure Not Increased With Diabetes Drug Alogliptin?
Teaser: A new analysis of EXAMINE finds no significant overall increase in heart-failure end points with alogliptin, but the jury is still out on this potential     risk with DPP-4 inhibitors, say editorialists.

Headlines: SSRIs Safe, Tolerable for Pediatric Anxiety
Teaser: An exhaustive analysis of adverse events associated with the treatment of anxiety in children and adolescents in the CAMS study concludes that the use of SSRIs is safe in this population.

Headlines: First Therapy for High-Risk Neuroblastoma Approved by FDA
Teaser: Dinutuximab, an antibody targeting glycolipids on the neuroblastoma cell, used in combination with other therapies has been shown to improve survival.

Headlines: Chantix May Lower Alcohol Tolerance, Up Seizure Risk: FDA
Teaser: The FDA has changed the labeling on the smoking cessation medication Chantix to reflect concerns that the drug may lower alcohol tolerance and boost seizure risk.

Headlines: Antidepressants, Statins Have Separate Impact on CV Mortality
Teaser: Nondepressed outpatients benefited from statins, and depressed outpatients benefitted from antidepressants; the two therapies were not synergistic, in a     study of 3-year CV outcomes.

Headlines: Endocrine Disruptors Cause Range of Diseases; Cost 157 Billion Euros
Teaser: A new EU analysis suggests a wide range of neurologic, endocrinologic, and reproductive abnormalities from chemicals used in everyday products such as     pesticides, cosmetics, and flame retardants.

Headlines: Websites Marketing Genetic Cancer Tests Oversell Benefits
Teaser: Websites marketing personalized cancer care services often overemphasize benefits and downplay limitations, and offer genetic tests of questionable value.

Headlines: Image-Guided Lidocaine Injections for Headache
Teaser: Lidocaine injections into part of the trigeminal nerve near the brain under fluoroscopic guidance improved migraine and cluster headaches, a new study shows.

Headlines: NEPA Combo for CINV Nears Approval in Europe
Teaser: In Europe, approval has been recommended for combination netupitant and palonosetron to prevent chemotherapy-induced nausea and vomiting (CINV) in cancer patients.

Headlines: Trial Has Lessons for Search for 'the Perfect Anticoagulant'
Teaser: Allergic reactions cut short a major trial of the REG1 anticoagulant-antidote drug pairing, but researchers seem undeterred in their search for a safer, controllable anticoagulant for use in PCI.

Headlines: Biologics Take Aim at Psoriasis Despite Worry Over Reactions
Teaser: The oral drug tofacitinib, typically prescribed for rheumatoid arthritis, is showing promise for the treatment of psoriasis, and new experimental agents are gaining ground.

Headlines: Gadolinium Found in Brain Tissue
Teaser: Researchers found traces of gadolinium among deceased persons, most commonly in the dentate nuclei, in amounts related to the number of contrast-enhanced MRI examinations they received.

Headlines: Antipsychotic Death Risk Revised Upwards in Dementia Patients
Teaser: Antipsychotics used to treat dementia patients carry a greater mortality risk than previous research suggests.

Headlines: Budesonide Has Potential for Lung Cancer Chemoprevention
Teaser: Inhaled budesonide significantly decreased the size of nonsolid lung nodules, which is of potential importance because some can progress to adenocarcinoma.

Headlines: K-Binder Patiromer Could Keep Patients on HF RAAS Inhibitors
Teaser: A new breed of potassium-binding agents could herald "a new era for renal disease and heart failure that really will change the game," says a prominent researcher. Others express caution about them.

Headlines: Is Bevacizumab Truly a New Standard in Cervical Cancer?
Teaser: New data on quality of life show 'convincingly' that it is not adversely affected, but does it all add up to a new standard?

Headlines: EAS Offers Advice on Statin-Induced Muscle Pain

Headlines: Cold Therapy Freezes Forehead Wrinkles

Headlines: Alirocumab Effective Against LDL-C Top of Max-Dose Statin
Teaser: Statins increase plasma concentrations of PCSK9, the target of alirocumab, but an analysis suggests high-dose statin therapy won't interfere with the PCSK9     inhibitor's benefit.

Headlines: GPs Should Focus on Individualizing Diabetes Treatment
Teaser: In a commentary on the recent American Diabetes Association's Standards of Care, authors point to individualization and patient-centeredness as key     concepts for primary-care clinicians.

Headlines: Cosyntropin Shows Efficacy for Postdural Puncture Headache
Teaser: The gold standard treatment, epidural blood patch, isn't always effective, and an alternative could be beneficial when there are contraindications.

Headlines: Antiviral Promising in Early HPV Trial
Teaser: The experimental drug ranpirnase has the potential to be the first antiviral treatment for human papillomavirus (HPV).

Headlines: Transperineal Prostate Biopsy 'Well Tolerated,' Study Shows
Teaser: The newer technique of transperineal biopsy performed under general anesthetic produced scores similar to those obtained with the standard transrectal approach.

Headlines: Phase 3 Results Positive for Prasterone for Menopause-Related Pain
Teaser: Daily use of an experimental treatment, prasterone, may ease pain from vaginal intercourse in postmenopausal women, according to a study sponsored by the maker of prasterone, EndoCeutics.

Headlines: Phenylephrine Eyedrops Safe for Routine Clinical Use

Headlines: FDA Panel Backs Breo Ellipta for Asthma in Adults
Teaser: The panel recommended against approving the long-acting beta-agonist combination therapy for children, primarily due to safety concerns.

Headlines: In Hodgkin's Lymphoma, Brentuximab vs Placebo for First Time

Headlines: FDA OKs Ivacaftor (Kalydeco) for Preschoolers With CF
Teaser: Ivacaftor is now indicated in the US for children aged as young as two years with CF and one of 10 mutations in the CFTR gene; a new formulation can be mixed with soft foods or liquids.

Headlines: Precision Medicine Needs 'Precision Genomics'
Teaser: In half of all cancer patients, tumor-only gene sequencing is not enough to guide therapeutic decisions on the use of precision cancer agents.

Headlines: More Intussusception Hospitalizations in California After Rotavirus Vaccine Intro
Teaser: The risk of intussusception hospitalizations in infants in California has risen since the introduction of rotavirus vaccines in 2006 and 2008, according to researchers.

Headlines: U.S. Prescription Drug Spending Rose 13 Percent in 2014: IMS Report

Headlines: Lithium Linked to Thyroid Dysfunction, but Only in Women
Teaser: The anticonvulsant topiramate, which is approved to treat pediatric epilepsy, migraine, and migraine prevention, may trigger or exacerbate eating disorders in young at-risk patients.

Headlines: Anticonvulsant May Trigger, Exacerbate Eating Disorders
Teaser: Doctors treating patients with fumaric esters for MS or psoriasis should be alert for PML both in lymphopenic and in nonlymphopenic patients, researchers say.

Headlines: First Case of Fumarate-Linked PML in Nonlymphopenic Patient
