Headlines: Histrelin for Precocious Puberty Effective in 6-Year Study
Teaser: With the first biosimilar approved by the US Food and Drug Administration, and more on the horizon, prescribers are going to need to brush up on the complexities of these products.

Headlines: Biosimilar Approvals Prompt Drug Swap Difficulties
Teaser: Pooled data do not prove the safety of finasteride for androgenic alopecia (AGA), with sexual side effects in particular not adequately evaluated, according to a new meta-analysis.

Headlines: Finasteride Safety Questionable in Androgenic Alopecia
Teaser: A novel, potent mu-opioid antagonist with olanzapine is designed to attenuate olanzapine-induced metabolic side effects.

Headlines: Novel Schizophrenia Drug Continues to Show Promise
Teaser: Both metformin and glyburide are effective oral agents for maintaining glycemic control in gestational diabetes mellitus (GDM). However, certain side effects are greater with glyburide, according to Chinese researchers.

Headlines: Metformin May Edge Glyburide in Gestational Diabetes
Teaser: Antidepressants administered in therapeutic doses to depressed patients have been linked to an increased risk for first-time seizures.

Headlines: Antidepressants at Normal Doses Linked to First-Time Seizures
Teaser: The long-term formulation of paliperidone, which is currently under FDA review, may be the first atypical antipsychotic administered on a four-times-a-year dosing schedule.

Headlines: Long-term Injectable Antipsychotic Cuts Schizophrenia Relapse
Teaser: The first-in-class drug, in addition to showing improvement in schizophrenia symptoms, shows signs of improving depression and social function.

Headlines: Novel Drug Promising for Schizophrenia
Teaser: Even with long-term evidence of the superiority of intraperitoneal (IP) over intravenous (IV) chemotherapy for advanced ovarian cancer, controversy lingers.

Headlines: Controversial IP Route Trumps IV Chemo for Ovarian Cancer
Teaser: As healthcare providers become increasingly pressured to provide quality care, the American Academy of Sleep Medicine has developed quality measures for the five most common sleep disorders.

Headlines: New AASM Quality Measures for Common Sleep Disorders
Teaser: The anemia drug will now carry a boxed warning on the potential for life-threatening allergic reactions.

Headlines: FDA Orders Stricter Warnings for Ferumoxytol (Feraheme)
Teaser: The effect was so powerful that the Data Safety and Monitoring Board stopped the trial, report researchers.

Headlines: Naproxen Lowers Ossification Risk in Hip Arthroscopy
Teaser: A benzodiazepine or an SSRI successfully treats panic disorder, but nearly all patients relapse, even after years of treatment, once drug is withdrawn. Reinstating drugs can get the disorder under control.

Headlines: Drug Therapy Prevents Panic Attacks, but Relapse Very Common
Teaser: Intra-articular ketorolac shows efficacy similar to that of corticosteroid injections in the treatment of knee osteoarthritis, a new study shows.

Headlines: Mindfulness Therapy May Offer Alternative to Antidepressants
Teaser: Mindfulness-based cognitive therapy may offer an alternative to drug treatment for recurrent depression.

Headlines: Laser Treatment Halts Oral Mucositis in Its Tracks
Teaser: Six minutes of treatment with the same type of laser that is used to treat wrinkles can prevent the oral mucositis in head and neck cancer patients.

Headlines: Newer Herpes Zoster Vaccine Effective Even in Older Adults
Teaser: A recombinant subunit vaccine significantly lowered the risk for herpes zoster in adults aged 50 years or older, with comparable efficacy in adults aged 70 years or older.

Headlines: SONATA: 50% Adverse Event Rate Reported for Lifitegrast
Teaser: About half the patients with dry eyes who were treated with the experimental drug lifitegrast experienced treatment-emergent adverse events, although not severe ones, a new study has shown.

Headlines: FDA Okays First Aripiprazole Generics
Teaser: The FDA has approved the first generic versions of the atypical antipsychotic aripiprazole.

Headlines: Novel Brain Stimulation May Boost Creativity, Treat Depression
Teaser: Low-energy brain stimulation can increase creativity via alpha oscillations, boosting creativity and potentially providing a novel treatment for depression.

Headlines: Experimental Drug Safe, Effective in Schizophrenia
Teaser: An experimental agent with a novel mechanism of action may offer a safe and effective treatment option for schizophrenia with a better side effect profile than atypical antipsychotics.

Headlines: Statins in Everyone 75 and Older? Could Be Cost-Effective: Analysis
Teaser: Perhaps, but "even very modest adverse effects attributable to statins tip the balance in the direction of harm," says an observer, who adds, regarding statins in this group, "Less is more."

Headlines: EMA: Heart Risk From Amiodarone Plus Hepatitis C Antivirals
Teaser: The caution applies to several medications with sofosbuvir, used to fight hepatitis C; the caution in Europe mirrors similar antiviral labeling changes     announced by the US FDA within the past month.

Headlines: Once-Daily Oral Combination Clears Hepatitis C in 95%

Headlines: Positive Results for Status Epilepticus Drug

Headlines: Clozapine-Induced Myocarditis Overlooked?
Teaser: A purportedly higher incidence of clozapine-induced myocarditis in Australia has led researchers there to warn that this adverse drug reaction is being overlooked elsewhere.

Headlines: MMR Vaccine Not Linked to Autism, Even in High-Risk Kids

Headlines: Evidence Points to Fallopian-tube Origins of Ovarian Cancer

Headlines: New AAN/AES Guideline on First Unprovoked Seizure in Adults
Teaser: Experts recommend clinicians approach patients on an individualized basis in terms of whether to treat with an antiepileptic drug following a first unprovoked seizure.

Headlines: Vandetanib for Medullary Thyroid Cancer: Manageable Toxicity

Headlines: Paradigm Shift: Anti-PD-1 Keytruda Tops Yervoy for Melanoma
Teaser: The newer drug, pembrolizumab, is a better first-line therapy than ipilimumab for advanced melanoma.

Headlines: HCV Antiviral Simeprevir Label Warns of Cardiac Risk

Headlines: Confusing Zerbaxa Label Could Lead to Dosing Errors: FDA

Headlines: Chronic Vardenafil Treatment Has CV Benefits in Type 2 Diabetes

Headlines: Elderly's Fall Risk With HTN Meds Highest in the Short Term

Headlines: Experimental Kappa Opioid Appears Safe and Effective

Headlines: No New Safety Signals for Botox in Incontinence

Headlines: SGLT2 Inhibitor Diabetes Drugs May Cause Ketoacidosis: FDA

Headlines: Cognitive Impairment Linked to Androgen Deprivation Therapy

Headlines: Falls Not a Major Risk in Seniors on BP-Lowering Therapy: Study
Teaser: With antihypertensive therapy, "we need not worry much about precipitating falls, and in the case of ACE inhibitors and calcium-channel blockers, we may actually reduce that risk," a researcher says.

Headlines: Investigational Drug Effective in Partial-Onset Seizures
Teaser: Results of a phase 3 study of brivaracetam also show the drug is well tolerated with low discontinuation rates.

Headlines: Patients Commonly Stop Antidepressants, Don't Tell Docs
Teaser: Roughly 1 in 5 patients stop taking their antidepressant without telling their doctor.

Headlines: Nitrous Oxide Improves Satisfaction With IUD Insertion
Teaser: Women who inhaled nitrous oxide during intrauterine device (IUD) insertion reported greater satisfaction with the procedure, although pain scores remained unchanged, according to new research.

Headlines: Bill Aims to Expand Drug Indications Minus Randomized Trials
Teaser: The latest draft of 21st Century Cures wins kudos for budgeting more for NIH, but some experts still worry that it would lower the scientific bar for FDA approvals.

Headlines: ASTRO Issues New Radiotherapy Guidelines for NSCLC
Teaser: The American Society for Radiation Oncology has issued a new guideline for the use of definitive and adjuvant radiotherapy in patients with locally advanced non-small cell lung cancer.

Headlines: New Antibiotics Promising in Pneumonia, Abdominal Infection
Teaser: Alternatives to treat drug-resistant bacteria are on the horizon, including a macrolide for community-acquired pneumonia and a tetracycline derivative for complicated abdominal infections.

Headlines: SWOG Study: 2 Effective Pills for AI-Related Pain Relief

Headlines: Sodium Nitrite, Citric Acid Creams Helpful for Anogenital Warts
Teaser: Twice-daily application of sodium nitrite and citric acid creams cleared anogenital warts more effectively than placebo, researchers say.

Headlines: How to Treat Side Effects of New Cancer Immunotherapies
Teaser: A new review article details the major side effects of immunotherapies for cancer and provides advice on how to treat them.

Headlines: Retinal Gene Therapy: Long-term Results Less Than Expected

Headlines: No Need for Premedication Before Blood Transfusion

Headlines: Potential Practice Change in Management of DCIS
Teaser: In a major clinical trial, an aromatase inhibitor was more effective than tamoxifen in preventing disease recurrence.

Headlines: ADA: Two Big Trials and Special 75th Anniversary Celebration
Teaser: Results from two major cardiovascular-outcomes trials will be presented at the 2015 American Diabetes Association Scientific Sessions, as speakers mark 75     years of progress and move the field forward.

Headlines: Sunday at ASCO: News That Will Affect Clinical Practice
Teaser: Today's news from the ASCO meeting comes from the plenary sessions and is expected to have an immediate impact on clinical practice.

Headlines: New Myelofibrosis Drug Works Even With Thrombocytopenia
Teaser: The new drug can be used even in patients with low platelet counts, a subset of patients for which there is currently no approved therapy.

Headlines: Saturday at ASCO: Changes for Prostate Cancer & Melanoma
Teaser: Among the news released today are studies that have potential to change current practice in prostate cancer and melanoma.

Headlines: FDA Clears Sirolimus (Rapamune) for Rare Lung Disease

Teaser: The results are only from a phase 1/2 study, but the percentage of responders compares favorably to currently available systemic therapy.

Headlines: Combination Therapy Improves Bladder Control

Headlines: Cannabis Smoking Common, Affects Cognition in MS

Teaser: Cannabis is becoming increasingly important in pain control, and clinicians must prepare to answer patients' questions about it, according to a leading researcher.

Headlines: Psychomotor Speed Flags DBS Responders With Severe Depression
Teaser: Psychomotor speed may identify which patients with treatment-resistant depression will respond to deep brain stimulation.

Headlines: US and Europe Differ on Use of Vaptans in Hyponatremia
Teaser: A lively debate was held at the recent endocrinology meeting in Dublin about which are the better guidelines for treatment of hyponatremia, those of the US or     Europe, centered on use of vaptans.

Headlines: e-Cigarettes of Questionable Value for Quitting Smoking

Headlines: Brain Stimulation Techniques Promising for Resistant OCD
Teaser: DBS is enjoying something of a comeback with new research on this and other modes of brain stimulation showing encouraging results in treatment-resistant obsessive- compulsive disorder.

Headlines: What's Hot at ASCO 2015?
Teaser: This year's meeting focusses on 'transforming data into learning' to speed up the process of applying results from clinical trials into patient care.

Headlines: Marijuana Doesn't Curb Agitation, Aggression in Dementia

Headlines: Chronic Use of Proton Pump Inhibitors Increases Heart Risk

Headlines: Practical Advice for Treating Skin Toxicity of Regorafenib

Headlines: ESMO Unveils Scale for Assessing Value of Cancer Drugs
Teaser: ESMO says that it intends to apply the scale prospectively to new anticancer drugs that will be approved by the EMA.

Headlines: Geriatrics Society Updates List of Inappropriate Drugs
Teaser: The American Geriatrics Society is updating its list of medications that can be problematic for older adults. Controversial changes to the so-called Beers Criteria are in the works.

Headlines: Lithium Linked to Renal, Endocrine Function

Headlines: Antipsychotics as First-Line Insomnia Treatment a No-No

Headlines: Metformin May Lower Risk of Glaucoma in Elderly

Headlines: Direct Current Stimulation Boosts Cognition in Schizophrenia
Teaser: Transcranial direct current stimulation improves memory, verbal fluency in patients with schizophrenia, but will it last?

Headlines: Sleep Apnea: Mixed Results for Mandibular Appliance

Headlines: Cost Changes Conclusion From Major CRC Trial
Teaser: Last year, the conclusion was that each of two colorectal cancer treatments were equally effective, and so either could be used. What a diference a year makes.

Headlines: FDA Okays Topiramate ER (Qudexy) Monotherapy in Children
Teaser: Once-a-day capsules are now approved as initial monotherapy for children aged 2 years and up with partial-onset seizures or primary generalized tonic-clonic seizures.

Headlines: Some Bird Flu Viruses in US Potential Threat to Humans: CDC
Teaser: Birds infected with highly pathogenic avian influenza A H5 viruses in the United States could cause human infection, the CDC says in a new advisory.

Headlines: Novel Testosterones May Overcome Oral Dosing Hurdles
Teaser: New oral formulations appear to normalize testosterone levels in hypogonadal men and could help overcome the challenges associated with oral dosing.

Headlines: Effects of Alemtuzumab in MS Persist at 4 Years
Teaser: Positive effects of the drug in patients with  relapsing-remitting multiple sclerosis who have very active disease may continue to 4 years.

Headlines: Unprecedented Responses With Daratumumab in Multiple Myeloma
Teaser: The novel anti-CD38 agent produced 'unprecedented overall responses' in heavily pretreated multiple myeloma patients.

Headlines: Novel Drug Mechanism Addresses Parkinson's Psychosis

Headlines: New 'Multiple-Source' DBS Device Looks Good for Parkinson's

Headlines: EMA Panel Likes Multiple Myeloma and Skin Cancer Drugs
Teaser: Two Novartis agents got positive reviews from European authorities.

Headlines: Another PFO Closure Study Yields Mixed Migraine Results
Teaser: The latest trial to investigate patent foramen ovale closure as potential treatment for refractory migraine has again yielded overall negative results but suggests possible benefit for those with aura.

Headlines: Topical Cyclosporine Better for Ocular Rosacea

Headlines: 'Game Changer' for First-Episode Schizophrenia

Headlines: Vitamin D Improves Depression in Women With Liver Disease
Teaser: Symptoms of depression improve in women with chronic liver disease when treated for vitamin D deficiency.

Headlines: New Data on CGRP Monoclonal Antibodies for Migraine Prevention
Teaser: Phase 2 data on calcitonin gene-related peptide monoclonal antibodies show efficacy and safety as potential novel migraine preventives, but experts say larger and longer studies are needed.

Headlines: ASCO Wants Your Feedback on Plan to Define Value in Drugs
Teaser: ASCO has published a draft conceptual framework for assessing the value of new cancer treatment options based on benefit, toxicity, and cost and is seeking public feedback to refine the strategy.

Headlines: Kids With Migraine Not Receiving Optimal Treatment

Headlines: New Drug for Rett Syndrome?
Teaser: Research shows that a new investigational drug is safe, well tolerated, and effective in managing core symptoms of this neurodegenerative genetic disorder.

Headlines: Medical Marijuana Laws Don't Encourage Teen Use

Headlines: Long-Term Topical Corticosteroids Best for Vulvar Lichen Sclerosus

Headlines: Too Many Patients With Migraine Receiving Opioids, Barbiturates
Teaser: A new survey reveals that half of patients with migraine are receiving medications that are not recommended as first-line and that may lead to overdose, addiction, and more frequent headaches.

Headlines: Breast Cancer Trial Results Spin a Cautionary Tale
Teaser: Some clinicians switched to newer, costlier, and more toxic drugs for advanced breast cancer before completion of a head-to-head trial showing that the old drug was similarly effective, cheapest, and least toxic.

Headlines: New Oral Biologic Improves Symptoms in Refractory RA
Teaser: A new oral JAK1/JAK2 inhibitor produces rapid clinical improvement in patients with refractory rheumatoid arthritis (RA), despite previous exposure to multiple biologic agents.

Headlines: Higher Stroke, Death With Balloon Inflation After Carotid Stent

Headlines: FDA Okays Current Label to Manage Eye, Skin Problems With Potiga

Headlines: NSAIDs Dramatically Reduce Ovulation With Consistent Use

Headlines: Synthetic Marijuana an Urgent Public Health Threat

Headlines: Chemoradiotherapy Widens Options in Rectal Cancer

Headlines: Iressa Back in the US for Lung Cancer, Now as First-Line

Headlines: Safety Profile of HPV Vaccines Under Review in Europe

Headlines: Physician Who Gave Unneeded Chemo Gets 45 Years in Prison

Headlines: New Abacus Calculates Price of Cancer Drug Based on Value
Teaser: An innovative interactive tool developed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center tries to put drug costs in context with their overall value.

Headlines: FDA Panel Says Necitumumab Has Benefit in Squamous NSCLC
Teaser: The monoclonal antibody could be approved by late 2015.

Headlines: Pinaverium Effectively Treats IBS Symptoms in RCT

Headlines: Immunotherapy Moves to Community Cancer Setting

Headlines: Uptake of HIV Prevention Starter Kit High in STI Clinics

Headlines: Acute Kidney Injury May Follow BRAF Inhibitor Treatment

Headlines: AIMS Project Improves Adherence, Outcomes in HIV Patients

Headlines: Medical Marijuana: Where's the Evidence?

Headlines: FDA Clears Combo Drug Orkambi for Cystic Fibrosis

Headlines: Endovascular Cooling for OOH Arrest: Little Clinical Gain Seen

Headlines: ICD Recruited for Paddle-Free AF Cardioversion in Small Study
Teaser: "This method is less time-consuming and does not necessitate deep anesthesia compared with external   cardioversion," says the lead author. But advantages     over the standard method remain hypothetical.

Headlines: FDA Reviewing Safety of Codeine for Cough in Kids Under 18
Teaser: The FDA is investigating the safety of using codeine-containing medicines to treat coughs and colds in children younger than 18 years because of the potential for serious adverse effects.

Headlines: California Governor Signs Bill Limiting School Vaccine Exemptions
Teaser: California Governor Jerry Brown on Tuesday signed a bill eliminating the state's personal beliefs exemption for school vaccine requirements - legislation that was prompted by a measles outbreak at Disneyland linked to low vaccination rates.

Headlines: High-Dose Baclofen Supports Abstinence in Alcoholism
Teaser: High-dose baclofen supports abstinence among alcohol-dependent patients compared with placebo and is reasonably well tolerated.

Headlines: CHMP Backs Three Drugs for Rare Diseases
Teaser: The EMA committee backs treatments for lysosomal acid lipase deficiency, alpha1-proteinase inhibitor deficiency, and Leber's hereditary optic neuropathy.

Headlines: ACOG Updates Recommendations to Include 9-Valent HPV Vaccine
Teaser: Only half of teenaged girls have received one dose of the HPV vaccine, but coverage of 80% would reduce cervical cancer burden by 53,000 cases.

Headlines: FDA Clears Two New Oral Drugs for Hepatitis C
Teaser: Technivie, for genotype 4 infection, combines ombitasvir, paritaprevir, and ritonavir and is for use with ribavirin. Daclatasvir, for use with sofosbuvir, is for genotype 3 infection.

Headlines: FDA Approves Sonidegib (Odomzo) for Basal Cell Carcinoma
Teaser: The drug is indicated for use in locally advanced disease

Headlines: Sufentanil Hybrid Receives CHMP Nod for Post-Op Pain
Teaser: The new product, Zalviso, is similar to another sufentanil-containing anesthetic-analgesic that has been available in the Netherlands for decades.

Headlines: AIs, Bisphosphonates Save Lives in Postmenopausal Breast Ca
Teaser: Aromatase inhibitors (AIs) and bisphosphonates both reduce early breast cancer recurrence and mortality in postmenopausal women.

Headlines: CHMP Recommends ADHD Drug for Approval
Teaser: An EMA committee recommended guanfacine in combination with comprehensive behavioral therapy for children and adolescents 6 to 17 years old with attention-deficit/hyperactivity disorder.

Headlines: Positive Biomarker Data for AD Drug, but No Clinical Benefit
Teaser: A biomarker analysis shows the antiamyloid agent gantenerumab yields dose-dependent reductions in brain amyloid and markers of neuronal injury, suggesting the tested dose may have been too low.

Headlines: CDC: Hispanics More Likely to Believe Antibiotics Lessen Colds
Teaser: US Hispanics are almost twice as likely as all patients to believe that taking antibiotics reduces cold symptoms, and nearly three times as likely to obtain antibiotics not prescribed by a clinician.

Headlines: Nondaily Treatment an Option for Those at High Risk for HIV
Teaser: For some people, nondaily pre-exposure prophylaxis is feasible, although adherence and protection is better with daily administration, results from the ADAPT trial show.

Headlines: Meta-Analysis: Cognitive Decline Rare After CV Procedures
Teaser: "The general perception has been there were significant adverse cognitive effects" after these treatments, say researchers. But results suggest that     clinicians "can be a little reassuring" to patients.

Headlines: Calmangafodipir May Reduce Chemo-Induced Neuropathy
Teaser: In colorectal cancer patients treated with the FOLFOX regimen, calmangafodipir reduced the incidence of chemotherapy-induced peripheral neuropathy.

Headlines: Could Dexamethasone Dose Affect Glioblastoma Survival?
Teaser: Dexamethasone is routinely used in the clinical management of glioblastoma, but a new study suggests that high-dose dexamethasone could affect survival.

Headlines: Ultrabrief ECT for Depression May Trump Standard ECT
Teaser: An analysis suggests efficacy similar to that of brief pulse electroconvulsive therapy but with fewer cognitive side effects.

Headlines: Rivastigmine Improves Gait, Reduces Falls in Parkinson's
Teaser: Rivastigmine improved gait in patients with Parkinson's disease and reduced frequency of falls. Falls are a major concern for patients, and fear of falling can lead to loss of mobility and social isolation.

Headlines: Illicit Use of 'Bath Salts' in Teens Much Lower Than Expected
Teaser: A survey of high school seniors has found that just a small minority report using bath salts, but the researchers caution more might be using the psychoactive recreational drug without knowing it.

Headlines: Patiromer Study Published: Approval for Hyperkalemia Soon?
Teaser: A study author says this is the first predictable, well-tolerated potassium binder and will change treatment for life-threatening hyperkalemia. FDA approval     could come this fall.

Headlines: Pneumonitis an Adverse Effect of PD-Inhibitor Immunotherapy
Teaser: Clinicians treating melanoma with programmed cell death (PD) inhibitors report autoimmune pneumonitis as a rare but potentially serious toxic effect.

Headlines: Vasomotor Symptoms Relieved by Escitalopram, E2, Venlafaxine
Teaser: Menopausal women with moderate vasomotor symptoms may find relief from escitalopram, low-dose dose oral 17-beta-estradiol, or venlafaxine, according to a pooled analysis.

Headlines: Mylan Withdraws 14 Lots of Calcium Chloride Prefilled Syringes
Teaser: The action is a precautionary measure as a result of customer complaints citing difficulties in administration of the drug.

Headlines: Single-Dose IV Fosaprepitant Effective for CINV
Teaser: A single IV dose of fosaprepitant was effective and safe for treating nausea and vomiting in subjects undergoing moderately emetogenic chemotherapy.

Headlines: Diabetes Drug Metformin: No Impact on Birth Weight in Obese Pregnancy
Teaser: A metformin study is one of the first clinical trials to investigate preventive treatment in obese pregnant women to protect the unborn child from     long-term effects.

Headlines: Pancreatic Cancer: Who Is Likely to Respond to FOLFIRINOX
Teaser: The enzyme CES2 may identify patients with pancreatic cancer who are likely to respond to treatment with irinotecan in the FOLFIRINOX regimen.

Headlines: Ipilimumab Side Effects in Real World, and What to Do
Teaser: Real-world immune-related adverse events with ipilimumab may be higher than clinical trials suggest; experts give advice on how to deal with them.

Headlines: FDA Approves 'Female Viagra' Flibanserin (Addyi)
Teaser: The manufacturer aims to have the drug available for sale starting October 17.

Headlines: Dementia Drugs Linked to Serious Weight Loss
Teaser: Cholinesterase inhibitors, commonly used to treat dementia, are associated with significant, potentially serious, weight loss in elderly dementia patients.

Headlines: New Hydrogel Drug-Delivery Method Targets Colon Inflammation
Teaser: A preclinical study has shown that hydrogel loaded with dexamethasone reduced epithelial inflammation in the colon more than free dexamethasone.

Headlines: Antidepressants in Pregnancy: Good News, Bad News
Teaser: SSRIs in pregnant women with depression have been linked to reduced rates of preterm birth and cesarean delivery. However, the drugs are also tied to a higher risk for neonatal complications.

Headlines: Memory Problems Due to 'Cancer Brain' and Not 'Chemo Brain'?
Teaser: A study in postmenopausal women with newly diagnosed breast cancer has linked pretreatment cytokine levels to memory problems.

Headlines: NICE Still Has It Wrong on Type 2 Diabetes Guidance, Say Docs
Teaser: UK NICE is wedded to some illogical recommendations with regard to pharmacotherapy of type 2 diabetes in the latest draft of its new guidance on treatment,     says a group of experts.

Headlines: Seniors Twice as Likely to Receive Psychotropic Meds
Teaser: Older adults are more likely to receive psychotropic medications and less likely to see a psychiatrist than younger adults, data from a major health survey indicate.

Headlines: 'Female Viagra' Foes Denounce PR Campaign to Win FDA Approval
Teaser: Opponents of flibanserin say an orchestrated appeal to gender justice masks the marginal effectiveness and significant health risks of a drug for low female libido.

Headlines: Reduced Access to Meds After Crackdown on Illegal Rx Drug Trade
Teaser: An unintended side effect of a crackdown on prescription drug abuse affects chronic pain patients’ access to medication.

Headlines: 'Mounting Evidence' for Hypofractionation in Breast Cancer
Teaser: Two studies add support for hypofractionation of radiation following surgery for early-stage breast cancer.

Headlines: 'Sensational' Hep C Response Rates in HIV Coinfection Trial
Teaser: C-EDGE trial investigators report very high sustained virologic response rates in patients taking grazoprevir and elbasvir coformulated in a single tablet.

Headlines: Did HHS Cancel Proposed FDA Limits on Mercury Fillings?
Teaser: "We are still working on securing (HHS) clearance," an FDA official told an attorney in a lawsuit seeking to ban the use of dental amalgam in pregnant women, nursing mothers, and children aged less than 6 years.

Headlines: Large Study Backs Switch to Next-Gen Tenofovir for HIV
Teaser: Tenofovir alafenamide is as effective as the standard formulation in maintaining viral suppression over 48 weeks, and might have bone- and renal-sparing effects, report investigators.

Headlines: CHMP Backs Antifungal Isavuconazole (Cresemba)
Teaser: The triazole antifungal is indicated for treatment of adults with invasive aspergillosis and mucormycosis in patients for whom amphotericin B is not appropriate.

Headlines: Teva Recalls Six More Lots of Fluorouracil Injection
Teaser: The recall of Adrucil is due to the potential presence of particulate matter identified as an aggregate of silicone rubber pieces from a filler diaphragm and fluorouracil crystals.

Headlines: What Now, ARNI? Experts Ponder Newly Arrived Heart-Failure Drug
Teaser: Although enthusiasm is widespread, "we aren't ready to offer this to everyone who comes to our office," says one expert. "Especially because we didn't have     the benefit of an FDA panel review."

Headlines: Gadolinium Brain Deposits on FDA Radar
Teaser: The FDA is investigating the potential risk for brain deposits with repeated use of gadolinium contrast agents for MRI.

Headlines: SWOG Trial Defines a Regimen for Biliary Cancer
Teaser: Adjuvant capecitabine and gemcitabine followed by radiotherapy and capecitabine was well tolerated and effective in the treatment of extrahepatic cholangiocarcinoma and gallbladder carcinoma.

Headlines: Leukotriene-Receptor Antagonists Improve Asthma Control
Teaser: Leukotriene-receptor antagonists, alone or with inhaled corticosteroids, significantly improved asthma control and reduced exacerbations, according to a systematic review.

Headlines: FDA Reviewing Risk With Off-Label Tramadol Use in Children
Teaser: The FDA is investigating the risk for respiratory problems in children aged 17 years and younger treated with the pain medication tramadol.

Headlines: Case Reports of 'Syndrome' Appearing After HPV Vaccination
Teaser: Clinicians are reporting a syndrome of pain, fatigue, and autonomic dysfunction appearing after human papillomavirus (HPV) vaccination.

Headlines: FDA Investigates Risk for Reprocessed Bronchoscopes
Teaser: So far, the agency has found that problems revolve around not following the manufacturer's directions for reprocessing precisely or not replacing scopes when damage is evident.

Headlines: Tips for Managing CV Toxicity With TKIs in Leukemia Patients
Teaser: A new review covers cardiovascular (CV) toxicity for patients with chronic myeloid leukemia (CML) on tyrosine kinase inhibitors (TKIs), and provides practical recommendations on management.

Headlines: FDA Okays New Atypical for Schizophrenia, Bipolar Disorder
Teaser: The FDA has approved a new atypical antipsychotic for the treatment of schizophrenia and bipolar disorder in adults.

Headlines: Number Using Opioids and Marijuana on the Rise
Teaser: A new study shows use of these two drugs together is increasing, which could signal a worrisome trend, researchers say.

Headlines: FDA Strengthens Fracture Warning for Canagliflozin
Teaser: New clinical trial data for canagliflozin confirmed previously noted risk about fractures and reduced bone mineral density in the hip and spine, prompting the FDA to revise the product label.

Headlines: No CVD/Psychiatric Risk With Varenicline: Analysis
Teaser: The label warns of the potential for cardiovascular risks with the smoking-cessation aid, as well as a boxed warning concerning neuropsychiatric side     effects, but a new analysis did not find evidence of such risks.

Headlines: EMPA-REG OUTCOME Results Top EASD Agenda in Stockholm
Teaser: This year's European Association for the Study of Diabetes Meeting will feature the much-anticipated results of the cardiovascular-outcomes study with     empagliflozin, among other exciting topics.

Headlines: Test Predicts Drug Response in Depression, Anxiety
Teaser: Pharmacogenomic testing predicts patient response to psychotropic medications and enhances treatment outcomes by identifying the best drug for individual patients, a new study suggests.

Headlines: Unilateral Equal to Bitemporal ECT in Depression
Teaser: High-dose unilateral electroconvulsive therapy is as effective as the more conventional bitemporal approach and has fewer cognitive effects, randomized trial results show.

Headlines: Telomerase Inhibitor Imetelstat Reverses Marrow Fibrosis
Teaser: The investigational agent induced complete and partial remissions in some patients with myeloproliferative disorders, but the mechanism of action is unclear.

Headlines: SCOT: Good Risk/Benefit Trade-Off With Celecoxib, Other NSAIDs
Teaser: Criticized for its limitations, the trial's researchers say low rates of side effects and CV events in the trial should reassure that celecoxib and     standard NSAIDs can be acceptable chronically in such patients; not all agree.

Headlines: Diuretic Combo Lowers BP, No Effect on Glucose Metabolism
Teaser: Adding the potassium-sparing diuretic amiloride to HCTZ amplified the blood-pressure reductions of each drug and offset the undesirable changes in blood     glucose and potassium, report the PATHWAY investigators.

Headlines: Ustekinumab Found to Be Effective in Adolescents With Psoriasis
Teaser: Adolescents with moderate to severe psoriasis may respond to the human monoclonal antibody ustekinumab as well as adults, with no unexpected side effects, a new study found.

Headlines: PRIDE Continues to Support ECT in Depressed Elderly
Teaser: Updated findings from the PRIDE trial continue to support right unilateral electrode placement and ultrabrief pulse ECT to achieve robust and rapid response in geriatric major depressive disorder.

Headlines: AF Recurs Despite Strategies Added to AF Ablation in Trials
Teaser: The use of antiarrhythmic drugs for 90 days after an AF ablation did not reduce AF/AT recurrence at 1 year, nor did the use of adenosine to guide     pulmonary-vein isolation ablation procedures, report investigators.

Headlines: Young Women Refuse Tamoxifen Because of Fertility Concerns
Teaser: Concerns about fertility can influence adherence to endocrine therapy in young women with breast cancer, a new study suggests.

Headlines: Effectiveness of Cancer Survivorship Care Plans Questioned
Teaser: Survivorship care plans have been recommended for cancer survivors to  improve their quality of care, but a Dutch study questions their benefits.

Headlines: FDA Clears Two-Drug Combo as First-Line Treatment for PAH
Teaser: Ambrisentan plus tadalafil in newly diagnosed pulmonary arterial hypertension reduces risk of disease worsening and improves exercise ability.

Headlines: Brentuximab -- First-Line Option in Elderly Hodgkin's Lymphoma
Teaser: A phase 2 trial has shown that brentuximab vedotin monotherapy is safe and effective as first-line therapy in elderly lymphoma patients who cannot tolerate standard chemotherapy.

Headlines: Metformin Intolerance Increased by Genes, Other Meds
Teaser: In two studies, certain gene variants and medications that inhibit the action of a metformin transporter in the gut increased the likelihood of drug     gastrointestinal side effects.

Headlines: Novel Interleukin 17 Antibody Quickly Reduces Psoriasis
Teaser: Brodalumab cleared 100% of plaque in twice as many patients as ustekinumab, but the safety profile needs more study.

Headlines: Pulmonary Fibrosis Treatment Trickier Than Drug Trials Imply
Teaser: In real-world patients with idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis, the mortality rate is higher than clinical trials have suggested, and disease is more severe, a German registry reveals.

Headlines: FDA Approves Pembrolizumab for Lung Cancer
Teaser: This is the second immunotherapy to be approved for lung cancer; a host of others are waiting in the wings.

Headlines: Metyrapone Appears Effective in Cushing's Syndrome in Long Term
Teaser: The steroidogenesis inhibitor metyrapone appears to be an effective short- and long-term treatment for Cushing's syndrome (CS), according to a new retrospective multicenter study.

Headlines: FDA Okays Juvederm Ultra XC for Lip Augmentation
Teaser: The dermal filler is now indicated for injection into the lips and perioral area for lip augmentation in adults older than 21 years.

Headlines: Synthetic Marijuana Linked to Subarachnoid Hemorrhage
Teaser: Neurologists are concerned about this possible new adverse effect of chemical-rich synthetic cannabis products.

Headlines: Depression Outcomes Not Improved With Decision Aid for Meds
Teaser: A deck of cards meant to help patients and clinicians collaborate on a decision about antidepressants led to better satisfaction for both, but did not improve outcomes or adherence.

Headlines: Intravitreous Melphalan Can Have Anterior Segment Toxic Effects
Teaser: Intravitreous injection of melphalan can have toxic effects in the anterior eye segment in addition to well established effects in the posterior segment, a new study shows.

Headlines: Cancer Treatment Should Not Be Delayed During Pregnancy
Teaser: Women diagnosed with cancer during pregnancy can be safely treated during the second and third trimesters without harming the fetus.

Headlines: Hypertonic Saline Effective for Infants With Bronchiolitis
Teaser: Nebulized hypertonic saline is a safe and effective treatment for infants with acute bronchiolitis, according to a new study.

Headlines: Genvoya, a Gentler Anti-HIV Cocktail, Okayed by EU Regulators
Teaser: A new version of tenofovir in the once-a-day tablet makes it safer for bones and kidneys than its predecessor Stribild.

Headlines: Poison-Center Data: Factor Xa Inhibitor Bleeding 'Rare'
Teaser: Overingestion of two NOACs showed bleeding events only after long-term use, and no toxicity in kids who took a family member's pills, leading one expert to     call the study "a reassuring first step."

Headlines: Report Endorsing e-Cigarettes Called Into Question
Teaser: A report by the government public health agency in England supporting the use of e-cigarettes as a smoking cessation aid is based on insufficient evidence, two experts say.

Headlines: EU Panel Likes Multiple Myeloma, Leukemia, Melanoma Drugs
Teaser: A recommendation from the Committee for Medicinal Products for Human Use usually results in eventual marketing approval.

Headlines: CHMP Backs Mepolizumab for Severe Eosinophilic Asthma
Teaser: The European Medicines Agency committee recommended approval of the novel anti-IL-5 biologic as add-on maintenance treatment in adults with severe refractory eosinophilic asthma.

Headlines: Switching AED Forms Improves Seizure Control for ID Patients
Teaser: Seizure control improved by 50% when patients with epilepsy and intellectual disability were switched from a liquid to a granule form of levetiracetam, a study shows. Gut absorption may be the reason.

Headlines: FDA Warns of Risk for Dosing Errors With Avycaz
Teaser: Three reports of medication errors caused by confusion over the drug strength displayed on the label of the intravenous antibacterial combination ceftazidime-avibactam (Avycaz) prompts label change.

Headlines: Simplified Antiretrovirals Outperform Typical HIV Treatment
Teaser: Viral suppression at 48 weeks was better with a two-pill regimen than a with a conventional five-pill antiretroviral approach, a new study indicates.

Headlines: FDA Approves Praxbind to Reverse Anticoagulant Pradaxa
Teaser: The FDA has approved Praxbind, a drug designed to rapidly reverse the anticoagulant effects of Pradaxa.

Headlines: 'Ground-Breaking' Ocrelizumab Data Dominate ECTRIMS
Teaser: The results of three new phase 3 studies with the new anti-B cell humanized antibody for multiple sclerosis were the major talking point among delegates attending the recent ECTRIMS meeting in Barcelona.

Headlines: Homeopathy Doc Gives Up Florida License After Toddler Death
Teaser: The medical examiner ruled no intent to cause harm, but two medical boards found substandard care.

Headlines: Epilepsy App Tracks Seizures
Teaser: Information gathered with the new interactive app, downloaded to the Apple Watch, will be used to develop a seizure detector.

Headlines: Does Exercise Improve Survival in Cancer?
Teaser: Evidence suggests that exercise and other lifestyle changes may protect against certain cancer types, but the jury is out as to whether it actually improves outcomes after diagnosis.

Headlines: Supplements Tied to 23K Emergency Department Visits Annually
Teaser: Lightly regulated dietary supplements send 23,005 Americans to emergency departments each year, with young patients likely to suffer cardiac woes and older patients likely to have problems swallowing.

Headlines: Impact of START Trial Center Stage at European AIDS Meeting
Teaser: New results on antiretroviral therapy and the fight against AIDS and other infectious diseases in Europe will be highlights of the meeting.

Headlines: Old Drug Has New Promise in MS
Teaser: Minocycline, an antibiotic that has been around for decades, reduced the risk for progression from clinically isolated syndrome to definite multiple sclerosis in a new study.

Headlines: Stimulants Safe in Children With ADHD and Heart Disease
Teaser: Stimulant medications for the treatment of ADHD in children with congenital heart disease are as safe and effective as they are for children with no underlying heart condition.

Headlines: Fluid Management: Buffered Crystalloid No Benefit vs Saline
Teaser: Among patients in the ICU receiving crystalloid fluid therapy, use of a buffered crystalloid compared with saline did not reduce the risk for acute kidney injury in a randomized trial.

Headlines: Alemtuzumab in MS: Still Looks Good at 5 Years
Teaser: New 5-year data from the pivotal phase 3 trials show alemtuzumab (Lemtrada, Genzyme) continues to be associated with low rates of disease progression and brain atrophy in patients with relapsing MS.

Headlines: FDA Expands Use of Nivolumab in Lung Cancer
Teaser: The new use is in nonsquamous, non-small-cell lung cancer (NSCLC). The drug was approved for squamous NSCLC earlier in the year.

Headlines: Experimental Tardive Dyskinesia Drug Hits Mark in Phase 3
Teaser: Neurocrine Biosciences' drug NBI-98854 eases symptoms of tardive dyskinesia in a phase 3 study.

Headlines: Women Are Demanding, and Receiving, Compounded Hormones
Teaser: The North American Menopause Society offers strict recommendations but little guidance on how to stem the tide, reminding physicians that they are legally bound to prescribe the FDA-approved products.

Headlines: More Data on Daclizumab in MS: DECIDE Published
Teaser: 2015 meeting shows more patients had 'no evidence of disease activity' with daclizumab vs beta interferon.

Headlines: Ankle Fracture: No Added Value With Supervised Exercise Rehab
Teaser: After ankle fracture, a supervised exercise program does not improve recovery of activity limitation or quality of life compared with advice alone, according to a new randomized trial.

Headlines: Orphan Drug Shown Effective for LEMS Weakness
Teaser: The study was designed to finally earn FDA approval for 3,4 DAP, long used to treat Lambert-Eaton myasthenic syndrome on a compassionate basis.

Headlines: FDA Expands Indication for Optune Device in Glioblastoma
Teaser: The FDA has expanded the indication for the Optune device so it can be used as adjunct therapy in newly diagnosed patients with glioblastoma multiforme.

Headlines: Psoriatic Arthritis: Phase 3 Data Confirm Secukinumab Efficacy
Teaser: The FUTURE 1 trial has confirmed that selective inhibition of IL-17A improves signs and symptoms of psoriatic arthritis for 1 year.

Headlines: Thyroid Hormone Common Contaminant in Weight-Loss Supplements
Teaser: A sampling of the most popular over-the-counter weight-loss supplements shows a third contain thyroid hormone, some at alarming levels.

Headlines: HPV Vaccination Rates Low Among Adolescent Males
Teaser: Human papilloma virus vaccination rates in adolescent males have increased in recent years, but remain very low, a new study has showed.

Headlines: FDA Panel Backs Lesinurad (Zurampic) for Gout
Teaser: An FDA advisory committee recommended approval of lesinurad for the treatment of gout-associated hyperuricemia, in combination with a xanthine oxidase inhibitor.

Headlines: New EMA Advice on PML Prevention With Tecfidera in MS
Teaser: The European Medicines Agency today issued recommendations on ways to minimize the risk for PML with dimethyl fumarate (Tecfidera), as well as with Fumaderm and Psorinovo, fumarates used in psoriasis.

Headlines: Pervasive Environmental Toxin Linked to Pregnancy Loss
Teaser: A new study suggests a link between biochemical pregnancy loss in women using in vitro fertilization or intrauterine insemination who have high levels of phthalates in their urine.

Headlines: Shorter RT Convenient Option for Low-Risk Prostate Cancer
Teaser: A shorter radiation schedule provides disease-free survival rates similar to those of conventional radiation, and it is more convenient than the more traditional approach.

Headlines: FDA Approves Trabectedin for Two Soft Tissue Sarcomas
Teaser: Researchers saw no improvement in overall survival in the pivotal US trial, but there are explanations for that.

Headlines: Viekira Pak, Technivie May Up Serious Liver Injury Risk: FDA
Teaser: The hepatitis C infection treatments Viekira Pak and Technivie may increase the risk for serious injury, particularly in those with underlying liver disease, the FDA warns.

Headlines: FDA Approves Relypsa's Drug Veltassa to Treat Hyperkalemia
Teaser: The U.S. Food and Drug Administration approved Relypsa Inc's drug Veltassa (patiromer for oral suspension) to treat hyperkalemia in patients with chronic kidney disease or heart problems.

Headlines: New Clues Why ‘Pear-Shaped' Women Less Likely to get Diabetes
Teaser: A study found variants determine where body fat is stored and the regulation of fat cells.

Headlines: Approved But Not Proven: What's Up With FDA, Cancer Drugs?
Teaser: How many approved cancer drugs actually pan out in terms of a survival benefit?

Headlines: Dual Therapy No Better Than NSAIDs Alone for Low Back Pain
Teaser: In patients with acute nontraumatic lower back pain, adding cyclobenzaprine or oxycodone/acetaminophen to naproxen alone did not improve functional outcomes or pain at 1 week.

Headlines: NCCN Unveils New 'Evidence Blocks' Initiative
Teaser: The NCCN has developed a novel system that will make it easier for the provider and patient to make informed choices when selecting systemic therapies.

Headlines: FDA Approves Oral Potassium-Binder Patiromer (Veltassa)
Teaser: It's been shown in trials to safely normalize serum potassium levels in patients taking drugs known to raise potassium, including aldosterone blockers and ACE inhibitors.

Headlines: High Maternal Thyroid Function Affects Offspring Brain Development
Teaser: The study is the first to show a link between high maternal thyroid function, as well as low, and neurodevelopment of offspring in childhood as assessed by     IQ and MRI brain scanning.

Headlines: Partial as Good as Whole-Breast Irradiation -- Clear Result
Teaser: A technique of temporary implanting of catheters to deliver radiotherapy for 4 to 5 days was as effective as whole-breast irradiation for 5 weeks.

Headlines: Concerns Over Sudden Increase in Radiation for Skin Cancer
Teaser: The use of first-line electronic brachytherapy for nonmelanoma skin cancer has risen 20-fold, raising concerns over inappropriate use.

Headlines: Men's Health Supplements Useless in Prostate Cancer Patients
Teaser: Men's health supplements marketed to promote prostate health have absolutely no benefit on outcomes or toxicities in men undergoing radiation therapy for prostate cancer.

Headlines: Steroid Reduces Flare After Radiation for Bone Metastases
Teaser: A few doses of steroid reduces the risk for and severity of pain flares that can occur immediately after radiation therapy, before the pain starts to recede.

Headlines: Green Light for Less Therapy for HPV Oropharyngeal Cancer
Teaser: Mounting evidence suggests that deintensification is feasible and that it reduces toxicity without compromising survival.

Headlines: FDA Panel Says Fluoroquinolones Need Stronger Warnings
Teaser: Fluoroquinolone labels need much stronger warnings about the risks for serious adverse events, according to members of two FDA committees.

Headlines: Transcranial Stimulation May Quell Cravings in Obese Subjects
Teaser: Stimulating the prefrontal cortex may alter food-reward circuits in the brain, diminish cravings, and lead to weight loss, a small proof-of-principle trial     suggests.

Headlines: FDA Clears New Combo Pill Genvoya for HIV-1 Infection
Teaser: Genvoya combines elvitegravir, cobicistat, emtricitabine, and a new form of tenofovir, which appears to have a better safety profile than tenofovir disoproxil fumarate.

Headlines: NEPA Added to ASCO Guildelines on Antiemetic Use
Teaser: The new combination product of netupitant and palonosetron (known as NEPA) has been included in an expedited update of antiemetic guidelines.

Headlines: Europe Concludes Syndromes Are Not Caused by HPV Vaccine
Teaser: The European Medicines Agency has concluded its safety review of the HPV vaccines, and says the evidence does not support causation of syndromes.

Headlines: First Precision Medicine Chemoprevention Trial Disappoints
Teaser: In the first precision-based chemoprevention study, erlotinib failed to significantly prevent the development of oral cancer in patients with oral premalignant lesions.

Headlines: FDA Approves Mepolizumab (Nucala) for Severe Asthma
Teaser: The FDA has approved mepolizumab (Nucala, GlaxoSmithKline) in combination with other asthma medications for maintenance treatment of patients aged 12 years or older with severe asthma.

Headlines: Researchers Say Path to Better Health Starts With Patients' Input
Teaser: The Patient-Centered Outcomes Research Institute, which has funded 468 studies, is creating research networks that will cover specific diseases involving millions of patients across the country.

Headlines: More Positive Results With Cannabidiol in Epilepsy
Teaser: Six-month data on an investigational cannabidiol product in children with intractable epilepsy are encouraging, investigators say.

Headlines: IBD Patients May Accept Riskier Drugs to Get Durable Remissions
Teaser: Patients with inflammatory bowel disease may be willing to accept as much as a 28% risk of a serious infection and a 1.8% chance of developing lymphoma with a newer, more effective therapy than currently exists, a new study suggests.

Headlines: T3 Analog Triac Improves Allan-Herndon-Dudley Syndrome
Teaser: Triac, a T3 analog, has been shown to significantly boost T3 levels in patients with Allan-Herndon-Dudley syndrome, a rare genetic disorder characterized     by intellectual disability and movement problems.

Headlines: Biosimilars, Tech Advances, Chikungunya Among ACR Highlights
Teaser: More than 16,000 attendees at the American College of Rheumatology (ACR) meeting will hear about the latest technology and resources to make their practices more efficient.

Headlines: Meds Seldom Deintensified in Elderly Diabetics: VA Study
Teaser: "We found that only one in four of nearly 400,000 older patients who could have been eligible to ease up on their multiple BP or blood sugar medicines     actually had their dosage changed."

Headlines: Experts Disagree Over Focal Therapy for Prostate Cancer
Teaser: Arguments over focal therapy for prostate cancer assume greater urgency following the FDA's approval of a device for focal prostate tissue ablation.

Headlines: Low-dose Ketamine Eases Pain, Reduces Opioid Use in ED
Teaser: Studies have already shown an analgesic benefit for the sedative at higher doses, but with more serious adverse events, investigators say.

Headlines: Iodine May Be Safer Alternative for Graves' Disease in Pregnancy
Teaser: A Japanese study "suggests that the view that we have about iodine being dangerous to the hyperthyroid person and to the fetus may need to be revised,"     says an expert observer.

Headlines: Experimental Agent Shows Promise for Alcohol Dependence
Teaser: The compound OSU6162 reduces 'liking' and craving for alcohol in alcohol-dependent adults by normalizing dopamine levels in the brain.

Headlines: FDA Approves Ipilimumab (Yervoy) for Use in Stage III Melanoma
Teaser: Ipilimumab is now approved for use as an adjuvant therapy for patients with resectable melanoma that has spread to the lymph nodes, the agency announced today.

Headlines: FDA Approves Imlygic, First Oncolytic Viral Therapy in the US
Teaser: The FDA has given the green light to talimogene laherparepvec for the treatment of advanced melanoma, making it the first oncolytic viral therapy to be approved for sale in the United States.

Headlines: FDA Review Finds No Increased CV Risk With Entacapone in PD
Teaser: An FDA review has found no increased cardiovascular risk linked to use of entacapone in the treatment of Parkinson’s disease.

Headlines: Brazil Study: Gastric Balloon Valid Option, but Outcomes Not Durable
Teaser: In this multicenter study of more than 3000 people, excess weight loss was greater in less obese patients, and there was only one gastric perforation, but     weight loss didn't last, despite multidisciplinary support.

Headlines: Rituximab Emerging as New Option for Membranous Nephropathy
Teaser: The treatment of membranous nephropathy remains controversial, but new data suggest that adding rituximab to nonimmunosuppresive antiproteinuric therapy is an option.

Headlines: Viekira Pak Results Reassuring for Compensated Cirrhosis
Teaser: For patients with genotype 1 hepatitis C infection and cirrhosis, the combination of ombitasvir, paritaprevir, and ritonavir plus dasabuvir, with or without ribavirin, is safe and effective.

Headlines: Empagliflozin's CV Gains Explored in Diabetics With, Without HF
Teaser: Given the specter of associated heart failure with some antidiabetic medications, deeper analysis of the recently reported EMPA-REG OUTCOME trial of the SGLT2 inhibitor may reassure.

Headlines: Daratumumab Approved for Multiple Myeloma in US
Teaser: The first monoclonal antibody for use in multiple myeloma, daratumumab (Darzalex), has just been approved by the FDA.

Headlines: Clozapine Best Choice for Treatment-Resistant Schizophrenia
Teaser: Treatment-resistant schizophrenia patients have better outcomes with clozapine compared with other standard antipsychotics, but despite its superior efficacy, the drug remains vastly underutilized.

Headlines: Filgotinib Shows Potential in Rheumatoid Arthritis
Teaser: Response to the Janus kinase 1 inhibitor was good in patients with rheumatoid arthritis who have highly active disease despite methotrexate therapy, new research showed.

Headlines: Chronic Symptoms After HPV Vaccination: Danes Start Study
Teaser: Danish specialists are investigating more than 1300 girls with chronic symptoms after HPV vaccination.

Headlines: Candesartan May Cut Cardiotoxicity in Breast Cancer Patients
Teaser: Adjuvant candesartan (but not metoprolol) showed "significant but modest" attenuation of LVEF changes after cancer therapy. More research is needed, but     "this study is a key first step," notes one expert.

Headlines: Deeper Grasp of Chemotherapy-Induced Peripheral Neuropathy
Teaser: Two unrelated studies provide deeper insights into chemotherapy-induced peripheral neuropathy.

Headlines: Big Trials Disappoint at Kidney Week
Teaser: The mystifying relation between vascular complications and kidney disorders has investigators stumped after negative results from three highly anticipated trials of statins, steroids, and fish oils.

Headlines: Gastric-Balloon 'Pill' Shows Early Promise in Weight Loss
Teaser: This novel gastric balloon is swallowed and later excreted, without the need for endoscopy and anesthesia; however, this is an experimental device in early     stages of research.

Headlines: Perioperative Medication Errors Plague Surgeries
Teaser: Previous literature on perioperative medication error rates underestimated true error rates, according to a new prospective study.

Headlines: FDA Approves Cotellic as Part of Melanoma Combination
Teaser: The MEK inhibitor cobimetinib (Cotellic, Roche) works with already-approved vemurafenib for the treatment of advanced melanoma that is BRAF mutation-positive.

Headlines: RA: No 'Sound Evidence' to Support Use of Cannabinoids
Teaser: Available studies do not support the use of medical marijuana in rheumatic disorders, although there is merit to further research, authors of a  systematic review concluded.

Headlines: Bariatric Surgery May Aid Very Obese Teens, 3-Year Data Show
Teaser: In the longest-ever prospective study of very obese teens who had gastric bypass or sleeve gastrectomy, the teens maintained a weight loss of 28% at 3     years, with manageable side effects.

Headlines: Varenicline Started in ACS Hospitalization Helps Smokers Quit
Teaser: UPDATED // In a randomized trial, a rare successful showing for a smoking-cessation medication in this particularly sick population, abstinence at 24 weeks was     confirmed by carbon-monoxide breath analysis.

Headlines: NY Docs Must Complete 4-Hour CME to Prescribe Marijuana
Teaser: Advocates said that the cost and time of the required course will dampen enthusiasm.

Headlines: Adverse Reaction to Aspirin Often Misdiagnosed as Allergy
Teaser: Many physicians erroneously label adverse reactions to aspirin as allergic, depriving cardiology patients of access to cost-effective therapy.

Headlines: NEAT-HFpEF: Activity Levels Fall on Nitrates in Preserved-EF HF
Teaser: There wasn't much neat about treatment with isosorbide mononitrate in the small randomized trial; it didn't improve functional capacity or quality-of-life     measures and may even have harmed.

Headlines: FDA Approves Nivolumab for Renal Cell Carcinoma
Teaser: The immunotherapy is the first treatment to show a survival benefit as a second-line therapy in patients with advanced disease.

Headlines: New Strategies but Modest Benefit in Uveal Melanoma
Teaser: New therapies being tried in uveual melanoma include combination everolimus, pasireotide long-acting release, and the MEK inhibitor trametinib.

Headlines: EMA Panel Backs Episalvan for Partial-Thickness Wounds
Teaser: Made from birch bark extract, Episalvan can reduce the healing time of wounds in which the upper layers of the skin have been damaged, for example by a burn or during surgical skin grafting.

Headlines: New Dry Eye Gel Improves Some, but Not All, Symptoms
Teaser: A carbomer-based lipid-containing artificial tear formulation improved patients' ocular surface staining grades and ocular irritation symptom scores and decreased symptoms in patients with dry eye.

Headlines: No Ranolazine Benefit Against Angina Seen in Small-Vessel CAD
Teaser: The antianginal agent didn't overall reduce symptoms due to microvascular disease in the small trial, although it may have helped in patients with the poorest coronary flow reserve.

Headlines: CHMP Recommends EU Approval for Brivaracetam
Teaser: The Committee for Medicinal Products for Human Use recommends marketing approval for brivaracetam (Briviact, UCB Pharma SA) as adjunctive therapy for partial-onset seizures.

Headlines: Europe Again Says HPV Vax Safe,  but Petition in Spain
Teaser: Europe has again said that HPV vaccination is safe and that it is not causally linked to chronic syndromes, but some doctors remain unconvinced.

Headlines: FDA Okays Ixazomib, Another Multiple Myeloma Drug
Teaser: This is the third approval this year for the treatment of the blood cancer.

Headlines: EMA Recommends Approval of Pitolisant (Wakix) for Narcolepsy
Teaser: Pitolisant is a first-in-class drug that increases histamine release in the brain to enhance wakefulness and alertness.

Headlines: Myosin-Activating Heart-Failure Med Advances in Small Trial
Teaser: Omecamtiv mecarbil in oral form seemed to improve ventricular function, dimensions, and volumes, and in general appeared safe despite one disagreeable,     eyebrow-raising biomarker signal.

Headlines: Sustained-Release Bimatoprost Lowers Intraocular Pressure
Teaser: The reduction in intraocular pressure was significant in glaucoma patients treated with the bimatoprost implant, 6-month results from the 24-month study suggest.

Headlines: Canadian Dermatologists Issue New Acne Treatment Guidelines
Teaser: Canadian researchers have published evidence-based guidelines to aid in treating acne, which affects up to 85% of adolescents and young adults.

Headlines: SPRINT and BP Management: 'Groundbreaking' but Questions Remain
Teaser: "If I had a patient with characteristics of SPRINT and they could tolerate the medication and were willing to go through more steps of titration, I'd want to try to get them to 120," said one expert.

Headlines: tPA for Stroke: Reassuring Results for Patients on Antiplatelets
Teaser: A new study representing the largest clinical experience of thrombolysis for stroke in patients receiving antiplatelet therapy suggests the overall benefits may outweigh the risks in this population.

Headlines: Early Azithromycin Reduces Severe Respiratory Tract Infections
Teaser: Children with recurrent wheeze who received azithromycin at the start of each respiratory tract infection were less likely to need oral corticosteroids later, a randomized trial showed.

Headlines: Anaphylaxis Risk Highest With IV Iron Dextran
Teaser: For patients receiving a first dose of an intravenous iron product, iron dextran had more than three times the risk for anaphylaxis as did iron sucrose.

Headlines: New Approach to Fibromyalgia Tackles Poor-Quality Sleep
Teaser: For patients with fibromyalgia, improving the quality of sleep can help improve other features of the syndrome, including pain, new analyses show.

Headlines: Dyspnea, Minor Bleeds Led Causes for Stopping Ticagrelor in Trial
Teaser: "As clinicians we shouldn't underestimate the impact on patients of nosebleeds and bruising," said a PEGASUS TIMI 54 researcher, so before treatment patients should hear about even nonmajor risks.

Headlines: What Charlie Sheen's Reveal Means for HIV
Teaser: Charlie Sheen reveals he is HIV positive.

Headlines: Acute Kidney Injury Linked to BRAF Inhibitors in Melanoma
Teaser: Treatment with vemurafenib and dabrafenib was associated with acute renal toxicity in patients with melanoma, according to data from the FDA Adverse Event Reporting System.

Headlines: FDA Adds Warnings to SGLT2 Inhibitors
Teaser: The FDA has updated warnings in the labels for SGLT2 inhibitors to include the risks for ketoacidosis and severe urinary tract infections.

Headlines: New Survivorship Care Plan Template for Radiation Oncology
Teaser: A comprehensive American Society of Radiation template, intended for specialists and primary care clinicians, aims to standardize and streamline post-treatment care.

Headlines: Metformin Doesn't Improve HbA1c in Kids with Type 1 Diabetes
Teaser: Adding metformin to insulin did not improve glycemic control in obese and overweight adolescents with type 1 diabetes but did lead to a reduction in     insulin dose and some weight loss.

Headlines: Fewer Labs OK for Patients Treated With Isotretinoin for Acne
Teaser: Minimal laboratory monitoring early in the course of isotretinoin therapy in patients with acne may be sufficient, according to a new study.

Headlines: EMA OKs Nucala for Severe Refractory Eosinophilic Asthma
Teaser: The European Medicines Agency has approved mepolizumab as an add-on treatment for severe refractory eosinophilic asthma in adults.

Headlines: Zafgen Says Second Patient Dies in Obesity Drug Trial
Teaser: A second patient died in a late-stage trial of Zafgen Inc's experimental obesity treatment, beloranib.

Headlines: Novel Depression Drug Hits Regulatory Roadblock
Teaser: An FDA advisory committee determined that the evidence backing gepirone does not support its approval as a treatment for major depression.

Headlines: ELIXA Published: Reiterates CV Safety of Lixisenatide in Diabetes
Teaser: Genotyping of the 5-fluorouracil (5-FU) detoxifying enzyme dihydropyrimidine dehydrogenase may provide guidance on 5-FU dosing and improve safety for cancer patients prescribed 5-FU.

Headlines: Up-front Genotyping Reduces Fluoropyrimidine Toxicity
Teaser: The federal report estimates that 12 of every 100 hospital stays included an infection or other avoidable complication in 2014, about the same rate as 2013. Still, that was 17 lower than 2010.

Headlines: Hospital Injury Rates Plateau After 3 Years of Decline
Teaser: The UK drug watchdog NICE has finally issued its new guidelines for the treatment of type 2 diabetes in adults, but there is still some criticism from     diabetes specialists and organizations.

Headlines: UK NICE Backtracks on Some of its Type 2 Diabetes Guidance
Teaser: Glycerol phenylbutyrate (Ravicti) is for patients with urea cycle disorder who cannot be managed by dietary protein restriction and/or amino acid supplementation alone.

Headlines: Europe Clears Ravicti for Urea Cycle Disorders
Teaser: The relative risks are "substantial" but the absolute risks should be seen in perspective, say researchers. "After almost 20 years of follow-up, the majority of the women were still alive."

Headlines: Re-MI, Re-Stroke Risks Defined in Women on Oral Contraceptives
Teaser: A second monoclonal antibody for use in the treatment of multiple myeloma has been approved by the FDA within 2 weeks of approval of the first such product.

Headlines: Elotuzumab (Empliciti) Approved for Multiple Myeloma in US
Teaser: FDA reviewers and advisory committee panel members were critical of drisapersen data, suggesting they may not provide the evidence needed for approval for Duchenne muscular dystrophy.

Headlines: FDA Panel Critical of Drisapersen Data in Duchenne
Teaser: Diabetes thought leaders' input was used to develop a formula for weighing the various factors that inform appropriate glycemic-control targets for         individual patients with type 2 diabetes.

Headlines: Algorithm Helps Individualize HbA1c Targets in Type 2 Diabetes
Teaser: US experts have developed new guidelines for general inpatient psychiatric care for children with autism or intellectual disabilities to bring it in line with care provided in specialist units.

Headlines: New Guidelines to Improve Inpatient Care for Kids With Autism
Teaser: A comprehensive review reveals there is very low-quality evidence to support the use of methylphenidate i

Headlines: Experts Urge Caution When Prescribing Common ADHD Drug in Kids
Teaser: The novel product, a monoclonal antibody against EGFR, is approved for use with chemotherapy in patients with squamous non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC).

Headlines: Necitumumab (Portrazza) Approved for Lung Cancer in US
Teaser: A meta-analysis has found that medications impair sleep latency, efficiency, and duration, and suggested skipping a third daily dose.

Headlines: IBD: Skin Issues From Anti-TNF Therapy Should Be Addressed
Teaser: Most patients who developed skin lesions during anti-TNF therapy for IBD who saw a dermatologist continued treatment.

Headlines: FDA Panel Backs Reslizumab for Adults With Severe Asthma
Teaser: The advisory committee ruled that evidence wasn't strong enough for recommending the drug for children aged 12 to 17 years, citing small numbers in studies; concerns include risk for anaphylaxis and muscle toxicity.

Headlines: Depression Outcomes Similar With Antidepressants, CBT
Teaser: A meta-analysis shows second-generation antidepressants and cognitive- behavioral therapy produce equal response and remission rates and surprisingly similar withdrawal rates in major depression.

Headlines: FDA Warns of Contamination Risk for Some Baclofen API Lots
Teaser: Certain lots of baclofen active pharmaceutical ingredient (API) may be at risk for contamination with particulates and should not be used to compound sterile injectable drugs, the FDA warns.

Headlines: Cannabidiol Effective and Safe at 3 Months for Epilepsy
Teaser: New open-label data on purified cannabidiol in children and young adults with treatment-resistant epilepsy are 'promising' at 3 months' follow-up, researchers say.

Headlines: No Effect on HbA1c for Liraglutide + Insulin in Type 1 Diabetes
Teaser: A Danish study showed no effect on HbA1c for liraglutide added to insulin in overweight adults with type 1 diabetes; therefore, its use can't currently be     recommended, says lead author.

Headlines: Ophthalmologists Have Low Patient Complaint Rates
Teaser: Ophthalmologists at academic centers have the highest risk for patient complaints compared with others in their field, but ophthalmology overall enjoys fewer complaints than other medical specialties.

Headlines: Some Differences Between Once-Weekly GLP-1 Agonists
Teaser: Once-weekly GLP-1 receptor agonists dulaglutide, exenatide, and the now-withdrawn taspoglutide show the greatest reduction of HbA1c in a meta-analysis.     Hypoglycemia risk is similar across the class.

Headlines: 'Bad Press' May Make Patients Stop Statins, Raise MI Risk
Teaser: An increased event risk is the "most disturbing" aspect of the analysis, says one expert: "Major media outlets need to be more careful about how they cover stories generated by antistatin zealots."

Headlines: Idelalisib Trial Stopped Because of 'Overwhelming Efficacy'
Teaser: In chronic lymphocytic leukemia, idelalisib combined with bendamustine and rituximab improved progression-free and overall survival compared with the standard two-drug combination.

Headlines: Infant Weight Gain in First Year: Link to Type 1 Diabetes Risk
Teaser: An author says the findings offer one more clue about risk but should not lead to changes in feeding.

Headlines: Women at Risk for Breast Cancer Don't Take Preventive Drugs
Teaser: Most women who are at high risk for breast cancer are choosing not to take drugs that could prevent the disease, a meta-analysis reveals.

Headlines: Cold Cap to Prevent Hair Loss During Chemo Cleared in US
Teaser: For the first time in the United States, women with breast cancer undergoing chemotherapy can wear a cold cap to reduce the risk for hair loss.

Headlines: FDA OKs First Drug (Kanuma) for Rare Enzyme Disease
Teaser: Produced with the help of genetically engineered chickens, the drug treats adults and children with lysosomal acid lipase deficiency, a potentially life-threatening genetic disorder.

Headlines: Ixazomib in First Oral Triplet for Multiple Myeloma
Teaser: Data from the trial that led to the approval of ixazomib have been presented for the first time. This is the first oral triplet for myeloma.

Headlines: Third Trimester Antibiotic Use Ups Risk for Childhood Wheeze
Teaser: Excess risk for childhood wheezing with antibiotic exposure during the third trimester remains after adjustment for confounding factors; for example, maternal respiratory infections during pregnancy.

Headlines: Autoimmune Epilepsy Gaining Attention
Teaser: Researchers are learning more about antibodies that attack the brain, causing various seizure syndromes.

Headlines: More Evidence Needed for Women's Health Preventive Services
Teaser: The US Preventive Services Task Force and the Endocrine Society are calling on Congress to provide funding to address key evidence gaps in preventive     services for women's health.

Headlines: Little Sign of Higher Kidney Risk With Long-term Lithium
Teaser: Researchers find no increase in kidney function decline with long-term lithium maintenance over other drugs in affective disorder patients with good baseline function, a finding they call 'reassuring.'

Headlines: New Tool Measures Patient Satisfaction After Rhinoplasty
Teaser: A new module can help patients tell plastic surgeons how they feel about their nose before and after rhinoplasty.

Headlines: Isavuconazole Comparable to Voriconazole for Aspergillosis Treatment
Teaser: Benefits of the broad-spectrum antifungal in a phase 3 trial included fewer adverse effects and improved ease of use.

Headlines: Fourth PML Case With Tecfidera in MS Calls for Vigilance
Teaser: After a fourth case of PML linked to the MS drug dimethyl fumarate (Tecfidera), it's becoming more widely accepted that even 'safer' immunosuppressants may have dangerous adverse effects, experts say.

Headlines: Resuming Antithrombotics for AF Safe After a Halt for GI Bleed
Teaser: More evidence is called for, caution researchers, but after patients recover from the bleed, "restarting or modifying" antithrombotics to a single agent seems safe and improves outcomes, say researchers.

Headlines: Antidepressants Linked to Increased Mania Risk
Teaser: SSRIs, venlafaxine linked to higher risk for manic or bipolar episodes, but role of underlying bipolar disorder a suspected factor.

Headlines: Appetite-Regulating Hormones May Block Alcohol Cravings
Teaser: Appetite hormones leptin and ghrelin have inverse appetitive effects, and the relationship between them could be harnessed to reduce cravings for alcohol in patients with alcohol use disorder.

Headlines: The Vicious 'Sleep-Seizure' Cycle in Epilepsy
Teaser: Researchers are making headway in pinpointing factors involved in the interaction between sleep and epilepsy.

Headlines: Switch From LMWH to Warfarin OK in Cancer-Related Thrombosis
Teaser: Switching from a low-molecular-weight heparin to warfarin is not associated with an increase in recurrent venous thromboembolism, major bleeding, or total bleeding.

Headlines: High-Potency Cannabis Linked to Brain Damage, Experts Warn
Teaser: High-potency cannabis damages the white matter in the corpus callosum independently of psychosis risk, say researchers, who warn of the urgent need to educate healthcare professionals and the public.

Headlines: Happiness Has No Influence on Mortality Risk
Teaser: Levels of happiness have no impact on an individual's mortality risk, concludes a detailed study of more than 700,000 women followed for over 10 years.

Headlines: STOP-IgAN Disappoints With No Benefit From Additional Rx
Teaser: Additional immunosuppression on top of best supportive care does not change outcomes for patients with moderately high-risk IgA nephropathy at the end of 3 years.

Headlines: Ketamine for Refractory Status Epilepticus?
Teaser: Ketamine, used for analgesia and sedation, is increasingly being used to treat refractory status epilepticus, but only for the most critically ill children, a new study suggests.

Headlines: Solidified: TDM-1 in Pretreated Metastatic HER2-+ Patients
Teaser: The final overall survival results from a major trial of patients with heavily pretreated disease are now in.

Headlines: Targeted Treatment May Reverse Alopecia Areata
Teaser: The psoriasis drug ustekinumab can spur hair regrowth and normalize immune function in patients with alopecia areata, according to the results of a study in three patients.

Headlines: Pharmacists Play Key Role in Mitigating Medication Errors
Teaser: Human and system errors during code situations are frequent, but pharmacists can have a protective effect.

Headlines: Prevent Addiction in Pediatric IBD Patients at High Risk
Teaser: Some children and adolescents with inflammatory bowel disease are at higher risk for chronic narcotic use and dependence. Evidence-based clinical strategies for prevention and treatment can help.

Headlines: AI vs Tamoxifen for DCIS? A Toss-up, Unless…
Teaser: Both anastrozole and tamoxifen were effective at preventing recurrence of breast cancer in postmenopausal women with ductal carcinoma in situ. Age, toxicities should drive choice, say investigators.

Headlines: Cancers May Impair Heart Function: More Evidence
Teaser: Treated and nontreated cancer patients had similarly reduced cardiac strain, which may suggest that "some inflammatory components to the tumor growth     affect the heart muscle," say researchers.

Headlines: Alectinib Approved in US for Refractory ALK-Positive NSCLC
Teaser: Another ALK-targeted therapy has been approved for use in patients who no longer respond to crizotinib, but this one is also active on brain metastases.

Headlines: First Emergency Antidote to 5-FU Chemo in the US
Teaser: This first-of-its-kind product is an emergency antidote for use in cases of unintended overdose or severe adverse reaction to 5-fluorouracil (5-FU).

Headlines: Three-Year Major Bleeding Risk Same With Watchman or Warfarin
Teaser: Patients with AF face a similar 3-year bleeding risk if they undergo left atrial appendage closure with this device or stay on long-term warfarin therapy.     The CMS cautionary approach is right, two experts say.

Headlines: Medicare's NTAP for Blinatumomab Should Be Questioned
Teaser: The NTAP program was designed to help hospitals offset costs associated with innovative interventions, but a new expensive drug does not meet the criteria, say two experts.

Headlines: Secukinumab Effective for Ankylosing Spondylitis in Phase 3 Trials
Teaser: A 150-mg subcutaneous monthly secukinumab dose achieved the best results, but there was no added benefit from an intravenous loading dose in ankylosing spondylitis, according to interim phase 3 data.

Headlines: Surgical Castration Instead of Drugs in Prostate Cancer
Teaser: Surgical castration has a lower risk for fractures, peripheral arterial disease, thromboembolism, and cardiac complications than GnRH agonists in metastatic prostate cancer.

Headlines: LIRA-RENAL: Liraglutide Safe in Diabetes With Renal Failure
Teaser: Data from the LIRA-RENAL study detailing use of liraglutide in patients with type 2 diabetes and moderate kidney disease have been published.

Headlines: Misperceptions Drive Pot Use Among Patients With Glaucoma
Teaser: Patients with glaucoma are more likely to use marijuana for treatment if they believe it is safe and effective, according to a new study.

Headlines: Pembrolizumab Now Approved for First Line in Melanoma
Teaser: The cell programmed-death inhibitor pembrolizumab was more effective and less toxic in first-line treatment when compared with ipilimumab.

Headlines: Common Skin Problems With EGFR-TKIs Used for Lung Cancer
Teaser: In patients treated with EGFR-TKIs for lung cancer, the most common skin problems are acne-like lesions, itching, dry skin, and nail bed inflammation.

Headlines: FDA Clears Selexipag for Pulmonary Arterial Hypertension
Teaser: The oral IP prostacyclin receptor agonist is indicated to delay disease progression and reduce the risk for hospitalization in adults with PAH.

Headlines: Quiz: New Rheumatology Guidelines, Names, Warnings in 2015
Teaser: With 2015 coming to a close, here is a chance to look back and see how well you remember the news from this year. Our most popular stories in rheumatology included policy news, as well as drug approvals, drug warnings, and even a new name for a common illness.

Headlines: Infectious Disease News in 2015: How Much Do You Remember?
Teaser: There was a lot happening in the field of infectious diseases this year, from the increasing threat of antibiotic resistance, to the expansion of diseases that used to be rare in the United States, to a major study that changed the way HIV will be treated. Take the following quiz to see how well you followed the news this year.

Headlines: News Quiz: Diabetes and Endocrinology Hot Topics in 2015
Teaser: It has been an eventful year in the field of diabetes and endocrinology, culminating in the landmark results of the EMPA-REG trial in a group type 2 diabetes patients with coexisting cardiovascular disease. Medscape has charted all of these advances; see how well you remember what happened in 2015.

Headlines: Psychiatry 2015 News Quiz: Test Your Smarts
Teaser: Got a nose for news? Test your knowledge of the top news in psychiatry this year.

Headlines: Radial-Access Rare in STEMI Post-Lytic 'Rescue' PCI: NCDR
Teaser: "Transradial rates are still surprisingly low for a population that you would expect to be at high risk for bleeding," say researchers, who attribute the finding to the "risk-treatment" paradox.

Headlines: Delayed Prescriptions Can Reduce Antibiotic Overuse
