Teaser: In adults with uncomplicated respiratory tract infections, delayed prescription strategies markedly reduced antibiotic use in a randomized controlled trial.

Headlines: More Kidney Disease With Long-Term Statins Seen in Cohort Study
Teaser: "Clinicians should tell their patients that there may be statin side effects we are not aware of, but there are also benefits that we are aware of," say researchers; cause-and-effect were not shown in their study.

Headlines: Proton Pump Inhibitors Affect Gut Bacteria
Teaser: Proton pump inhibitors (PPI) used to reduce stomach acid and treat acid reflux change the populations of microbes living in the intestines, which may help explain why they increase the risk of certain infections, according to a new study.

Headlines: EMA Panel Backs Two Octocog Alfa Products for Hemophilia A
Teaser: Iblias and Kovaltry from Bayer Pharma AG are indicated for treatment and prevention of bleeding in patients with hemophilia A.

Headlines: CHMP Recommends Lesinurad (Zurampic) for Gout
Teaser: The European Medicines Agency panel has recommended marketing authorization for lesinurad for the treatment of hyperuricemia in adults with gout.

Headlines: CHMP Backs Ferric Maltol for Iron Deficiency Anemia in IBD
Teaser: Ferric maltol is an oral trivalent iron preparation that increases hemoglobin levels in patients with IBD with iron deficiency anemia.

Headlines: EU Thumbs Up for Osimertinib and Necitumumab for NSCLC
Teaser: European Medicines Agency has recommended approval of two new agents that are used in patients with non-small-cell lung cancer (NSCLC) that is EGFR-positive.

Headlines: New PAI Guidelines Stress Importance of Treating Adrenal Crisis
Teaser: The first-ever Endocrine Society clinical-practice guidelines on diagnosis and management of primary adrenal insufficiency in adults and children stress     the urgency of treating adrenal crisis.

Headlines: Short-Course Corticosteroid Adverse Events Common in Kids
Teaser: A systematic review has quantified the risks for adverse events for children taking short courses of oral corticosteroids.

Headlines: QI Cuts Duration of Antibiotics for Uncomplicated SSTIs
Teaser: A four-part quality improvement (QI) initiative significantly reduces the duration of antibiotics prescribed for uncomplicated skin and soft tissue infections (SSTIs) in children, researchers report.

Headlines: CDC, ACP Issue Guideline on Antibiotic Use for RTIs
Teaser: 'Providers should apply strict criteria…to determine when antibiotics are needed,' a guideline author said.

Headlines: Class I Recall of Cranial Image-Guided Surgery System
Teaser: Brainlab is recalling the system because of navigation inaccuracies that could lead to serious injuries, even death, the FDA said.

Headlines: AACE Publishes Latest 'Cookbook' for Diabetes Management
Teaser: The new document and set of graphics include all medications licensed in the US through 2015 and incorporates new clinical-trial data.

Headlines: Wider Eligibility for Heart Transplantation in New Guidelines
Teaser: The ISHLT's 10-year guidelines overhaul relaxes restrictions on weight, age, comorbidities, and other criteria and make a broader-than-ever range of patients eligible for wait listing.

Headlines: 'Bipolar' Therapy: New Twist in Advanced Prostate Cancer
Teaser: Challenging current notions, exposing prostate cancer cells alternately to very high and very low levels of testosterone may have clinical benefit and improve quality of life.

Headlines: Proton Pump Inhibitors May Increase Risk for Kidney Disease
Teaser: Proton pump inhibitors such as omeprazole are linked to increased risks for chronic kidney disease and for acute kidney injury, according to two population-based analyses.

Headlines: Scrambler Therapy Benefit in Cancer-Related Neuropathic Pain
Teaser: Noninvasive scrambler therapy is emerging as a potential option for the treatment of cancer-related neuropathic pain, although uptake remains limited in the absence of major clinical trials.

Headlines: Quality of Life With Docetaxel and ADT in Prostate Cancer
Teaser: When docetaxel is added to androgen-deprivation therapy, patients with metastatic prostate cancer report no long-term effects on quality of life.

Headlines: Recro Pharma's Lead Painkiller Succeeds in Mid-Stage Trial
Teaser: Recro Pharma Inc said its lead painkiller reduced pain in post-operative orthopedic surgery patients and was safe and well tolerated, in a mid-stage trial.

Headlines: After Great Pain, a Cold Cap for Chemo Hair Loss Came
Teaser: Refrigeration expertise and anguish from the adverse effects of breast cancer chemotherapy came together in a British family, and gave rise to technologic innovation.

Headlines: High-Dose Vitamin D Shows Promising Effects in MS
Teaser: Taking 10,400 IU cholecalciferol daily was associated with target serum levels of 25-hydroxyvitamin D and reductions in interleukin-17 T cells, which are believed to play a key role in MS, in a new study.

Headlines: Molecular Signatures Explain Unique Responses to Vaccination
Teaser: Patients who describe influenza-like symptoms after vaccination have a distinct genetic signature compared with patients who do not have such a reaction.

Headlines: Intravaginal DHEA Eases Postmenopausal Vaginal Dryness, Pain
Teaser: Daily intravaginal DHEA suppositories give relief to postmenopausal women for whom sex is painful, but who cannot or do not want to use estrogen treatments.

Headlines: Which Kidney Cancer Drug on Progression? Surprising Answers
Teaser: Although cabozantinib has shown the best progression-free survival ever seen, nivolumab improves overall survival and has fewer adverse events.

Headlines: Filter Mask Might Lessen Diesel-Fume Cardiotoxicity in HF
Teaser: "This trial is the first to show that a filter can reduce both endothelial dysfunction and BNP increases in patients with heart failure during     diesel-exhaust exposure," according to researchers.

Headlines: Empirical Terbinafine for Nail Fungus Is Most Cost-effective
Teaser: Empirical treatment of onychomycosis with terbinafine is far more cost effective than confirmatory testing before treatment, according to new findings.

Headlines: 'Triple Therapy' Raises Bleed Risk After PCI for MI: Study
Teaser: Regardless of P2Y12 receptor inhibitor used, the risk of bleeding complications went up by adding an oral anticoagulant to dual-antiplatelet     therapy—maybe more so with one particular antiplatelet.

Headlines: Levamisole-Adulterated Cocaine Linked to Pyoderma Gangrenosum
Teaser: Clinicians should be aware that levamisole-adulterated cocaine is a potential cause of pyoderma gangrenosum (PG), researchers warn.

Headlines: Flip Flop: ED Drugs Not Tied to Prostate Cancer Return
Teaser: Erectile dysfunction (ED) is a common adverse effect of prostate cancer therapy. But is the use of these drugs tied to biochemical recurrence? New evidence counters an earlier study.

Headlines: First Chemo 'Antidote' Cuts Deaths From 5-FU Toxicity
Teaser: The first and only approved antidote for severe toxicity related to a chemotherapy overdose dramatically reduces mortality.

Headlines: Activity With PD-1 Inhibitors in Upper GI Cancers
Teaser: Early-phase trials show encouraging antitumor activity for nivolumab and pembrolizumab in advanced gastric, esophagus, and gastroesophageal junction cancers.

Headlines: Cherry-Flavored e-Cigarettes Linked to Lung Irritant
Teaser: Flavored e-cigarettes, particularly cherry-flavored, expose users to benzaldehyde, a compound that can irritate the airways, at levels often greater than those seen with conventional cigarettes.

Headlines: Soy May Protect Against Fertility Harms of Endocrine Disruptors
Teaser: A Harvard study is the first to find that women who eat soy and have been exposed to the endocrine disruptor BPA have higher chances of pregnancy success     and live birth after IVF.

Headlines: EU to Review Metformin Meds to Unify Renal Recommendations
Teaser: The European Medicines Agency is to review prescribing information with regard to the use of metformin in patients with renal impairment, with a view to     harmonizing advice on this issue across the EU.

Headlines: CHMP Recommends Coagadex for Factor X Deficiency
Teaser: The medicine can be used as treatment for acute bleeding or as prophylaxis in patients with hereditary factor X deficiency.

Headlines: CHMP Backs Selexipag for Pulmonary Arterial Hypertension
Teaser: Selective prostaglandin receptor agonist has mechanism distinct from prostacyclin and its analogs.

Headlines: Eribulin Approved for Liposarcoma, Improves Survival
Teaser: Already approved for use in breast cancer, eribulin is the first drug to show an improved overall survival in patients with liposarcoma.

Headlines: Smoking Cessation Pill vs Nicotine Patches or Lozenges
Teaser: Smoking cessation pills aren't any better than nicotine patches or lozenges at helping people successfully quit, a U.S. study suggests.

Headlines: Mixed Opioid Agent Adds to Growing List of Therapies for IBS-D
Teaser: Studies suggest a new oral agent with mixed opioid effects may be a promising new option for irritable bowel syndrome with diarrhea; its approval adds to the growing list of options for the disorder.

Headlines: Topiramate for Substance Use: Upside/Downside
Teaser: Topiramate, which has shown promise as a treatment for substance use disorders, reduces the amount of cannabis users consume, but at the cost of increased adverse effects.

Headlines: Strenuous Physical Activity Linked to ALS in Older Women
Teaser: Genes and environment may interact with strenuous physical activity to increase risks, new data suggest.

Headlines: Refractive Outcomes Stable at Five Years After SMILE Procedure for Myopia
Teaser: Refractive outcomes remain stable at five years in the first eyes treated with small incision lenticule extraction (ReLEx SMILE, Zeiss) for myopia, report ophthalmologists from Germany.

Headlines: After Dust Settles, Mixed Reaction to New US Dietary Guidelines
Teaser: Response to the new 2015-2020 Dietary Guidelines for Americans ranged from neutral to supportive to harsh critique; now that docs have had time to digest     the impact, Medscape gauged reactions.

Headlines: Oral Propranolol Best for Reducing Infantile Hemangioma
Teaser: Oral propranolol had a 95% clearance rate vs 43% for oral corticosteroids, according to a meta-analysis.

Headlines: FDA Panel Considers Allergen Immunotherapy Development
Teaser: An FDA panel met to discuss issues around the clinical development of allergen immunotherapy products.

Headlines: Safe and Sound (So Far): A Radiopharmaceutical for GI Tumors
Teaser: An investigative treatment for midgut neuroendocrine tumors demonstrated some unprecedented efficacy results in early analyses. Now the safety data are a bit more mature.

Headlines: Antipsychotics Boost Type 2 Diabetes Risk in Youth
Teaser: A new meta-analysis links second-generation antipsychotics with a significantly increased risk orf type 2 diabetes risk in youth, once again underscoring the serious metabolic risks of these agents.

Headlines: EHR Use Tied to Lower Adverse Event Rates
Teaser: Hospitals that had fully electronic health records had lower rates of adverse drug events, hospital-acquired infections, and other adverse events among inpatients, researchers reported.

Headlines: Higher-Dose SSRIs for Major Depression May Improve Response
Teaser: Higher-dose SSRIs for major depression are associated with modest improvement and may be a viable way of boosting response in some patients.

Headlines: IRIS: Diabetes Drug Reduces Recurrent Stroke, MI
Teaser: A randomized trial shows that in patients with insulin resistance but no diabetes and a history of recent stroke or TIA, pioglitazone reduced recurrent stroke and myocardial infarction vs placebo.

Headlines: FDA Expands Use of Liver Drug to Subset of Patients
Teaser: The U.S. Food and Drug Administration has expanded the use of Gilead Sciences Inc's drug Harvoni (ledipasvir and sofosbuvir) to some hepatitis C patients in the advanced stage of cirrhosis, including those who have undergone liver transplant.

Headlines: Cutting Cancer Drug Costs: No Pain, No Gain
Teaser: Public policy changes could help control the escalating cost of cancer drugs, but not without making tradeoffs in the process, say some experts.

Headlines: New Consumer Advice on Prostate Cancer Includes 'Value'
Teaser: New consumer advice guides include information on the 'relative value of treatments,' but the guide on prostate cancer has been met with criticism.

Headlines: Oral Opioids No Better Than NSAIDs for Knee OA Pain
Teaser: A new systematic review has challenged the assumption that oral opioids provide stronger pain relief than NSAIDs in knee osteoarthritis.

Headlines: Therapy, Antidepressants Similarly Effective for Depression
Teaser: A new ACP guideline recommended that physicians discuss the benefits, potential adverse effects, and costs of both treatments with patients. The guideline also addressed problems with St John's wort.

Headlines: Psychiatrists Urged to Support ECT Reclassification
Teaser: The APA is encouraging its members to support the FDA's proposed reclassification of ECT devices from high- to low-risk.

Headlines: Antidiabetic Agent Helps Antipsychotic-Induced Dyslipidemia
Teaser: The antidiabetic agent metformin may offer an effective treatment for antipsychotic-induced dyslipidemia, new research suggests.

Headlines: New Diagnostic Test for Parkinson's?
Teaser: Biopsy of the submandibular gland may help identify Lewy-type synucleinopathy in patients with PD, a new study shows.

Headlines: Side Effects With Sorafenib More Pronounced in Thyroid Cancer
Teaser: The incidence of side effects from the oral multikinase inhibitor sorafenib appears to be considerably higher among patients with differentiated thyroid cancer than those with renal cell or hepatocellular carcinoma.

Headlines: Amgen on GAUSS-3: Evolocumab Meets LDL-Based Primary End Points
Teaser: Teasing with top-line results, the company says the PCSK9 inhibitor dropped LDL-C vs ezetimibe at 24 weeks in patients intolerant of statins, similar to     what was shown in the 12-week GAUSS-2 trial.

Headlines: Does Pharma 'Highjack' FDA Public Comment on Cancer Drugs?
Teaser: Meetings of the US Food and Drug Administration (FDA) Oncologic Drugs Advisory Committee include public comment. But who are the people commenting?

Headlines: Parental Depression: Long-term Impact on Children
Teaser: Children of depressed parents show significant reductions in academic performance at age 16 years, new research indicates.

Headlines: Proton Beam in Medulloblastoma: 'New Benchmark'
Teaser: In children with medulloblastoma, proton-beam therapy has survival rates similar to standard radiotherapy, but fewer systemic toxicities.

Headlines: Benefit of Steroids Extends to Late Preterm Period
Teaser: In late preterm infants, antenatal betamethasone reduces the need for respiratory support at 72 hours and lowers the risk for severe respiratory morbidity, new research suggests.

Headlines: Rivastigmine Prevents Falls in  Patients With PD
Teaser: The results are 'very encouraging and exciting' but need to be reproduced in larger trials, lead researcher says.

Headlines: Nonadherence to ADHD Meds: Red Flag for Illicit Drug Use?
Teaser: Urine samples from ADHD patients show higher rates of illicit drug use among those nonadherent to prescribed stimulant medications.

Headlines: New Guidance: Bisphosphonate Holidays for Low-Risk Patients
Teaser: High-risk osteoporosis patients, however, are advised to continue therapy; discussion of the risks/benefits is encouraged.

Headlines: EU Panel Likes Nivolumab for Kidney Cancer, Other Drugs
Teaser: A European advisory committee has recommended extending the indication for immunotherapy to include the treatment of advanced renal cell carcinoma.

Headlines: CHMP Backs Ixekizumab (Taltz) for Plaque Psoriasis
Teaser: The monoclonal antibody targets interleukin 17A, a key driver of inflammation in psoriasis.

Headlines: Telephone Triage Deflects ED Visits to Oncologists' Offices
Teaser: A novel telephone triage system helped deflect a significant number of ED visits by oncology patients into physicians' offices instead, saving the healthcare system considerable amounts of money.

Headlines: New APS Guideline on Postoperative Pain
Teaser: In a new American Pain Society guideline on postoperative pain management in children and adults, an expert panel recommends a multimodal approach.

Headlines: Question Over Role of RAS Blockers for Hypertension in Diabetes
Teaser: A new meta-analysis suggests that in diabetes patients without kidney disease, any blood-pressure-lowering agent will do.

Headlines: New Evidence Backs Levetiracetam for Prolonged Seizure
Teaser: Levetiracetam is as good as phenytoin for the treatment of status epilepticus, new data suggest, and might even be cheaper.

Headlines: Ultra-Low-Dose Opioid May Quash Severe Suicidal Ideation
Teaser: Short-term use of ultra-low-dose buprenorphine may reduce suicidal ideation in severely depressed patients, new research shows.

Headlines: Opioids for Depression: Novel Treatment Tested
Teaser: The combination of buprenorphine and samidorphan shows some efficacy as an adjunctive therapy for treatment-resistant major depression.

Headlines: Ganglion Block Beats Blood Patch for Dural Puncture Headache
Teaser: This approach should be the first-line therapy for obstetric patients experiencing postdural puncture headache, researchers say.

Headlines: Meditation Provides Short-Term Relief of Back Pain in Seniors
Teaser: A new study has found that although short-term improvements may be noted among older adults using meditation to help manage lower back pain, the effects are not long-lasting.

Headlines: Oral Steroids, NSAIDs Equally Safe, Effective for Acute Gout
Teaser: A large, multicenter randomized trial found that oral prednisolone and oral indomethacin were equally effective at reducing acute gout pain in patients presenting to emergency departments.

Headlines: Marijuana Use Tied to Drug, Alcohol Abuse, Nicotine Dependence
Teaser: A new study sounds a note of caution about underappreciated risks linking marijuana use to subsequent development of alcohol and drug abuse and nicotine dependence.

Headlines: Depression Symptoms Ongoing Even With Optimal Treatment
Teaser: Many patients with major depressive disorder continue to experience symptoms despite optimal treatment, a US poll shows.

Headlines: ASCO on Ovarian Suppression in Young Breast Cancer Patients
Teaser: The latest results on ovarian suppression in premenopausal women with breast cancer,  hailed as practice changing, have now been incorporated into clinical guidelines.

Headlines: Disease Suppression Persists With Ozanimod at 72 Weeks in MS
Teaser: The 48-week extension of the RADIANCE trial showed persistent benefit for ozanimod, reduced gadolinium-enhancing lesions, and a low relapse rate.

Headlines: Adding an Antipsychotic Helps Treat Pain
Teaser: A literature review finds that the atypical antipsychotic olanzapine has the most evidence supporting its use in various pain syndromes.

Headlines: Disability Accumulation Varies in Moderately Advanced MS
Teaser: Disability accumulation may be independent of prior disease progression, but its trajectory is highly variable, suggesting that patients with higher EDSS scores may still benefit from stronger therapies.

Headlines: Organ Complications Can Hit Early in Systemic Sclerosis
Teaser: For most people with systemic sclerosis, pulmonary, heart, and other complications start early and ramp up quickly, according to an analysis of nearly 10,000 EUSTAR patients.

Headlines: FDA Clears Brivaracetam (Briviact) for Partial-Onset Seizures
Teaser: The levetiracetam analogue is approved for adjunctive therapy for treatment of partial-onset seizures in patients age 16 and older with epilepsy.

Headlines: Stroke Prevalence Linked to Poor Air Quality
Teaser: Higher stroke rates correspond to areas of the US and China with the most air pollution, a new study shows.

Headlines: Investigational Cream Promising for Epidermolysis Bullosa
Teaser: The concentrated form of an old ingredient -- allantoin, a diureide of glyoxylic acid -- has shown benefit in people with the rare condition of epidermolysis bullosa in a phase 2b study.

Headlines: Long-term Aspirin Tied to Small Drop in Overall Cancer Risk
Teaser: Long-term low-dose aspirin could decrease the risk for cancer, especially colorectal cancer; aspirin may also benefit patients who receive CRC screening and have even greater impact on those who don't.

Headlines: Cannabis in First-Episode Psychosis Linked to Poor Outcomes
Teaser: Cannabis use in early psychosis is linked to higher hospital admission risk, prolonged stays, and antipsychotic drug failure.

Headlines: Many Lens Implant Patients May Develop Cataracts Within 10 Years
Teaser: Many patients who get lens implant surgery to correct vision problems may develop cataracts or elevated pressure around the eyes within 10 years after the procedures, a Swiss study suggests.

Headlines: FDA Clears New Contact Lens That Senses Eye Pressure Changes
Teaser: The Triggerfish contact lens provides 24-hour continuous monitoring of changes in intraocular pressure patterns that otherwise could not be obtained, the FDA said.

Headlines: Glaucoma Drops May Help in Refractory AMD
Teaser: When age-related macular degeneration (AMD) is refractory to intravitreous anti-vascular endothelial growth factor (anti-VEGF), adding dorzolamide-timolol eye drops may be helpful, according to a small pilot study.

Headlines: Immuno-oncology Driving More Precise Cancer Treatment
Teaser: A predicted shift in combination treatments, in which new immunotherapies treat the host, not the tumor cells, will mean that oncologists could become immunologists and virologists.

Headlines: Novel 'Gene Silencer' Shows Promise in Huntington's
Teaser: The first clinical trial of a second-generation antisense oligonucleotide that targets the cause of Huntington's disease is underway after promising results in animal testing.

Headlines: Lower CAD Risk Hinted With Gene Variants Linked to Lower Triglycerides
Teaser: The question now is whether an antibody that achieves loss of function in ANGPTL4 "can be safely given to achieve lower coronary disease,"     commented an expert observer.

Headlines: Can the Endobarrier Help Obese Diabetics Running out of Options?
Teaser: The first trial of a duodenal-jejunal bypass liner together with GLP-1 agonist therapy in morbidly obese diabetic patients who are failing therapy suggests     this combo may kick-start behavior changes.

Headlines: Peanut Trial LEAPS Back Into Limelight at Allergy Meeting
Teaser: The much-anticipated update from the LEAP study on the protective effects of early peanut exposure in infants will be presented, as will data on the safety of asthma medications.

Headlines: Unilateral ECT Equal to Bilateral Approach for Major Depression
Teaser: Twice-weekly high-dose unilateral ECT for severe depression is as effective as bilateral ECT, with fewer cognitive side effects, new research shows.

Headlines: Have Difficult-to-Treat Pain Patients? Try Genetic Testing
Teaser: Genetic testing might help sort out which medications to prescribe to pain patients, new research suggests.

Headlines: Infliximab May Top Cyclosporine for Steroid-Refractory Ulcerative Colitis
Teaser: Infliximab may be slightly better than cyclosporine for treating patients with steroid-refractory ulcerative colitis (UC), according to results from a systematic review and meta-analysis.

Headlines: CHMP Backs Two Hemophilia B Drugs (Idelvion and Alprolix)
Teaser: Both blood coagulation factor IX products are indicated for treatment and prophylaxis of bleeding in patients of all ages with hemophilia B.

Headlines: Patients Rate Physicians' Responses to DTC Genomic Testing
Teaser: Patients using direct-to-consumer genomic tests had unrealistic expectations of the utility of testing and of the ability of healthcare providers to interpret and explain results, a new study showed.

Headlines: Flibanserin Approval Not Supported by Data, Review Suggests
Teaser: The female libido drug showed a significant adverse event rate and only marginal efficacy in a new meta-analysis; experts questioned US Food and Drug Administration approval.

Headlines: Multimodal Care Reduces All-Cause Mortality in Opioid Users
Teaser: Those patients who received mental health, addiction, or rehabilitative treatment were 40% less likely to die within 6 months of starting on opioids than those who did not.

Headlines: Another Option for Opioid-Induced Constipation?
Teaser: A new drug in development is superior to placebo in treating opioid-induced constipation and doesn't interfere with analgesic effect.

Headlines: CHMP Backs Emtricitabine/Tenofovir Alafenamide for HIV
Teaser: The combo, called Descovy, is an alternative treatment option to Gilead's tenofovir disoproxil fumarate (Viread) and is expected to have similar efficacy, the committee said.

Headlines: California to Kick Out Poorly Performing Hospitals?
Teaser: Providers and insurers are balking at a Covered California proposal to eject hospitals with inordinately high costs and low quality from its networks.

Headlines: EMA Launches Investigation Into Gadolinium Deposits in Brain
Teaser: Concern over gadolinium deposits in patients undergoing multiple MRIs has led the European Medicines Agency to launch a review of the potential risks. The FDA launched a similar investigation last summer.

Headlines: Risky Drug Prescriptions Cut by Multipronged Intervention
Teaser: Primary care prescribing of NSAIDs and antiplatelet agents for high-risk patients dropped with education, informatics, and financial incentives.

Headlines: For Arthritis Pain: Diclofenac Best, Acetaminophen Worst
Teaser: Diclofenac was most effective and acetaminophen least effective for relieving pain in knee or hip osteoarthritis.

Headlines: Marijuana for Cancer: No Benefit, but Don't Tell Patients
Teaser: As more states approve medical marijuana, oncologists should be prepared to field questions from patients, but the available scientific data are limited.

Headlines: Legalized Cannabis and the Brain: NIDA Sounds the Alarm
Teaser: NIDA researchers sound the alarm over a possible increase in unknown harms brought on by the wave of cannabis legalization now sweeping the US.

Headlines: 'Difficult' Patients More Likely to Be Medically Misdiagnosed
Teaser: Patients who engage in disruptive behaviors may distract physicians, at the expense of important clinical details, new research shows.

Headlines: A 'Remarkable' New Treatment for Cataracts
Teaser: Scientists have described a cure for cataracts that involves regrowing the lens in the eye using stem cells.

Headlines: Methadone in Palliative Care? This Guidance Will Aid Use
Teaser: To minimize overdose risks, panel recommends adherence to multispecialty guidelines and careful use of methadone in palliative care.

Headlines: Reslizumab Effective in Chronic Sinusitis With Nasal Polyps
Teaser: For a subgroup of patients, an anti-interleukin-5 antibody improved asthma exacerbation rates, lung function, and quality of life, according to a subanalysis of data from two pivotal phase 3 trials.

Headlines: Low-Dose Steroids Generally Safe in Rheumatic Diseases
Teaser: A EULAR task force has concluded that long-term use of glucocorticoid doses of 5 mg/day or less is generally safe in treating rheumatic diseases.

Headlines: 'Legal LSD': Dangerous Party Drug Sold Online
Teaser: A 'legal high' that has potentially serious adverse effects is being sold online to partygoers as LSD, say Spanish researchers, who warn of the rising tide of novel psychoactive substances.

Headlines: Dose-Dense Chemo Boosts Survival in Premenopausal Breast Cancer
Teaser: Adjuvant chemotherapy given every 2 weeks improved overall survival by almost a third compared with the standard 3-week interval.

Headlines: FDA OKs Crizotinib (Xalkori) for ROS-1-Mutated Lung Cancer
Teaser: The FDA has approved crizotinib for the treatment for patients with ROS-1-positive non-small cell lung cancer.

Headlines: Cord-Cutting Technique Smooths Cellulite for 3 Years
Teaser: A one-time subcision treatment, in which fibrous septae underlying the characteristic cellulite dimples are cut, is effective and safe, 3-year data show.

Headlines: Adverse Childhood Experiences Tied to Less Well-Being in Adults
Teaser: Adverse childhood experiences (ACE) such as the death of a close friend or relative, prolonged absence of a parent or witnessing a shooting or stabbing are associated with less well-being in young adults, according to University of Minnesota researchers.

Headlines: Safety Data Accumulating for Combination Asthma Drugs
Teaser: The first of a series of safety studies mandated by the FDA suggests that the black-box warning on inhalers might not be warranted; however, patients with the most severe disease were excluded.

Headlines: Early-Term Elective Delivery May Be OK, Study Suggests
Teaser: Infants born electively at 37 to 38 weeks' gestation did not have an increased risk for neonatal morbidity or infant mortality compared with those who were expectantly managed and born at full term.

Headlines: Topical Anticholinergic Reduces Underarm Hyperhidrosis
Teaser: An investigational anticholinergic gel noninvasively reduces excess sweating with minimal adverse effects, a phase 2b study suggests.

Headlines: New Concussion Score for Children Flags Higher-Risk Cases
Teaser: Use of a simple 12-point score successfully identified children with concussion who were at higher risk for prolonged symptoms.

Headlines: HPV Vaccine Side-Effects Class-Action Suit Planned in Japan
Teaser: Lawyers representing girls with adverse effects after HPV vaccination are preparing a lawsuit against the government and the manufacturers.

Headlines: Prolonged Nightly Fasting Cuts Risk for Breast Cancer Return
Teaser: Nighttime fasting of 13 hours or longer was associated with a significantly lower risk for recurrence in women with early-stage breast cancer.

Headlines: Baricitinib Offers Promise of Remission in Refractory RA
Teaser: The oral Janus kinase 1 and 2 inhibitor baricitinib significantly increased ACR20 response rates and improved physical function in patients with rheumatoid arthritis for whom other therapies had failed.

Headlines: Keryx Says Anemia Drug Succeeds in Study of Kidney Patients
Teaser: Keryx Biopharmaceuticals Inc on Tuesday said its drug to treat iron deficiency anemia in chronic kidney disease patients not yet requiring dialysis met the goals of a late stage clinical trial, potentially paving the way for an expanded approval of the treatment.

Headlines: Defibrotide Approved for Serious Disorder After HSCT
Teaser: This is the first treatment approved for a rare but often fatal complication that can occur in cancer patients who receive hematopoietic stem cell transplants.

Headlines: Antipsychotics Linked to Mortality in Parkinson's
Teaser: Comorbidities should be checked, PD drugs adjusted, and perhaps behavioral approaches tried before an antipsychotic is introduced, researchers say.

Headlines: Acupuncture May Ease Hot Flashes in Women With Breast Cancer
Teaser: Acupuncture may help ease hot flashes in women with breast cancer who often can't take traditional hormone treatments, according to a new study from Italy.

Headlines: Diclofenac Best Treatment in ED for Renal Colic: Study
Teaser: The most effective sustained emergency department (ED) analgesia for renal colic is intramuscular (IM) diclofenac, not intravenous (IV) morphine, according to results from a randomized controlled trial.

Headlines: Possible Drug Risks Buried in Delayed FDA 'Watch Lists'
Teaser: The agency has finally posted quarterly reports for 2015 that list drugs with potential signals of serious risk, such as stroke for SGLT-2 inhibitors. FDA critics say its early warning system needs fixing.

Headlines: Obesity Survey Uncovers Striking Clinician 'Knowledge Gap'
Teaser: "The most striking observation...is that it demonstrates a considerable knowledge gap in the indications, efficacy, and safety of currently FDA-approved     drugs for obesity," says one expert.

Headlines: PPIs May Lower GI Events After DAPT With Low-Dose Aspirin
Teaser: Based on new analysis from COGENT, "one could make an argument to consider routine PPIs" in these CAD patients, said the senior author. "But that does go     beyond current guidelines."

Headlines: Study Suggests Bringing Back Whole-Cell Pertussis Vaccine
Teaser: Using a mixed vaccine series with whole-cell and Tdap could reduce pertussis incidence dramatically. But would parents accept the old vaccine with its associated adverse effects?

Headlines: Ketamine Linked to Bladder Toxicity
Teaser: Recreational use of ketamine has been linked to bladder toxicity, raising concerns that this may affect its clinical potential as a rapid-acting treatment for depression and other disorders.

Headlines: Tocilizumab Ups Giant Cell Arteritis Remissions in Early Trial
Teaser: Patients with giant cell arteritis treated with tocilizumab were more likely to reach and maintain complete remission and were able to taper off steroids more quickly in a randomized trial.

Headlines: Dual-Drug Strategy Reduces Carpet of Polyps in FAP Patients
Teaser: Colon carpeted with polyps in FAP patients can be favorably affected with a novel dual-drug strategy that offers the first really tenable treatment for this condition.

Headlines: Botox Alleviates Neuropathic Pain
Teaser: A series of two doses of botulinum toxin A relieved neuropathic pain better than did placebo, new randomized findings show.

Headlines: ENDO 2016: Centennial Celebration Will Mix Old With New
Teaser: The program of the Endocrine Society's meeting will feature odes to past endocrine achievements and the many advances for which they paved the way.

Headlines: Ixekizumab (Taltz) for Plaque Psoriasis Clears FDA
Teaser: The monoclonal antibody targets interleukin 17A, which drives inflammation in psoriasis, and is intended for patients who are candidates for systemic therapy.

Headlines: Diabetes Drugs Have Positive Effect in MS
Teaser: Metformin and pioglitazone help regulate immune and inflammatory responses in obese patients with multiple sclerosis who also have metabolic syndrome, a new study suggests.

Headlines: Number of Elderly at Risk for Major Drug-Drug Event Doubles
Teaser: Two-thirds of elderly are taking five or more prescription/nonprescription medications, a new study showed. Experts calls for better monitoring systems, more patient input in drug lists.

Headlines: Investigational Long-Acting Growth Hormone Shows Promise
Teaser: A twice-monthly recombinant human growth hormone demonstrates efficacy and safety and may improve compliance over daily formulations.

Headlines: ASCO Urges Aggressive Efforts to Increase HPV Vaccination
Teaser: Despite many American medical professional bodies strongly recommending HPV vaccination, uptake remains low. Now oncologists are being told to get involved.

Headlines: Venetoclax Approved in US for Certain CLL Patients
Teaser: The new drug has been approved for patients with chronic lymphocytic leukemia (CLL) who harbor the 17p deletion, which has a poor prognosis.

Headlines: e-Cigs Cut Tobacco Use in Patients With Serious Mental Illness
Teaser: Individuals with serious mental illnesses may be able to reduce their tobacco consumption with the use of electronic cigarettes, without exacerbating psychopathologic symptoms, say UK scientists.

Headlines: Exercise May Aid Sleep for Overweight Men With Insomnia
Teaser: Overweight men with chronic insomnia fall asleep more easily and quickly after a six-month aerobic exercise program, according to a new study in Finland.

Headlines: FDA: Metformin Safe for Some Patients With Renal Problems
Teaser: UPDATED // Changing its course in response to mounting evidence, the agency said the diabetes drug can be used safely in patients with mild and, in some cases, moderate kidney impairment.

Headlines: NCCN Scrutinizes Sexual Dysfunction in Cancer Survivors
Teaser: The National Comprehensive Cancer Network (NCCN) Guidelines for Survivorship focus this year on issues of sexual health for both men and women.

Headlines: Parkinson's Drug Highly Effective for Resistant Depression
Teaser: Enhancement of the dopaminergic system with the Parkinson's drug pramipexole can be extremely effective in alleviating symptoms of treatment-resistant unipolar and bipolar depression.

Headlines: NCCN: Shorter RT Course 'Preferred' for Breast Conservation
Teaser: The latest NCCN guidelines for breast cancer urge the use of hypofractionation, in which radiation is delivered for 3 rather than 5 weeks.

Headlines: Specialists Say Childhood Asthma Is Overdiagnosed
Teaser: In an article published in the journal Archives of Disease in Childhood, two respiratory specialists claim that doctors are overdiagnosing asthma in children, with inhalers being prescribed needlessly.

Headlines: Gut Microbiota Altered in First-Episode Schizophrenia
Teaser: Individuals with first-episode schizophrenia have alterations in gut microbiota that appear to be driven by early antipsychotic therapy and are linked to inflammation, Finnish data indicate.

Headlines: Novel Drug May Offer Hope in Prader-Willi Syndrome, Obesity
Teaser: Beloranib reduces weight and hyperphagia in Prader-Willi syndrome and may also hold promise for other severe obesity conditions, but first the company must     prove that it doesn't raise thrombotic risk.

Headlines: EMA Committee Backs First Oral Drug for Fabry Disease
Teaser: Migalastat (Galafold) may provide a more convenient treatment option for patients with this rare genetic disease.

Headlines: Regeneron, Sanofi Eczema Drug Clears Hurdles in Big Trials
Teaser: Regeneron Pharmaceuticals Inc and Sanofi said on Friday their experimental treatment for eczema proved highly effective in two large studies, without serious side effects often seen with standard treatments for the chronic inflammatory skin disease.

Headlines: Oral GLP-1 Agonist Promising in Phase 2 in Type 2 Diabetes
Teaser: A novel oral formulation of a long-acting GLP-1 agonist could provide HbA1c and weight-loss benefits similar to the injectables in type 2 diabetes, but in     a daily pill instead.

Headlines: HOPE-3: Statins Lower CV Events in Intermediate-CHD-Risk Patients
Teaser: UPDATED // Alone or with blood-pressure-lowering therapy, at least in those with elevated baseline BP, rosuvastatin lowered composite end points by 24% to 29% vs     placebo.

Headlines: FDA Investigates Counterfeit Materials in Surgical Mesh
Teaser: The FDA is investigating allegations that Boston Scientific used counterfeit raw material in the manufacturing of urogynecologic surgical mesh.

Headlines: EMA Panel Backs Pandemic Avian Influenza Vaccine
Teaser: The European Medicines Agency's Committee for Medicinal Products for Human Use has recommended granting marketing authorization for the Pandemic Live Attenuated Influenza Vaccine.

Headlines: Endocrine Society Advises Against Compounded Hormone Use
Teaser: A new scientific statement details the science of hormonal compounds for treating menopausal symptoms, sexual dysfunction, and thyroid conditions,     emphasizing the superiority of FDA-approved products.

Headlines: Pricey PCSK9 Inhibitors Require Careful Patient Selection
Teaser: The drugs, for familial hypercholesterolemia and atherosclerotic cardiovascular disease, cost about $14,000/year in the US, even though the effect on morbidity and mortality has yet to be determined.

Headlines: Peginterferon Beta-1a Efficacy in MS Sustained Long-term
Teaser: An extension study of the pivotal ADVANCE trial demonstrates sustained efficacy of peginterferon beta-1a with long-term treatment in relapsing MS.

Headlines: Everolimus Data for Seizures in Tuberous Sclerosis 'Exciting'
Teaser: The new results may open the door to eventually being able to treat epilepsy, not just seizures, researchers say.

Headlines: Repeated Ketamine May Sustain Antidepressant Effect
Teaser: Repeated administration of ketamine may help prolong the antidepressant effect in patients with treatment-resistant depression.

Headlines: First Osteoporotic Break Increases Subsequent Fracture Risk
Teaser: The risk of a second osteoporotic fracture is greatest in the year following a first break, and patients should be treated immediately to prevent future     fractures. Risk remains high for 10 years.

Headlines: Once-Daily Epilepsy Drug Equivalent to Twice-Daily Drug
Teaser: A new study shows eslicarbazepine acetate is equivalent in efficacy to twice-daily carbamazepine monotherapy.

Headlines: Fingolimod Easier to Swallow Than Dimethyl Fumarate?
Teaser: Patients with multiple sclerosis are more likely to discontinue dimethyl fumarate than fingolimod after 2 years or less, largely because of tolerability issues, a real-world study has found.

Headlines: Hope for Advanced HNSCC at Last From Immunotherapy
Teaser: Nivolumab significantly improved survival for patients with advanced refractory head and neck cancer.

Headlines: Sleep Problems Linked to Reduced Brain Volume
Teaser: Sleep problems in older adults have been link to reduced brain volume, new research shows.

Headlines: MammaPrint Shows Which Breast Cancer Patients Can Skip Chemo
Teaser: The first outcome data from a huge European trial show that the 70-gene assay can identify patients who can safety skip chemotherapy.

Headlines: Sorafenib a Possible Option for Medullary Thyroid Carcinoma?
Teaser: Sorafenib might be a suitable option for treating advanced MTC, when the standard drugs are not available.

Headlines: Metformin Remains Best First-line Therapy for Type 2 Diabetes
Teaser: Despite the introduction of many new drug classes to treat type 2 diabetes, a contemporary systematic review concludes that metformin should remain as     first choice for first-line therapy.

Headlines: Uneven Use of Antibiotic Prophylaxis in Pediatric Surgery
Teaser: Antibiotic prophylaxis rates varied greatly among pediatric hospitals; it was both over- and underused.

Headlines: New AAN Guideline on Use of Botulinum Neurotoxins
Teaser: The American Academy of Neurology has released new recommendations on the use of botulinum neurotoxin products in the treatment of blepharospasm, cervical dystonia, adult spasticity, and headache.

Headlines: Depression Yet Another Side Effect of ADT?
Teaser: Older men (age 65 and older) with localized prostate cancer may be at increased risk of developing depression.

Headlines: Slashing the Cost of Cure: Hep C Generics' First Data Shine
Teaser: Generic medications for hepatitis C, which are about 1% of the cost of brand-name drugs, pay back big, according to preliminary results from the REDEMPTION-1 trial.

Headlines: More Patients Living Longer: Latest Immunotherapy Data
Teaser: The latest data for survival on nivolumab are better than those previously seen with ipilimumab, and both show that some patients live for years.

Headlines: Reader Poll: What's Your Opinion of FDA Watch Lists?
Teaser: The FDA has fallen behind on reporting serious adverse effects with drugs.

Headlines: OTC Antihistamine Promotes Remyelination in MS
Teaser: The first randomized trial showing efficacy for a remyelinating agent in MS suggests it is possible to repair injury to nerve cells.

Headlines: Vitamin D Boosts LVEF, Not Walk Distance, in HF Study
Teaser: Although vitamin D treatment is safe and may improve ventricular remodeling, and by extension, outcomes, in patients with heart failure, say investigators, observers are skeptical.

Headlines: SSRI May Help Alzheimer's Agitation, but Caveats Abound
Teaser: The selective serotonin reuptake inhibitor citalopram may reduce agitation in patients with Alzheimer's disease, but only at high doses, which are not recommended by the FDA.

Headlines: New Practice Guidelines on Antipsychotic Use in Dementia
Teaser: Judicious use of antipsychotics to treat agitation or psychosis in patients with dementia is the focus of new practice guidelines from the American Psychiatric Association.

Headlines: Adjuvant Whole-Brain Radiotherapy: End of an Era?
Teaser: Updated data from the N0574 study confirm no improvement in overall survival but greater cognitive deterioration with adjunct whole-brain radiotherapy in patients with one to three brain metastases.

Headlines: Scalp Cooling Safe, Long-term European Data Show
Teaser: Scalp cooling, which reduces hair loss during chemotherapy, has not been embraced in the United States, although 40 years of European data show that it is safe.

Headlines: From Brintellix to Trintellix: Drug's Name Changes for Safety
Teaser: The FDA has approved a brand name change for the antidepressant Brintellix to decrease the risk of prescribing and dispensing errors due to name confusion with an antiplatelet agent.

Headlines: Ixazomib in First All-Oral Triplet for Multiple Myeloma
Teaser: The trial showing efficacy for ixazomib in the first oral triplet regimen for the treatment of relapsed, refractory multiple myeloma has now published.

Headlines: FDA Okays Oral Formulation of Perampanel (Fycompa)
Teaser: Perampanel (Fycompa) will now be available in oral suspension formulation for partial-onset seizures with or without secondary generalized seizures, as well as primary generalized tonic-clonic seizures for patients aged 12 years and older.

Headlines: Hospital Discharge: One of the Most Dangerous Times for Patients
Teaser: Within two weeks of Joyce Oyler's discharge from the hospital, sores developed in her mouth and throat, and blood began seeping from her nose and bowels.

Headlines: FDA Okays Pimavanserin for Hallucinations, Delusions in PD
Teaser: The drug is the first one approved to treat hallucinations and delusions associated with psychosis in Parkinson's disease.

Headlines: FDA Expands Breath-Actuated Inhaler Use to Kids as Young as 4
Teaser: The rescue inhaler ProAir RespiClick offers a new option for younger patients that eliminates the need for hand-breath coordination during inhalation.

Headlines: CHMP Likes Gilead's TAF-Based HIV Regimen Odefsey
Teaser: Odefsey is a fixed-dose combination pill containing emtricitabine, rilpivirine, and tenofovir alafenamide that recently cleared the US Food and Drug Administration.

Headlines: European Panel Endorses Three Cancer Drugs
Teaser: The European regulators were busy this week with announcements about two drugs for hematologic cancers and one for neuroendocrine tumors.

Headlines: EMA Panel Backs Daclizumab (Zinbryta) for Multiple Sclerosis
Teaser: Daclizumab, a once-monthly injection, offers a targeted mechanism of action that is not expected to cause broad and prolonged immune cell depletion.

Headlines: Yoga Improves Quality of Life in Pulmonary Hypertension
Teaser: Adults with pulmonary arterial hypertension could derive some relief from yoga, results from a preliminary study suggest. The 12-week program eased anxiety and depression, among other measures.

Headlines: No Link Between Smoking Cessation Meds and Serious Side Effects
Teaser: A large study of psychiatric and nonpsychiatric patients showed no increased risk for previously suggested neuropsychiatric side effects that prompted an FDA box warning.

Headlines: Natalizumab Misses Endpoint in Secondary Progressive MS
Teaser: In the ASCEND trial, treatment did not delay disease progression, the primary endpoint, although there was a benefit on upper-extremity function.

Headlines: Off-Label Ketamine Prescribing: US Psychiatrists Troubled
Teaser: With limited evidence ketamine is effective for the short-term treatment of depression and almost no long-term safety and efficacy data, US psychiatrists are troubled by off-label prescribing.

Headlines: Adverse Reactions to Antihistamines More Common Than Thought
Teaser: Headaches, sleepiness, rashes, behavioral changes, and convulsions were among the adverse events linked to antihistamine use in children in a population-based study.

Headlines: Release Raises False Alarm Over Hep B Meds and Cancer Risk
Teaser: A news release issued at the International Liver Congress warned that long-term treatment of hepatitis B is linked to colorectal and cervical cancer, but the study came to the opposite conclusion.

Headlines: Dichlorphenamide Shows Clear Benefit in Periodic Paralysis
Teaser: Dichlorphenamide reduces the rate and severity of muscle weakness attacks and improves quality of life in patients with hypokalemic and hyperkalemic periodic paralysis.

Headlines: Latest Data: Calcium Supplements Not Associated With CVD
Teaser: New analysis shows calcium supplements and/or vitamin D do not adversely affect CVD outcomes in middle-aged or older men and women -- an important finding, given their role in osteoporosis prevention.

Headlines: CKD Tied to Increased Risk for Hospital-Acquired Complications
Teaser: Hospitalized patients with chronic kidney disease were 19% more likely than those with normal kidney function to experience complications in a review of outcomes from a population-based cohort.

Headlines: MS Drug Linked to Colorectal Cancer Risk
Teaser: Despite its cardiotoxicity -- and now possibly colorectal cancer risk -- mitoxantrone might still be an appropriate therapy in carefully selected patients, researchers say.

Headlines: Immediate ADT Improves Survival in Relapsed Prostate Cancer
Teaser: Delayed ADT was associated with worse overall survival in men with PSA relapsed or noncurable prostate cancer, but there are caveats.

Headlines: DBS Cuts Depression in Treatment-Resistant Patients
Teaser: A new study shows that stimulation of the ventral anterior limb of the internal capsule significantly reduces depressive symptoms in patients with treatment-resistant depression.

Headlines: Botulinum Toxin Beats Neuromodulation for Overactive Bladder
Teaser: Onabotulinum toxin A injection appears to be more effective than sacral neuromodulation for urinary incontinence, but comes with more adverse effects, including urinary tract infection.

Headlines: Prostate Cancer: French HIFU Study Adds to Debate
Teaser: A French study used HIFU to perform hemiablation of the prostate in men with low- and intermediate-risk cancer, adding to the debate on how and when the approach should be used.

Headlines: Olanzapine Linked to Rare but Serious Skin Reaction, FDA Warns
Teaser: The US Food and Drug Administration is warning that the antipsychotic olanzapine has been linked to a rare but potentially life-threatening skin condition.

Headlines: 'Major' Ketamine Discovery May Lead to New Antidepressants
Teaser: A 'major' discovery that explains how ketamine produces its swift antidepressant effect may lead to the development of rapid-onset agents that have none of the harms typically linked to the drug.

Headlines: FDA Panel Votes for IR Opioid but Without Abuse Labeling
Teaser: Despite the drug company's presentations, FDA advisory committee members didn't find enough evidence to recommend abuse-deterrent labeling for the new immediate-release product.

Headlines: Testosterone Pill Is Safe, Has 'Very Good Science'
Teaser: A new oral testosterone formulation for hypogonadism has no liver toxicity, which has been a problem with other testosterone pills.

Headlines: New FDA-Approved Prostate 'Tool': Will You HIFU?
Teaser: High-intensity focused ultrasound (HIFU) is approved for prostate ablation but not for the treatment of prostate cancer. Why? What now?

Headlines: Warfarin, AF May Each Contribute to Dementia Risk in AF
Teaser: Anticoagulation clearly plays a role in long-term brain health, a researcher notes, but "we learned as well that atrial fibrillation is an additive disease state, in that it increases risk beyond anticoagulation."

Headlines: VANISH: Ablation for Recurrent VT Bests Intensified Amiodarone
Teaser: UPDATED // Catheter ablation reduced the primary outcome compared with aggressive drug therapy and should be the preferred treatment in this population, the authors     said.

Headlines: ToxT Adds Time Dimension to Assess AEs of Cancer Treatment
Teaser: A new analytic approach, known as Toxicity over Time (ToxT), incorporates the dimension of time into adverse event reporting in oncology clinical trials.

Headlines: Ultrasound Thalamotomy Benefits Essential Tremor
Teaser: The investigational treatment of focused ultrasound shows significant improvement over sham treatment at 3 months, with sustained improvement at 12 months.

Headlines: Perioperative Rosuvastatin Fails to Curb Cardiac Surgery Complications
Teaser: Although the adverse effects on renal function may relate to patient ethnicity or rosuvastatin use, "a class effect of statin therapy in patients     undergoing cardiac surgery cannot be ruled out," the authors said.

Headlines: AHA/ASA Issues First-Ever Stroke Rehabilitation Guidelines
Teaser: The new guidelines call for intensive multidisciplinary treatment of patients after a stroke and stress the importance of communication and coordination among those providing care.

Headlines: Behavioral Therapy for ADHD: Recommendations Ignored?
Teaser: Very young children with ADHD are still not being referred for behavioral therapy as first-line treatment despite current AAP recommendations to do so.

Headlines: Success With Stem Cell Transplant in Myasthenia Gravis
Teaser: Seven patients with severe myasthenia gravis who received autologous hematopoietic stem cell transplants have experienced long-term remission.

Headlines: Impulse Control Problems Linked to Antipsychotic, FDA Warns
Teaser: The FDA is warning of impulse control problems associated with the atypical antipsychotic aripiprazole.

Headlines: Single-Dose Drug Decreases Bone Loss in Newly Treated HIV
Teaser: A single dose of zoledronic acid given at the start of ART decreases bone loss over the course of 48 weeks in HIV, according to a small, single-center, proof-of-concept study.

Headlines: Education, Reminders Reduce Risky Prescriptions for Elders
Teaser: Education and electronic reminders can reduce the prescription of potentially inappropriate medication to older patients discharged from the emergency department, new research shows.

Headlines: Androgen Treatment Leads to Elongated Telomeres in Small Trial
Teaser: The phase 1-2 study showed such unexpectedly high efficacy from treatment with the sex hormone danazol that investigators ended the study early.

Headlines: ECT an Effective Treatment Option for Schizophrenia
Teaser: Electroconvulsive therapy may be an effective treatment option for patients with schizophrenia, new research suggests.

Headlines: Death Risk With Off-Label Oral Ketoconazole Use, FDA Warns
Teaser: Clinicians continue to prescribe ketoconazole tablets for skin and nail fungal infections, even though the FDA withdrew those indications in 2013 in light of the risk for liver damage and death.

Headlines: FDA Warns About Amputation Risk With Canagliflozin
Teaser: UPDATED // The agency is investigating whether the twofold increase in amputations seen in an ongoing trial is attributable to the drug.

Headlines: Midday Napping May Raise HTN Risk, Says Meta-analysis
Teaser: Although noting several limitations, experts say this analysis of more than 112,000 individuals "grabbed attention" and "provides food for thought"     for clinicians.

Headlines: LEADERS FREE: Adieu to Bare-Metal Stents for High-Bleed-Risk ACS
Teaser: Bare-metal stents should not be used for high-bleeding-risk ACS patients undergoing PCI, the authors say, but left unanswered is whether dual-antiplatelet     therapy can be cut short with drug-eluting stents.

Headlines: Polymer Temporarily Protects and Tightens Skin, Smoothes Wrinkles
Teaser: Material made from a silicone-based polymer can mimic the properties of normal youthful skin and shows promise for improving appearance, treating dry skin, and providing ultraviolet protection, researchers report.

Headlines: APS Issues New Guidance on Medical Marijuana for Pain
Teaser: With patients increasingly turning to herbal cannabis for chronic pain -- legally or not --  the American Pain Society white paper offers clinical guidance and strong suggestions on the need for more research.

Headlines: Promising Data With Ketamine in Chronic and Phantom Limb Pain
Teaser: The key to avoiding adverse effects with ketamine is to start at a low dose, says one clinician.

Headlines: Lithium May Best Newer Drugs at Reducing Self-harm in BD
Teaser: In this study of more than 6500 bipolar disorder patients, lithium was better at reducing rates of self-harm and unintended injury compared with newer drugs commonly prescribed for this condition.

Headlines: CAM Use May Delay Chemotherapy in Breast Cancer
Teaser: Breast cancer patients with early-stage disease who use dietary supplements are less likely to initiate recommended chemotherapy, new research shows.

Headlines: Falling, Serious Injury in Elderly Tied to Changes in BP Meds
Teaser: Now there are data showing that after starting antihypertensive meds or raising their dosages, physicians should keep a closer eye on older patients to     make sure they tolerate the changes, say researchers.

Headlines: Limit Fluoroquinolone Use in Light of Risks, FDA Says
Teaser: Clinicians should not prescribe these antibiotics to patients with uncomplicated infections such as sinusitis if there are other treatment options, the agency said.

Headlines: Giant Cell Arteritis: Ustekinumab Shows Activity in Early Trial
Teaser: Ustekinumab was associated with lower steroid doses in some patients with GCA and reduced arterial wall thickening.

Headlines: Vaccine Boosts Glioblastoma Survival
Teaser: A novel combination of cytomegalovirus-targeted dendritic cell vaccine and tetanus preconditioning shows a significant increase in survival and improved immune response in glioblastoma.

Headlines: Where Cancer Care Falls Short, According to Patients
Teaser: Despite believing their medical care is excellent, US cancer patients often feel inadequately informed about a lot of things, according to new polling of 3000 adults with cancer.

Headlines: Relapses Rebound in Patients With MS Stopping Fingolimod
Teaser: As seen with natalizumab, a new study shows patients may experience rebound in relapses after stopping fingolimod.

Headlines: Proton Pump Inhibitors Accelerate Cellular Aging
Teaser: A new study suggests that chronic use of a proton pump inhibitor (PPI) accelerates aging of endothelial cells.

Headlines: Benefits of Medical Marijuana May Outweigh Risks
Teaser: For pain, medical marijuana appears to be more effective than conventional medications, with few, and very minor, adverse effects, new research shows.

Headlines: Second-generation Antipsychotics: Not All Equal
Teaser: A systematic review and meta-analysis of various second-generation antipsychotic agents in the treatment of first-episode psychosis finds that not all are created equal.

Headlines: ADHD Medication May Boost Kids' Arrhythmia Risk
Teaser: Children and young people prescribed methylphenidate, commonly used in ADHD, have an increased risk for arrhythmia in the weeks after initiation of treatment.

Headlines: High Prolactin Levels Signal Antipsychotic Toxicity
Teaser: Monitoring prolactin levels in plasma is a way to accurately assess potential toxicity of antipsychotic medications in patients aged 55 years and older.

Headlines: What Will You Tell Breast Cancer Patients About MA-17R?
Teaser: A major clinical trial indicates that 5 more years of an aromatase inhibitor in postmenopausal women yields a disease-free survival benefit as well as adverse events. Is the treatment worthwhile?

Headlines: FDA Clears Obeticholic Acid for Primary Biliary Cholangitis
Teaser: The first new treatment in almost 20 years for the condition, Ocaliva is for use in combination with UDCA in adults with poor response to UDCA or as a single therapy in adults unable to tolerate UDCA.

Headlines: FDA Approves Daclizumab (Zinbryta) for Multiple Sclerosis
Teaser: The US Food and Drug Administration has approved daclizumab for treatment of patients with MS who are not responsive to other agents; the approval comes with a Risk Evaluation and Mitigation Strategy.

Headlines: Reader Poll: Are Fluoroquinolones Safe?
Teaser: The FDA recently issued a warning about serious adverse effects after fluoroquinolone use. Will you continue to prescribe them to your patients?

Headlines: FDA OKs Buprenorphine Implant (Probuphine) for Opioid Dependence
Teaser: The new buprenorphine subdermal implant could be 'game changer' in the battle to combat opioid use disorder.

Headlines: Antipsychotic-Related Metabolic Testing Falls Far Short
Teaser: Although rates of annual glucose testing among adults prescribed antipsychotics are high, fewer than half of patients undergo lipid testing, an analysis of Medicaid data suggests.

Headlines: Mindfulness Therapy May Prevent Depression Relapse
Teaser: Mindfulness-based cognitive therapy substantially reduces the risk for relapse in patients with recurrent depression, a new meta-analysis confirms.

Headlines: Benzodiazepines Are Often Inappropriately Prescribed
Teaser: Although the drugs have known adverse effects for people with depression, 52% of prescriptions, which often come from primary care physicians, were concurrent with prescriptions for antidepressants.

Headlines: FDA Panel OKs Sanofi Insulin-GLP-1 Combo for Diabetes
Teaser: The committee was concerned about the pen injectors used to deliver the medication as well as the potential for allergic reactions.

Headlines: Economic Crisis of 2008 Followed by Excess Cancer Deaths
Teaser: An analysis of data from 75 countries shows an increase of cancer deaths, particularly in countries without universal healthcare coverage.

Headlines: Gastric Endoscopic Myotomy Showing Promise for Gastroparesis
Teaser: For patients with refractory disease, gastric peroral endoscopic myotomy (G-POEM) can reduce hospitalizations, improve symptoms, and normalize gastric emptying time, early research suggests.

Headlines: NICE Recommends Three Diabetes Treatments
Teaser: The National Institute for Health and Care Excellence (NICE) is issuing guidance recommending three existing drugs as individual treatments for type 2 diabetes.

Headlines: FDA Panel Backs Novo Nordisk Insulin-GLP-1 Combination, IDegLira
Teaser: The committee said that it was uncertain about which patients would most benefit from the combination.

Headlines: Pregabalin Linked to Major Birth Defects
Teaser: Exposure to pregabalin, an antiepileptic also prescribed for pain and psychiatric disorders, during pregnancy is linked to a 3-fold increased risk for major birth defects, a new study suggests.

Headlines: Lyme and Other Tickborne Diseases in New Hampshire
Teaser: New Hampshire continues to have one of the highest rates of Lyme disease in the nation. The state's Division of Public Health Services provides advice on diagnosis and treatment.

Headlines: Skin Cancer Patients Face Deadly Risk Using 'Black Salve' Home Remedy
Teaser: People who fear they have skin cancer, or know it, and decide to try an unapproved product called "black salve" may face infection, scarring and worse cancer outcomes, doctors warn.

Headlines: New Neurotoxicity From Immunotherapy for Advanced Melanoma?
Teaser: Two cases of severe demyelinating polyradiculoneuropathy linked to pembrolizumab prompt calls for increased awareness of this 'devastating' complication.

Headlines: Should Patients Get a Money-Back Guarantee?
Teaser: One major health system is giving the radical idea a try. So far, one executive sees it as a positive 'disruption' -- another calls it 'nutty.'

Headlines: Lichenoid Features Tied to Cancer Immunotherapy Skin Problems
Teaser: Skin eruptions in cancer patients due to use of antagonist antibodies to programmed cell death 1 (PD-1) and programmed cell death ligand 1 (PD-L1) show lichenoid features on histologic analysis, according to a small case series.

Headlines: FDA Panel Backs Approval of Psoriasis Drug Brodalumab
Teaser: The panelists said that patients should be given proper informed consent about the risk for suicide.

Headlines: Avoiding Meds That Worsen, Cause HF: AHA Presents Action Plan
Teaser: Though geared for heart failure patients of all ages, the AHA's new statement, "implicates almost every   medication most older patients are taking," says one expert.

Headlines: Variable LDL-C Tied to Worse Memory-Test Scores, MRI Findings
Teaser: The study adds to "emerging evidence that vascular factors are of importance to brain health and underscores that LDL-C variability might be a useful risk marker,"   the lead author says.

Headlines: Experts Warn Against DIY Brain Stimulation
Teaser: In response to reports of the general public using 'do-it-yourself' transcranial electrical stimulation to 'zap themselves smarter,' several experts have warned of the possible dangers of this practice

Headlines: EMA Begins Review of Retinoid Drugs
Teaser: An EMA committee has begun a review of retinoids because of concerns about the adequacy of pregnancy prevention programs and product information regarding the risk for neuropsychiatric disorders.

Headlines: FDA Approves First OTC Retinoid (Differin Gel 0.1%) for Acne
Teaser: The product contains the first new active ingredient for OTC acne treatment since the 1980s.

Headlines: PRAC to Review Risks of Modified-Release Paracetamol
Teaser: The agency will consider measures to minimize risk and reduce harm of overdose with modified- and prolonged-release paracetamol products.

Headlines: Bring Back HPV Vaccination, Say Japanese Experts
Teaser: The Japanese government withdrew its recommendation for the HPV vaccine because of concern over side effects, but some physicians are urging the government to reconsider.

Headlines: Novel Cancer Weight-loss Drugs Needed to Improve Outcomes
Teaser: Medications to tackle cachexia in cancer patients that reflect recent breakthroughs in our understanding of the pathological process are needed, say         palliative care experts.

Headlines: Gastric Bypass Superior to Medical Management of Diabetes But With Side Effects
Teaser: Gastric bypass is more effective than lifestyle-medical management alone in achieving diabetes treatment goals, but the effect of surgery diminishes over time and is associated with more adverse events, researchers report.

Headlines: Checkpoint Inhibitors Linked to Inflammatory Arthritis
Teaser: Inflammatory arthritis and sicca syndrome have been reported with ipilimumab and/or nivolumab, and the conditions can persist after stopping therapy.

Headlines: Antidepressants Have a Role to Play in Schizophrenia
Teaser: A review of adjunctive antidepressants in schizophrenia shows these agents have a role to play in patients with predominantly negative or depressive symptoms.

Headlines: Guidelines Updated on Pediatric Sedation
Teaser: The American Academy of Pediatrics and the American Academy of Pediatric Dentistry have issued updated guidelines on pediatric sedation.

Headlines: Cell-Based Therapy for Transplant Patients Gets OK in Europe
Teaser: A novel product that consists of T cells has been recommended for conditional approval for use in stem cell transplant patients in Europe.

Headlines: Second-Generation Antipsychotics Offer Better Quality of Life
Teaser: Schizophrenia patients taking a second-generation drug reported better quality of life compared with those taking first-generation agents.

Headlines: Ticagrelor Stopped by Many Stable Patients With Prior MI
Teaser: Discontinuation was seen mostly in the first year of treatment and emphasizes that "patients may make decisions about treatment without telling their physician or     acknowledging adverse events," caution researchers.

Headlines: Can Patients Discontinue Immunotherapy and Still Benefit?
Teaser: Overall, there are few data on whether to and when to discontinue immunotherapy, but clues from trials show continued benefit.

Headlines: AAP: Stop Giving Codeine to Children
Teaser: The American Academy of Pediatrics urges parents and healthcare providers to stop giving codeine to children and calls for formal restrictions on its use.

Headlines: Vaccine Maverick 'Dr Bob' Sears Accused of Negligence
Teaser: Known for his alternative childhood vaccination schedules, Dr Sears could lose his license in a case brought by the California medical board.

Headlines: DCIS Score Fails Cost-Effectiveness Test
Teaser: The Oncotype DX DCIS Score was not cost-effective in any of five different treatment strategies that were analyzed.

Headlines: FDA Questions Validity of Smoking Cessation Drug Research
Teaser: The FDA has raised concerns about a postmarketing study that examined adverse neuropsychiatric events associated with smoking cessation drugs varenicline and bupropion.

Headlines: Novel SGLT Inhibitor Adds Benefit to Insulin in Type 1 Diabetes
Teaser: A study design includes "optimized" insulin to demonstrate additional benefit for sotagliflozin, but the safety profile may be an issue and "awaits further     results."

Headlines: 'America's Other Drug Problem': High Volume of Prescriptions for Elderly
Teaser: Older people are often given a huge number of medications, and many of them are unnecessary or even harmful.

Headlines: Fingerprints Disappear During Capecitabine Therapy
Teaser: The commonly used chemotherapy agent capecitabine can leave many patients without fingerprints, but the effect is temporary.

Headlines: Optical Coherence Tomography: Modest Benefit in PCI
Teaser: The imaging technology was not associated with adverse effects, despite increasing PCI procedural time and contrast-media exposure in the DOCTORS study.

Headlines: Metformin Mitigates Antipsychotic Weight Gain in Autism
Teaser: A study finds metformin effective in decreasing weight gain associated with atypical antipsychotic use in children and adolescents with autism spectrum disorder.

Headlines: EpiPen Price Hikes: What to Know
Teaser: The rising cost of a life-saving allergy drug dispenser is raising eyebrows at the pharmacy counter and on Capitol Hill.

Headlines: Oral Contraceptives Don't Impair Sexual Function, at Least Overall
Teaser: Still, use of a levonorgestrel-based contraceptive in a trial had modest but significant adverse effects on measures of arousal and pleasure, and "for     individual women, we believe it could be of clinical importance."

Headlines: Spotting Psychosis Linked to AEDs in Epilepsy
Teaser: The identification of antiepilepsy drug-induced psychotic disorders among epilepsy patients may become easier after the identification of several associated factors, say Australian researchers.

Headlines: Vancomycin in Cataract Procedures May Cause Blindness
Teaser: Researchers have documented 35 eyes with severe hemorrhagic occlusive retinal vasculitis after treatment with vancomycin during cataract procedures.

Headlines: FDA: 'Unique' Toxicity With Failed French Drug
Teaser: The investigational FAAH inhibitor BIA 10-2474 exhibits a unique toxicity that does not extend to other drugs in the class, the FDA has concluded.

Headlines: Can Chemotherapy Affect Developing Ovaries in Female Fetus?
Teaser: Experimental data suggest that chemotherapy given during pregnancy could affect ovary development in the fetus.

Headlines: Counterfeit Alprazolam Poses a 'Major Public Health Threat'
Teaser: Counterfeit alprazolam tablets containing the highly potent opioid fentanyl have been behind a series of cases of central nervous system depression and death in California.

Headlines: Transdermal Buprenorphine May Ease Neuropathic Pain, With Caveat
Teaser: For diabetes patients with moderate-to-severe neuropathic pain, those who can tolerate the treatment often experience significant relief.

Headlines: Parents' Vaccine Acceptance Continues to Rise, Clinicians Say
Teaser: A comparison of the 2016 and 2015 Medscape surveys on vaccine acceptance shows that the increase last year wasn't a temporary boost from reaction to the California measles outbreak. Still, more than 1 in 3 clinicians see no gains.

Headlines: Class Action Lawsuit Against HPV Vaccine Filed in Japan
Teaser: The class action lawsuit has 63 plaintiffs claiming a wide range of health problems that they say developed after receiving the HPV vaccine.

Headlines: Fluoroquinolone Label Warning Strengthened by FDA
Teaser: The FDA updated fluoroquinolone labeling to warn against routine use in patients with acute bacterial sinusitis, acute exacerbation of chronic bronchitis, and uncomplicated urinary tract infections.

Headlines: Post-Finasteride Syndrome Not Related to Androgen Deficiency
Teaser: Men who report persistent sexual symptoms after using finasteride for hair loss do not show abnormalities in androgens or their receptors, according to a new report.

Headlines: Methotrexate Helpful in Some With Laryngotracheal Stenosis
Teaser: In patients with rapidly recurrent nonvasculitic laryngotracheal stenosis (LTS), low-dose methotrexate may be an effective adjunct to surgery, researchers say.

Headlines: Antidepressants Worsen Sexual Dysfunction and Depression?
Teaser: Currently available antidepressants that lead to sexual problems may make depression worse, results of a new survey show.

Headlines: Micronutrient Deficiency Often Unnoticed in PPI Users
Teaser: Proton pump inhibitors (PPIs) raise the risk for micronutrient deficiency, but clinicians rarely check for it, a small study warns.

Headlines: New Antipsychotic Effective With Placebo-like Side Effects
Teaser: Several positive studies support pursuit of approval for a first-in-class antipsychotic with efficacy comparable to that of current medications but with a placebo-like side effect profile.

Headlines: Nivolumab Ups Quality of Life in Head and Neck Cancer Pts
Teaser: Patients with advanced head and neck cancer who have progressed following first-line treatment have stable or improved symptoms and function with nivolumab immunotherapy, phase 3 trial data reveal.

Headlines: SSRIs Disrupt Sleep in the Elderly, May Contribute to Dementia
Teaser: Antidepressants, especially SSRIs, can significantly disrupt sleep architecture in elderly patients and may contribute to early neurodegeneration that can progress to dementia, new research shows.

Headlines: Drug Cuts Tardive Dyskinesia in Psychiatric Patients
Teaser: Valbenazine reduces the severity of tardive dyskinesia and works in both psychotic patients and those with mood disorders with no risk for psychiatric instability during the course of treatment.

Headlines: Herbal and Dietary Supplements Tied to Liver Damage
Teaser: One in five cases of chemical-induced liver damage come from herbal and dietary supplements, a research review concludes.

Headlines: Suboptimal Reporting of Adverse Events in Pivotal Cancer CTs
Teaser: Many FDA-approved trials for treatment of advanced cancers had suboptimal reporting for recurrent and late toxicities and duration of AEs.

Headlines: Pricey New Treatment Roils Issues of How to Treat Prostate Cancer
Teaser: High-intensity focused ultrasound, often not covered by insurance, leads to discussions about which patients benefit in the real world.

Headlines: Hypnotics Linked to Increased Suicide Risk
Teaser: Hypnotic medications such as benzodiazepines may be linked to an increased risk for suicide and suicidal ideation, although the impact of comorbid depression and substance use remains unclear.

Headlines: New FDA Watch List Covers 27 Drugs and Drug Classes
Teaser: The quarterly list of drugs and unexpected adverse events includes treatments for disorders ranging from diabetes and depression to multiple sclerosis and hypertension.

Headlines: HCV Drugs May Reactivate HBV, FDA Warns
Teaser: A boxed warning for nine direct-acting antiviral drugs for HCV advises clinicians to screen for current or prior HVB infections.

Headlines: New Tenofovir Formulation Provides Safer Hepatitis B Treatment
Teaser: A new prodrug formulation, tenofovir alafenamide, effectively treats chronic hepatitis B virus (HBV) infection with fewer bone and renal adverse effects than tenofovir disoproxil fumarate, according to two noninferiority trials.

Headlines: Is IMRT for Gynecologic Cancers Less Toxic?
Teaser: Pelvic IMRT reduces acute patient-reported toxicity compared to standard pelvic radiation therapy.

Headlines: Lenvatinib: 'Real-World' Therapy for Differentiated Thyroid Cancer
Teaser: The first reports of the drug outside of the clinical trial setting show efficacy but early side effects.

Headlines: Statin Safety Claims in Lancet Reignite Acrimony
Teaser: The statin review is being cast as more than yearlong effort to set the record straight regarding the safety and efficacy of statin therapy and at the same time "a total whitewash."

Headlines: Emergency Contraceptives Affected by Other Medications, UK Warns
Teaser: The UK's version of the FDA is warning that emergency contraceptives may not work properly when combined with certain other common medications.

Headlines: Adverse Effects Underreported in Clinical Trials
Teaser: Adverse effects of medical treatments appear to be underreported in peer-reviewed journal articles that describe clinical trial results, a new systematic review has found.

Headlines: Dual VA and Medicare Use Tied to Risky Prescribing
Teaser: Policies that allow veterans to use both Veterans Affairs facilities and other healthcare systems exposed patients with dementia to potentially harmful drug prescribing, a new study has found.

Headlines: Don't Rush to Ban or Use Kratom, Expert Says
Teaser: A new review contends the herbal remedy kratom has some beneficial properties, suggesting a Drug Enforcement Administration proposal to make it illegal could bring legitimate research to a standstill.

Headlines: MEK Inhibitors Linked to Ocular Adverse Effects
Teaser: MEK inhibitors appear to be associated with a risk for ocular side effects, and patients should be monitored.

Headlines: What's Hot at ASH 2016 Meeting?
Teaser: New data to be presented at the upcoming American Society of Hematology (ASH) annual meeting will likely change clinical practice for some patients with lymphoma.

Headlines: Recall of Cantrell, Tri-Coast Drugs for Sterility Concerns
Teaser: Concerns about lack of sterility have led Cantrell Drug Company and Tri-Coast Pharmacy to recall numerous lots of drug products used for various indications.

Headlines: Cannabis Helpful for Drug Addiction, Mental Health Disorders?
Teaser: A new review suggests cannabis may be useful in the treatment of substance use disorders and anxiety disorders, particularly PTSD. However, more research is needed.

Headlines: ED Visits for Adverse Drug Reactions Common and Rising
Teaser: Four of every 1000 individuals will go to the emergency department for an adverse drug reaction each year, and that number is rising in older adults, a new study has found.

Headlines: Ustekinumab Effective in TNFi-Refractory Crohn's Disease
Teaser: Ustekinumab induced early response and sustained remission at 44 weeks significantly better than did placebo, with a similar side effect profile, three trials have found.

Headlines: New Standard in ER+ Breast Cancer, but How to Proceed?
Teaser: Palbociclib improves progression-free survival in advanced disease to an unprecedented degree, but does that mean it should automatically be used in every patient?

Headlines: Prescribers Have Poor Understanding of Penicillin Allergy
