Teaser: Inpatient healthcare providers who prescribe medications have little understanding of when to consult an allergist about a documented penicillin allergy, a new survey shows.

Headlines: FDA Approves Boxed Warning for Essure
Teaser: The new label for the permanent contraceptive device highlights possible adverse events such as perforation of the uterus or fallopian tubes.

Headlines: Questioning Ethics of Costly Drugs for Metastatic Cancer
Teaser: Spending a six-figure sum to prolong a life by a few weeks or months is unaffordable and is inappropriate for many patients, argues a UK clinician.

Headlines: Testing Penicillin Allergy Cuts Wide-Spectrum Antibiotic Use
Teaser: Hospitals can substantially reduce the use of beta-lactam antibiotics in patients at high risk for infection by screening to verify penicillin allergy, new research shows.

Headlines: Off-Label Drug, Medical Device Use Discussed at FDA Hearing
Teaser: The FDA held a 2-day public hearing to solicit input about the marketing and use of medications and medical devices for off-label use.

Headlines: FDA Clears Tenofovir Alafenamide (Vemlidy) for Chronic HBV
Teaser: Once-daily Vemlidy has similar efficacy to tenofovir disoproxil (Viread) with fewer bone and renal side effects, the company says.

Headlines: Childhood Cancer Survivors Continue to Report Poor Health
Teaser: Childhood cancer survivors treated in a more modern era of cancer care still report equal levels of perceived ill health as those treated in a much earlier era despite receiving less toxic therapy.

Headlines: Fatal Myocarditis -- Rare New ADR With Immunotherapy
Teaser: Fatal myocarditis has been reported in melanoma patients treated with ipilimumab and nivolumab; this appears to be a rare T-cell-driven reaction.

Headlines: More Information on Adverse Effects in Tragic French Trial
Teaser: Clinical details on four of the volunteers who received the drug that caused severe neurologic reactions -- including death in one case -- have now been published in NEJM.

Headlines: 'Unprecedented' Rise in Pediatric Opioid Poisonings
Teaser: Hospitalizations for pediatric opioid poisonings rose sharply from 1997 to 2012, and the largest increase was among toddlers and preschoolers, a new study has found.

Headlines: FDA Recommends Boxed Warning, Decision Guide for Essure
Teaser: The boxed warning should list adverse events that may be associated with the device, and the decision guide should be signed by patient and provider.

Headlines: Questions Over Adjuvant Ipilimumab in Melanoma
Teaser: An editorial raises questions on data for patient-reported outcomes for adjuvant ipilimumab, 10 mg/kg, in melanoma; toxicity also questioned.

Headlines: Some Stop Immunotherapy, Still Have Controlled Cancer
Teaser: In a small study of patients with advanced renal cell carcinoma, nearly half had durable responses after discontinuing checkpoint inhibitors because of toxicities.

Headlines: Air Pollution 'a Catalyst' for Obesity, Diabetes in Children
Teaser: "Poor air quality appears to be a catalyst for obesity and diabetes in     children," conclude authors of a study finding a role for exposure to air     pollution in the etiology of type 2 diabetes in youth.

Headlines: Why the FDA Took 23 Years to Warn About Morcellators
Teaser: Power morcellators can spread occult uterine cancer, but manufacturers, hospitals, and physicians didn't start telling the FDA about such mishaps until an injured patient did so more than 2 decades after the first device was approved.

Headlines: PRAC: Selexipag Under Review, Starts Antibiotic Safety Review
Teaser: PRAC advises continued use of selexipag (Uptravi), on the basis of preliminary data review; launches review of long-lasting side effects with quinolone and fluoroquinolone antibiotics.

Headlines: FDA: Chlorhexidine Gluconate May Cause Allergic Reactions
Teaser: An increase in reports of serious allergic reactions to OTC skin antiseptic products containing chlorhexidine gluconate prompts safety alert from FDA and a request that manufacturers update labels.

Headlines: One Way e-Cigarettes May Up CV Risk: Altering HR Variability
Teaser: Questions for the future: Are their cardiac risks as great as those from tobacco cigarettes? Which components of e-cigarette aerosol are driving their adverse physiological effects?

Headlines: Dimethyl Fumarate for MS: Liver Injury Warning Strengthened
Teaser: The prescribing information for the oral medication has been updated to include a warning of potential liver injury that could require hospitalization.

Headlines: Severe Side Effects Higher Than Expected in Breast Cancer
Teaser: Study found that almost half of women treated for early-stage invasive breast cancer experience severe or very severe side effects.

Headlines: Ferric Citrate Improves Iron-Deficiency Anemia in Chronic Kidney Disease
Teaser: Oral treatment with ferric citrate improves iron-deficiency anemia in patients with non-dialysis-dependent chronic kidney disease (NDD-CKD), according to a randomized controlled trial.

Headlines: Blocking Peripheral Cannabinoid Receptors Cuts Gorging -- in Mice
Teaser: CB1-receptor antagonists that don't cross the blood-brain barrier may be     useful to treat metabolic syndrome, without the harmful psychiatric side     effects seen with rimonabant, preclinical work suggests.

Headlines: Europe Clears Tenofovir Alafenamide (Vemlidy) for Chronic HBV
Teaser: The efficacy of once-daily Vemlidy is similar to that of tenofovir disoproxil (Viread) with fewer bone and renal side effects, the company says.

Headlines: Marijuana Use Jumps in Pregnant Women
Teaser: More pregnant women in the US are using marijuana than ever before, prompting experts to warn that such use could lead to adverse outcomes for mothers and infants.

Headlines: Psychiatry News Quiz 2016: Test Your Smarts
Teaser: Re-emergence of research into psychedelics for mental illness, doctors gone bad and MACRA's potential impact on incomes were among the most read stories by psychiatrists this year. Test your news knowledge.

Headlines: VPT for Low-Risk Prostate Cancer: 'Huge Leap Forward'
Teaser: Vascular-targeted photodynamic therapy (VPT) involves a light-sensitive drug activated with a laser to destroy tumor tissue in the prostate.

Headlines: Bendamustine Toxicity in FL Raises Eyebrows -- and Questions
Teaser: Results from the GALLIUM study in follicular lymphoma (FL) showed that fatal toxicity was higher with bendamustine compared with other regimens. What does this mean for clinical practice?

Headlines: FDA Smokes Black Box Warning on Chantix
Teaser: Siding with an advisory committee, the FDA approved dropping the black box warning regarding possible serious neuropsychiatric side effects with Pfizer's smoking cessation drug varenicline.

Headlines: First-Ever RCT: Cold Cap Works for Chemo Hair Loss
Teaser: Hair loss from chemotherapy is often cited as traumatizing by breast cancer patients; a first-ever randomized clinical trial shows that a scalp-cooling device helps.

Headlines: What Your Patients Searched for Most in 2016
Teaser: The Zika virus surprised everybody in 2016 and sent people searching for more information about its symptoms and how to prevent it. Surprising side effects of common medications and high drug prices also earned spots on the list of year's top searches.

Headlines: Immunotherapy Looks 'Promising' in Malignant Mesothelioma
Teaser: Immunotherapy with nivolumab and pembrolizumab could offer hope to patients with malignant mesothelioma: new studies show improved progression-free survival.

Headlines: Muscle Pain Reported Mostly by Those Aware They're on Statins
Teaser: Attribute most reported muscle pain on statins to the power of suggestion, says a new analysis of a decade-old trial. An observer says the truth is in middle: often it's a nocebo effect, often it's real.

Headlines: Long-term Symptoms in Cervical Cancer Survivors
Teaser: Long-term cervical cancer survivors frequently suffer from treatment-related side effects, which can greatly affect their quality of life.

Headlines: Should You 'Fire' a Patient for Refusing Vaccines?
Teaser: More physicians are taking a stronger stance against vaccine-refusing patients. What do you think?

Headlines: Don't Use Tramadol and Codeine in Kids Under 12, FDA Warns
Teaser: The two opioids pose the risk for potentially fatal respiratory depression in young children. The FDA also is restricting their use in older children.

Headlines: Even Short-term Oral Steroids Carry Serious Risk
Teaser: A large, population-based study found a significantly higher rate of acute adverse events such as sepsis, venous thromboembolism, and fracture, even after a low-dose, short-term steroid treatment.

Headlines: Ten Drugs Make New FDA Watch List
Teaser: Some of the adverse events observed for the cited drugs already have been put to regulatory rest.

Headlines: New Insomnia Med a Safer Option for Older Adults?
Teaser: The insomnia drug suvorexant appears to be safe and effective in older adults, without some of the risks and side effects commonly associated with of other pharmaceutical agents, new research suggests.

Headlines: No Consensus for Discontinuing Mainstay Alzheimer's Drugs
Teaser: Guidelines for initiating treatment of Alzheimer's symptoms with cholinesterase inhibitors are well established, but consensus as to when, how, and whether to discontinue treatment is lacking.

Headlines: Tailor Prostate Cancer Tx by Adverse Effects Profile
Teaser: Prostate cancer treatments are all associated with distinct adverse effects profiles, and these can be used to individualize treatment decisions for localized disease.

Headlines: FDA: Avoid IBS Drug Viberzi in Patients With No Gallbladder
Teaser: Patients without a gallbladder have an increased risk for serious pancreatitis when taking eluxadoline.

Headlines: Decade-Long Benefit With Sulfonylureas in Rare Genetic Diabetes
Teaser: Sulfonylureas can be used to treat a rare form of gene-associated diabetes for at least 10 years, with good glycemic control and no serious adverse events, say UK researchers.

Headlines: 'Imatinib Changed Everything': The Future Is Now More Hopeful
Teaser: The development in the 1990s of this oral drug that targets a driver mutation 'fundamentally altered the field of oncology,' says an NEJM editorial.

Headlines: Muscle Composition Metric May Help Predict Chemo Toxicity
Teaser: An experimental metric that measures muscle composition may be able to predict which patients are most likely to experience chemotherapy-related side effects.

Headlines: Neurofeedback Promising in Chemotherapy-Induced Neuropathy
Teaser: Neurofeedback attenuates pain and unpleasantness of chemotherapy-induced peripheral neuropathy compared with usual care, and has virtually no side effects.

Headlines: Ocrelizumab Not Linked to Serious Infection Risk in MS
Teaser: Further OPERA and ORATORIO results show similar or even lower rates of severe infection in patients receiving the study drug vs interferon or placebo, researchers say, as well as better patient-reported outcomes.

Headlines: Another AE Identified With Checkpoint Inhibitors
Teaser: Add connective tissue diseases, such as Sjogren's syndrome, to the list of immune-related adverse events that can develop during cancer treatment with immune checkpoint inhibitors.

Headlines: Statin-Related Factors Predict High LDL-C Post-Coronary Hospitalization
Teaser: The key targets for interventions to improve LDL-C are prescription of and     adherence to sufficiently potent statins and notice of side effects, not     psychosocial or socioeconomic factors, the authors say.

Headlines: EU Panel Likes Novel Targeted Lung Cancer Combo
Teaser: The European panel has recommended for approval a targeted therapy combination for lung cancer with BRAF mutations and a treatment for chemotherapy-induced nausea and vomiting.

Headlines: Fewer Skin Side Effects With Accelerated Partial Breast Irradiation
Teaser: Accelerated partial breast irradiation (APBI) with interstitial brachytherapy may be an alternative to whole-breast irradiation (WBI) for some patients, according to five-year results from the GEC-ESTRO trial.

Headlines: SGLT1/2 Inhibitor Sotagliflozin 'Encouraging' in Type 1 Diabetes
Teaser: The investigational, oral agent sotagliflozin, a first-in-class, oral dual inhibitor of both SGLT1 and SGLT2, is in phase 3 trials in type 1 diabetes; results are promising but there are some caveats.

Headlines: Spasticity Drug Cuts Alcohol Consumption in High-Risk Drinkers
Teaser: Primary care patients with high-risk alcohol consumption have significantly better rates of low-risk drinking or abstinence with baclofen vs placebo, the results of a French study indicate.

Headlines: Value of Opioid Antagonists for Withdrawal Uncertain
Teaser: Combining an opioid antagonist with an adrenergic agonist is feasible for managing opioid withdrawal, but it's unclear whether this approach is better than an adrenergic agent alone.

Headlines: Clindamycin Recalled as Sterility Problems Dog Hospira
Teaser: Earlier this year, the FDA faulted the drug maker for 'inadequate' oversight and control of its manufacturing processes at multiple plants.

Headlines: FDA Approves New Epinephrine Prefilled Syringe
Teaser: Symjepi, from Adamis Pharmaceuticals, is for the emergency treatment of type I allergic reactions, including anaphylaxis.

Headlines: Antibiotic-Associated Adverse Events Common
Teaser: As many as 20% of hospitalized patients prescribed antibiotics experienced an adverse drug event, including Clostridium difficile or multidrug-resistant organism infection, a new study found.

Headlines: Quarter-Dose Combo Meds for HTN Effective, More Tolerated
Teaser: A literature review suggests very low-dose multiple-drug regimens can lower blood pressure similar to standard-dose monotherapy, with fewer side effects.

Headlines: New Drug Safe, Effective for Tardive Dyskinesia
Teaser: Phase 3 trials showed improved movement and quality-of-life scores for deutetrabenazine-treated patients with tardive dyskinesia, leading the FDA to grant priority review and an August 30 target date.

Headlines: New Insight Into Off-Label Ketamine Use for Depression
Teaser: As the off-label use of ketamine for the treatment of severe depression soars, new research provides insight into the way clinicians are using it in the field, away from the research setting.

Headlines: Dacomitinib: Potential New EGFR Inhibitor for First-Line NSCLC
Teaser: The investigational second-generation EGFR inhibitor significantly prolonged PFS, but at a cost of higher toxicity compared to gefitinib.

Headlines: Is APHINITY the End of the Line for Trastuzumab Add-ons?
Teaser: The addition of pertuzumab to standard trastuzumab therapy in patients with early HER2-positive breast cancer led to modest improvements and increased side effects in the APHINITY trial.

Headlines: Underutilization of Clozapine 'Shameful, Embarrassing'
Teaser: Clozapine is underprescribed for schizophrenia because of concerns of adverse events and inadequate training. One expert says this underutilization "is shameful and embarrassing" for psychiatry.

Headlines: No Harm Seen in MRI Gadolinium Retention in Brain, FDA Says
Teaser: Nearly 2 years of study yield no evidence of adverse events, but the FDA continues to recommend that clinicians use gadolinium-based contrast agents sparingly.

Headlines: Dopamine Agonists for Pituitary Tumors: To Treat or Not?
Teaser: A novel use of medical therapy soon after surgery for nonfunctioning pituitary adenomas was up for debate, with strong arguments for and against changing the standard of care.

Headlines: Heart Problems Hit Hopes for Experimental Amgen, UCB Bone Drug
Teaser: Amgen Inc and UCB SA no longer expect their experimental osteoporosis drug to win U.S. approval this year after a higher rate of serious heart-related side effects were observed in a late-stage clinical trial.

Headlines: FDA: Fluoroquinolones Not Linked to Retinal Detachment
Teaser: Available evidence does not support reports that fluoroquinolone antibiotics may result in retinal detachment or aortic aneurysm or dissection, the FDA said.

Headlines: Valbenazine Approval Highlights Lessons for Researchers
Teaser: A New England Journal of Medicine editorial notes that the recent FDA approval of valbenazine for tardive dyskinesia shows how to effectively and quickly develop a much-needed treatment.

Headlines: Safety Events Common in Newly Approved Drugs
Teaser: More than 30% of new drugs approved by the FDA during a 10-year period are affected by a postmarket safety event.

Headlines: Prostate Cancer Patients Satisfied With HDR Brachytherapy
Teaser: A single outpatient treatment with high-dose-rate (HDR) brachytherapy for prostate cancer was associated with low toxicity and high quality of life.

Headlines: Questions Over 'Flu Jab' in Lung Cancer Patients on PD Inhibitors
Teaser: Patients with cancer receiving immune checkpoint inhibitors could be at increased risk for adverse events compared with the general population if they are given a yearly flu jab, say Swiss researchers.

Headlines: 'Inadequate' Reporting of Ketamine Side Effects in Trials
Teaser: Active assessment, surveillance, and reporting of side effects during trials of ketamine for patients with depression are inadequate, new research suggests.

Headlines: FDA Warns About Triamcinolone and Moxifloxacin Combo for Eye
Teaser: The FDA issued a safety alert after serious adverse events were reported in at least 43 patients who received a compounded triamcinolone and moxifloxacin product by intravitreal injection.

Headlines: First-Episode Psychosis Drug Choice: No Clear Winner
Teaser: After first-episode psychosis, haloperidol should not be used, and the choice among second-generation antipsychotics should be guided by their side effect profile, new research suggests.

Headlines: Fear Keeps Many Eczema Patients From Using Steroid Creams
Teaser: Many people with eczema may avoid creams and ointments that can help ease symptoms like itching and inflammation because they’re afraid to try topical corticosteroids, a recent study suggests.

Headlines: CV Events, Death Lower After Statin Rechallenge
Teaser: Getting patients to stay on statins after an adverse reaction is getting harder though in the face of a growing "cult" of online antistatin sentiment, one expert says.

Headlines: Antipsychotics May Boost Outcomes in Refractory Depression
Teaser: Adding an antipsychotic to current antidepressant therapy may lead to better outcomes in treatment-refractory major depressive disorder, new research suggests.

Headlines: CDK Inhibitors in Breast Cancer: Manageable Toxicity Profile
Teaser: CDK inhibitors represent a new treatment option in HR+ breast cancer. A new review article shows that their overall toxicity is low and can be adequately managed.

Headlines: 'Incredibly Exciting': CAR T Cells as 'Living Drugs'
Teaser: Unlike drugs that gradually disappear from the body, CAR T cells are 'living drugs' that persist in the body for years.

Headlines: ADHD Meds Tied to Lower Substance Abuse Risk
Teaser: A new study provides more evidence that stimulants used to treat attention-deficit/hyperactivity disorder (ADHD) are unlikely to increase substance-related problems and may have a protective effect.

Headlines: Are You Concerned About Endocrine Disruptors?
Teaser: Chemicals that disrupt hormones may lead to certain health problems you see in your practice.

Headlines: FDA Advisory Board Gives Thumbs Up to Gemtuzumab for AML
Teaser: After being withdrawn from the market in 2010, gemtuzumab may once again be available as a frontline therapy for acute myeloid leukemia.

Headlines: Reassurance on Generic Lamotrigine Bioequivalence
Teaser: Two disparate generic formulations of lamotrigine were found to be bioequivalent to the branded product, Lamictal, in a new FDA-sponsored study.

Headlines: RCT: Menopause Symptoms Mistaken for Tamoxifen Side Effects
Teaser: Many women who use tamoxifen as a chemopreventive agent experience symptoms that are assumed to be drug related, but they may just be naturally occurring symptoms related to menopause.

Headlines: PPIs Linked With Higher Risk for Death
Teaser: Use and duration of proton-pump inhibitors should be limited to medical indications, researchers say. An expert agrees but says the excess risk is small and the drugs are still often the best option.

Headlines: New FDA Watch List Flags More Drugs
Teaser: The agency spotted possible safety blips on its radar for 14 drugs or drug classes in the first 3 months of 2017.

Headlines: Penicillin Allergy in Children Substantially Overreported
Teaser: Many children with reported penicillin allergy are not actually allergic to the drug, a new study has found.

Headlines: Corneal Edema: Is Your Patient Receiving Amantadine?
Teaser: Amantadine-induced corneal edema, which can mimic a number of other ocular conditions, is best treated simply by discontinuation of the drug.

Headlines: CAR T Cells Encouraging for Diffuse Large B-Cell Lymphoma
Teaser: Results from phase 2 studies of two anti-CD19 therapies for relapsed/refractory DLBCL show impressive responses, as well as adverse events that were 'reversible.'

Headlines: Reports of Adverse Reactions With Cosmetics Increasing
Teaser: Inflammatory arthritis is an underappreciated adverse event of immune checkpoint blockade that requires special management considerations.

Headlines: Do Cold Meds Carry a Psychosis Risk?
Teaser: Can common cold medication really make someone commit a violent and deadly crime?

Headlines: 'Vote of Confidence for Sulfonylureas and Pioglitazone' in TOSCA IT
Teaser: "My bottom line is this is a vote of confidence for sulfonylureas and pioglitazone," said one expert. "You could use these data to perhaps finesse which patients you might give them to."

Headlines: Clear Benefit With Adjuvant Nivolumab in Resected Melanoma
Teaser: Adjuvant nivolumab significant improves relapse-free survival and reduces toxicity in comparison with ipilimumab in stage III/IV resected melanoma for patients at risk for relapse, trial results reveal.

Headlines: Neurologic AEs on Rise as Checkpoint Inhibitors Evolve
Teaser: Potentially lethal immune-related adverse events (AEs) are expected to increase as anti-PD-1 therapies for solid tumors expand to include other cancers.

Headlines: PharMEDium Recalls Oxytocin Products Because of Subpotency
Teaser: The recall covers all unexpired lots of oxytocin compounded with lactated Ringer's or lactated Ringer's and dextrose products produced between July 6, 2017, and August 29, 2017.

Headlines: ADA Updates Recommendations for Managing Hypertension in Diabetes
Teaser: The recommendations include a treatment algorithm detailing specific lifestyle and pharmacologic approaches based on initial BP, renal sufficiency, response to therapy, and adverse effects.

Headlines: FDA OKs Deutetrabenazine (Austedo) for Tardive Dyskinesia
Teaser: The drug was also approved for chorea associated with Huntington's disease earlier in this year.

Headlines: First CAR T-Cell 'Living Drug' Approved by FDA
Teaser: The first chimeric antigen receptor (CAR) T-cell therapy has been approved by the FDA for use in relapsed/refractory leukemia, for which it offers a 'paradigm shift.'

Headlines: Final Word? Antidepressants 'Do Work'
Teaser: Investigators are hoping a new 'mega-analysis' puts a final cap on the ongoing controversy over whether antidepressants, particularly selective serotonin reuptake inhibitors, are effective for depression.

Headlines: Anacetrapib REVEALs 'Modest' Effect on Cardiovascular Outcomes
Teaser: Despite becoming the first CETP inhibitor to reduce outcomes in a major trial, whether the 9% reduction in events shown in REVEAL is enough for the drug to reach the market is being debated.

Headlines: AKI Risk With SGLT2 Inibitors? Maybe Not, Clinic Data Show
Teaser: Despite FDA warnings of a possible increased risk for AKI with the SGLT2 inhibitors, a new analysis of two large databases finds no evidence of elevated risk.

Headlines: Do TV Drug Ads Say Too Much About Risks? FDA Wants to Know
Teaser: Recent research suggests that limiting the list of adverse events in DTC ads to the most important ones would help consumers better remember them.

Headlines: Do Your Patients Believe in Medical Conspiracy Theories?
Teaser: More than half of Americans say that big business and government is, in some way, conspiring against the health of the people.

Headlines: Celecoxib May Be Safest Choice for Older, Chronic NSAID Users
Teaser: The risk of major non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID) toxicity in older adults who take the drugs regularly is higher with naproxen and ibuprofen than with celecoxib, according to a new secondary analysis of PRECISION trial data.

Headlines: Inadvertent HPV Vaccination During Pregnancy Seems Safe
Teaser: Inadvertent human papillomavirus (HPV) vaccination in the periconceptional period or during pregnancy appears to have no adverse effects on women or their offspring, according to data from the Vaccine Safety Datalink.

Headlines: FDA Warns Against Use of Any Liquid Product From PharmaTech
Teaser: Lab tests have found Burkholderia cepacia contamination in PharmaTech's oral liquid docusate products, which has been linked to recent patient infections.

Headlines: Class Action Lawsuit Against HPV Vaccine Filed in Colombia
Teaser: An association representing 700 individuals who allege damage after receiving the human papillomavirus vaccine Gardasil has been launched in Colombia; a class action suit is ongoing in Japan.

Headlines: Fear of Interactions May Affect Adherence in HIV+ Trans Women
Teaser: A study found that fear of interactions between hormone therapy and antiretroviral therapy may hinder medication adherence in transgender women with HIV; more research is needed on tailoring care to this group.

Headlines: New Agent Promising for Negative Schizophrenia Symptoms
Teaser: In a phase 2b trial, treatment with the investigational agent MIN-101 led to an improvement in negative symptoms of schizophrenia.

Headlines: Do You Deprescribe?
Teaser: Some physicians hesitate to take patients off medications for fear that the harms will outweigh the benefits.

Headlines: AE Risks With Combined Tx for Advanced Breast CA
Teaser: Individual targeted agents carry different degrees of risk for severe toxicities, but early management may prevent or reduce negative effect on quality of life.

Headlines: PRAC Further Restricts Daclizumab (Zinbryta) in MS
Teaser: Because of risk for serious liver damage, daclizumab can be used only in specific patient groups, with 'strict liver monitoring,' the EMA committee has advised.

Headlines: So Much Care It Hurts
Teaser: A growing number of patients and doctors are concerned about overtreatment, which is rampant across the health care system.

Headlines: Cascade of Costs Could Push New Gene Therapy Above $1 Million
Teaser: The costs of using a new class of cancer treatments include far more than the drug’s sticker price.

Headlines: Trump's Pick for Drug Czar Pulls Out After Investigation
Teaser: The decision follows a report by the Washington Post and 60 Minutes that showed Rep. Tom Marino spearheaded legislation that made it harder for the government to police the pharmaceutical industry.

Headlines: Opioids Top List of Malpractice Claims Linked to Medications
Teaser: One problem is that some physicians cave into the requests of persuasive, pill-seeking patients against their better judgement, the medical liability insurer Coverys says in a new study.

Headlines: Immunotherapy Side Effects: New Global Guidelines for Nurses
Teaser: Immunotherapy has revolutionized cancer therapy, but these drugs have unique and sometimes life-threatening adverse events, as outlined in the new guidelines.

Headlines: Side Effects Skyrocket in France With Levothyroxine Reformulation
Teaser: Merck is being pressured to make the previous formulation available, despite concerns and limited supplies.

Headlines: Cancer Drugs Dominate New FDA Watch List
Teaser: Making the list does not mean that the FDA has determined the drug causes the reported adverse event.

Headlines: Prescribing Pitfalls in Heart Failure With Comorbidities
Teaser: Heart-failure patients often have chronic pain, diabetes, depression, or other med-intensive issues and may not even disclose what OTC drugs they're taking. Experts discuss prescribing cautions in these complex patients.

Headlines: Right-to-Try Gains Steam as FDA Eases Compassionate Use
Teaser: A House subcommittee considered two bills that would do an end run around an FDA program that makes experimental drugs available to the seriously ill.

Headlines: FDA: Blindness Risk From Compounded Vancomycin Eye Injections
Teaser: The FDA is warning against intraocular injections of vancomycin either alone or in combination with other drugs, in light of a new case of hemorrhagic occlusive retinal vasculitis.

Headlines: Treatment That's Easy to Swallow in HPV+ Throat Cancer
Teaser: The radiation therapy dose for throat cancer was cut 50%, but the 2-year outcomes are still excellent, including no injury to patient swallowing.

Headlines: Cardiac Effects of Fingolimod in MS Reversible
Teaser: Fingolimod, used to treat multiple sclerosis, dampens cardiac autonomic modulation at rest and during challenges, but this effect appears to be reversible after discontinuation of the drug, a study shows.

Headlines: Antidepressants Tied to a Significantly Increased Risk for Death
Teaser: A new meta-analysis shows a 33% increased risk for death with antidepressant use in the general population.

Headlines: Montelukast Tied to Psychiatric Adverse Events in Kids, Adults
Teaser: A review of voluntary adverse event reports found that asthma medication montelukast was linked to increased reports of depression and nightmares in adults and children, and aggression in children.

Headlines: New Guidelines for Managing CAR T-Cell Acute Toxicities
Teaser: Researchers at MD Anderson have developed a framework to help recognize and manage unique acute toxicities associated with CAR T-cell therapy.

Headlines: Do Tattoos Raise the Risk for Cancer?
Teaser: Components of the ink in tattoos migrate from the skin to the lymph nodes, leading to chronic enlargement, but the health risk has yet to be determined.

Headlines: Potentially Inappropriate Meds Common in Home Health Patients
Teaser: A high prevalence of potentially inappropriate medication use among Medicare home health nursing patients puts this population at significantly increased risk for hospitalization, a study found.

Headlines: Experts Still Confounded by How to Prevent, Manage Hypoglycemia
Teaser: Clinicians, advocates, and federal officials said the pressing public-health problem of hypoglycemia should be considered an outcome, not a side effect, and noted it can occur outside of diabetes.

Headlines: Antibiotics, Antidepressants Dominate New FDA Watch List
Teaser: Presence on list does not mean a drug has been linked to a risk, only that new safety information is available or potential risk has been identified and further review will be or has been completed.

Headlines: Heated Intraperitoneal Chemo for Ovarian Cancer Ups Survival
Teaser: A single administration of hyperthermic intraperitoneal chemotherapy at the end of cytoreductive surgery improves overall survival in women with advanced ovarian cancer.

Headlines: Pneumothorax Events Linked to Placement of Enteral Feeding Tube
Teaser: The FDA has received 79 reports (including 17 deaths) of pneumothorax events associated with feeding tube placement involving two approved enteral access systems.

Headlines: Transcranial DC Stimulation Promising in Bipolar Depression
Teaser: Transcranial direct current stimulation, added to existing therapy, was safe and effective in a small sham-controlled study of patients with bipolar depression.

Headlines: Inadequate Informed Consent Often Tied to Lawsuits Over Injectable Cosmetic Fillers
Teaser: Lawsuits related to complications from injectable cosmetic fillers are rare and most stem from inadequate informed consent, according to a cross-sectional analysis of adverse events and litigation.

Headlines: Three in 10 Doses of Metformin Not Taken by Patients With T2D
Teaser: Patients with type 2 diabetes (T2D) are less likely to take the most commonly prescribed diabetes drug, metformin, than other, newer medications, say UK researchers, who suggest adverse events may be to blame.

Headlines: EMA Updates Contraception Advice Around Mycophenolate
Teaser: When a male patient has taken mycophenolate, either he or his female partner should use reliable contraception; it is no longer required that they both use contraception, the EMA now advises.

Headlines: Older Americans Taking Too Many Unneeded Drugs
Teaser: Researchers estimate that 25 percent of people ages 65 to 69 take at least five prescription drugs to treat chronic conditions. But some doctors are trying to teach others about “deprescribing” or systematically discontinuing medicines that are inappropriate, duplicative or unnecessary.

Headlines: SGLT2 Inhibitors as First-line Therapy for Diabetes With CVD?
Teaser: An expert argues case for SGLT2 inhibitors as first-line therapy for patients with type 2 diabetes and CVD, but is he fighting a losing battle? As even he concedes cost is currently a major barrier.

Headlines: First Data on Older Breast Cancer Pts on CDK4/6 Inhibitors
Teaser: Giving CDK4/6 inhibitors to breast cancer patients aged ≥70 years yields a similar progression-free survival to that seen in younger women, although the toxicity is more severe, say FDA researchers.

Headlines: Long-term Use of Daclizumab Safe, With Caveats
Teaser: Although the open-label extension study of 1500 patients with MS showed relatively positive safety results for daclizumab, investigators urge caution for those with elevated liver enzymes.

Headlines: Do TV Drug Ads Say Too Much About Risks?
Teaser: The FDA thinks that less may be more when it comes to drug ads on TV and radio.

Headlines: EU Regulators to Review Fibroid Drug for Possible Liver Risk
Teaser: Reports of liver damage and transplants have surfaced regarding ulipristal acetate (Esmya), now before the FDA for approval to treat uterine fibroids.

Headlines: Flavocoxid for OA Tied to Life-Threatening Health Problems
Teaser: The FDA says several adverse events, including drug-induced liver injury and hypersensitivity pneumonitis, have been linked to flavocoxid, a medical food product marketed for osteoarthritis (OA).

Headlines: Hormonal Contraceptives Tied to Suicide
Teaser: The researchers call for greater awareness of the possibility that hormonal contraceptives can affect mood, particularly in adolescent girls.

Headlines: Baxter Recalls Amiodarone (Nexterone) Due to Particulate Matter
Teaser: The company identified particulate matter consistent with polyethylene, the primary constituent of the film and ports used to manufacture the bag in which Nexterone is packaged in one lot of the product.

Headlines: Gout Drug Febuxostat (Uloric) Subject of FDA Safety Alert
Teaser: Preliminary data from a safety study show an increased risk for heart-related deaths with febuxostat compared with allopurinol in patients with gout, the FDA said.

Headlines: Threefold Increased Stroke Risk Tied to Certain Antipsychotics
Teaser: Second-generation antipsychotics increase risk for cardiovascular events, especially in the elderly. But are there differences in risk between these agents?

Headlines: JAK-1 Inhibitor Effective for RA, but Safety Signal Troubles
Teaser: The oral JAK-1 inhibitor upadacitinib is showing a strong response in active rheumatoid arthritis that has responded inadequately to biologics; however, concern lingers about venous thrombotic events.

Headlines: 'Unrelenting': 20-Year Recurrence Risks in Breast Cancer
Teaser: Clinicians have new long-term data to use in discussions with patients with estrogen receptor-positive breast cancer who have been treated with 5 years of endocrine therapy.

Headlines: Breast Cancer Chemo Responders May Avoid Lymph Node Surgery
Teaser: Women with aggressive forms of breast cancer may be able to avoid lymph node surgery and its adverse effects if they respond well to chemotherapy, the results of two studies suggest.

Headlines: Participants in Rogue Herpes Vaccine Research Take Legal Action
Teaser: Three participants in unauthorized herpes vaccine research file a lawsuit against scientist’s company, alleging adverse side effects.

Headlines: Aggressive Approach to High-Grade Prostate Cancer May Be Best
Teaser: High-dose radiotherapy plus androgen-deprivation treatment (ADT) delivered superior outcomes compared with standard external-beam radiation and ADT or radical prostatectomy alone.

Headlines: EU Says Yes to Mylotarg for AML, No to Adjuvant Sunitinib
Teaser: Gemtuzumab ozogamicin (Mylotarg) has been recommended for approval in Europe for use in acute myeloid leukemia, but adjuvant sunitinib after kidney cancer surgery was turned down.

Headlines: Europe Says No to Neratinib for Breast Cancer
Teaser: The European committee recommended against approval of neratinib (Nerlynx) for breast cancer, even though the drug has been approved in the United States.

Headlines: FDA Alert: Clarithromycin Risky in Patients With Heart Disease
Teaser: The agency adds a new warning about the increased risk for death in patients with heart disease prescribed the antibiotic clarithromycin and recommends considering an alternative when possible.

Headlines: Benzodiazepine Harms Overlooked, Especially in Older Adults
Teaser: International survey shows modest reductions among people aged 65 years or older, but rates of use in this population are still too high, authors say.

Headlines: SGLT2 Inhibitor-Linked Diabetic Ketoacidosis Is Rare, but Severe
Teaser: A series of Australian cases of DKA linked to SGLT2 inhibitors confirms the side effect is rare but severe. Most cases had identifiable precipitators.

Headlines: Exercise Benefits Cancer Patients Even 4 Years Later
Teaser: A long-term follow-up showed that an exercise program conducted during active treatment continues to confer benefits even 4 years later.

Headlines: ID Docs Best Poised to Lead Antimicrobial Stewardship Programs
Teaser: The eclectic expertise of infectious disease specialists uniquely qualifies them to lead antimicrobial stewardship programs, according to a joint statement from several medical societies.

Headlines: New Guidelines for Treating Checkpoint Inhibitor Toxicities
Teaser: ASCO and the NCCN have issued joint guidelines for treating toxicities associated with checkpoint inhibitor treatment.

Headlines: People on Liver Transplant Waitlist May Be No Worse Off if They Have Used Marijuana
Teaser: Candidates on the liver transplant (LT) waitlist who have used marijuana have no worse outcomes than their counterparts on the list who have not used it, a single-center study suggests.

Headlines: PRAC Seeks New Pregnancy Prevention Measures For Retinoids
Teaser: The EMA committee calls for updating pregnancy prevention measures and including a warning with retinoid products on the possible risk for neuropsychiatric disorders.

Headlines: PRAC Recommends Regular Liver Testing for Women Taking Esmya
Teaser: The European Medicines Agency's Pharmacovigilance Risk Assessment Committee recommended liver monitoring at least monthly for women taking ulipristal acetate (Esmya, Gedeon Richter) for uterine fibroids.

Headlines: PRAC Wants Flupirtine Off the Market in Europe
Teaser: Despite restrictions put in place in 2013, serious liver problems related to flupirtine-containing medicines continue to be reported.

Headlines: Is Ozanimod a Safer S1P Receptor Modulator?
Teaser: New safety data from the SUNBEAM and RADIANCE trials.

Headlines: Deep Brain Stimulation May Slow Alzheimer's
Teaser: Research into DBS for Alzheimer's has focused on brain regions involved in memory. A new study shows using it in frontal behavioral and cognitive neural networks may slow decline in executive function.

Headlines: FDA Acts to Stem Misuse, Abuse of Antidiarrheal Loperamide
Teaser: The FDA moves to limit the number of loperamide doses per package amid ongoing reports of serious cardiac problems and deaths with misuse and abuse of the antidiarrhea medication.

Headlines: Cancer Immunotherapy May Be Safe for Rheumatology Patients
Teaser: A minority of those who received immune checkpoint inhibitors and had underlying rheumatologic disease experienced flare-ups or adverse effects, a small study found.

Headlines: Genotyping May Boost Antidepressant Treatment Success
Teaser: Impairments in the gene that encodes the enzyme responsible for metabolizing the antidepressant escitalopram may be responsible for treatment failure.

Headlines: Stop Using OTC Benzocaine Teething Products, FDA Says
Teaser: The agency will also increase warnings on all benzocaine-containing over-the-counter and prescription topical anesthetics because of the rare but serious risk for methemoglobinemia.

Headlines: Canakinumab Efficacy Confirmed In Recurrent Fever Disorders
Teaser: Canakinumab controlled flares in colchicine-resistant familial Mediterranean fever, mevalonate kinase deficiency, and tumor necrosis factor receptor-associated periodic syndrome.

Headlines: New Data: Finasteride Safely Prevents Prostate Cancer
Teaser: The thumbnail take on finasteride has been that it prevents prostate cancer but increases the risk for high-grade disease. A new study debunks the latter idea.

Headlines: Inappropriate, Omitted Rx Common at Discharge for Older Adults
Teaser: Four in five older hospitalized adults received at least one potentially inappropriate prescription at discharge, putting them at increased risk for rehospitalization and death, a study found.

Headlines: On Demand as Effective as Maintenance Therapy for Mild Asthma
Teaser: For patients with mild asthma, as-needed therapy may be just as effective and cause fewer adverse effects than daily steroid therapy.

Headlines: Deprescribing Benzodiazepines: New Primary Care Guidelines Issued
Teaser: According to new evidence-based guidelines from Canada, doctors should deprescribe benzodiazepines in all adults aged 65 and older, and in those aged 18 to 64 who have used them for more than 4 weeks.

Headlines: Hypothyroidism After TKIs for Cancer Linked to Longer Survival
Teaser: Overt hypothyroidism after tyrosine kinase inhibitor (TKI) treatment for cancer is associated with a significant survival benefit, and the adverse effect may have prognostic value, say researchers.

Headlines: Neurologic Effects of Cancer Drugs May Be Severe, Fatal
Teaser: Checkpoint inhibitors have changed treatment of metastatic melanoma and other cancers. However, some immune-related neurologic adverse events that can be serious or fatal are emerging.

Headlines: EMA Panel Recommends Once-Daily HIV-1 Treatment Biktarvy
Teaser: EMA panel recommends marketing authorization for a once-daily HIV-1 combo containing bictegravir, emtricitabine, and tenofovir.

Headlines: Drug Test Spurs Frank Talk Between Hypertension Patients and Doctors
Teaser: Roughly half of patients don’t take their high blood pressure medicine as they should, even though heart disease is the leading cause of death in America. Now, a drug test can flag whether a patient is taking the prescribed medication and is meant to spark a more truthful conversation between patient and doctor.

Headlines: Delabeling for Penicillin Allergy Found Safe in Children
Teaser: Children with low-risk penicillin allergy symptoms who tested negative for penicillin allergy tolerated penicillin without serious adverse or allergic reactions during the following year, a study found.

Headlines: Antipsychotics May Alter Thyroid Function
Teaser: Patients with severe mental disorders are more likely to be in either a hypothyroid or a hyperthyroid state than others, say Norwegian scientists, who found that antipsychotic use may affect thyroid function.

Headlines: Allopurinol: Extra Caution Urged in High-Risk Groups
Teaser: The risk for severe cutaneous adverse reactions to allopurinol was much higher among those who were black, Asian, Native Hawaiian/Pacific Islander, women, older, or receiving higher starting doses.

Headlines: New Serious Adverse Effects With Alemtuzumab in MS
Teaser: Several new and potentially life-threatening adverse events associated with the use of this novel agent for multiple sclerosis have been reported.

Headlines: First Trial of Three Aromatase Inhibitors
Teaser: Clinicians should use factors such as patient preference, tolerability, and cost to determine best adjuvant therapy for postmenopausal patients with early breast cancer.

Headlines: New Gene Test Reduces Skin Reactions to Carbamazepine
Teaser: A new gene variant test to guide treatment decisions led to reductions in the incidence of cutaneous adverse reactions to carbamazepine, a new study shows.

Headlines: Sepsis Alerts, Better Sleep, Handoffs Top Hospital Meeting
Teaser: Hospitalists will hear about the impact of the specialty and new challenges emerging at the Society of Hospital Medicine 2018 Meeting.

Headlines: 'Big Deal': NCCN Guide for Immunotherapy Adverse Events
Teaser: Some of the side effects of immunotherapies for cancer become very serious, very fast. The National Comprehensive Cancer Network (NCCN) now has an easy-to-use guideline for that.

Headlines: Dermal Fillers: The Risks to Eliminating Wrinkles
Teaser: In 2016, more than 2.4 million filler procedures were done with one type alone, hyaluronic acid (Juvederm, Restylane), in the U.S. That’s a 56% increase over the last decade.

Headlines: EU Panel Backs Dolutegravir/Rilpivirine Combo Pill for HIV
Teaser: The once-daily pill can maintain viral suppression in patients on a stable antiretroviral regimen with no known or suspected resistance to a non-nucleoside reverse transcriptase inhibitor or integrase inhibitor.

Headlines: Canada Recommends Screening Pregnant Women for Asymptomatic Bacteriuria, With Caveats
Teaser: An updated guideline from the Canadian Task Force on Preventive Health Care recommends first-trimester screening of pregnant women for asymptomatic bacteriuria, affirming routine practice but acknowledging that the evidence is "weak" and the benefit "small but uncertain."

Headlines: FDA Orders Additional, Stronger Fluoroquinolone Warnings
Teaser: Labels now must consistently reflect the antibiotics’ potential risks for mental health side effects and serious blood sugar events. The label change follows a series of warning additions over 10 years.

Headlines: Romosozumab Improves Bone Mineral Density in Men With Osteoporosis
Teaser: Romosozumab improves bone mineral density (BMD) in men with osteoporosis, but safety concerns are holding up its approval in the U.S.

Headlines: AbbVie Wins Reversal of $140 Mln Verdict in Case Over AndroGel Risks
Teaser: A U.S. judge on Thursday overturned a $140.1 million verdict against AbbVie Inc in a lawsuit by a man who claimed the company misrepresented the risks of its testosterone replacement drug AndroGel, causing him to suffer a heart attack.

Headlines: Inhaled Heroin Tied to 'Peculiar, Often Catastrophic' Brain Damage
Teaser: Heating heroin and inhaling its fumes is growing in popularity and may lead to peculiar and often catastrophic brain complications.

Headlines: Diabetes Can Follow Immune Checkpoint Inhibitor Treatment
Teaser: Life-threatening, immune-mediated type 1 diabetes can develop within weeks of commencing immune checkpoint inhibitor treatment, researchers from Australia report.

Headlines: Live and Inactivated Flu Vaccines Have Similar Efficacy in Children
Teaser: Live attenuated influenza vaccine (LAIV) and inactivated influenza vaccine (IIV) have similar efficacy in children, according to results from a Canadian Immunization Research Network (CIRN) study.

Headlines: FDA Repays Industry by Rushing Risky Drugs to Market
Teaser: As pharma companies underwrite three-fourths of the FDA’s budget for scientific reviews, the agency is increasingly fast-tracking expensive drugs with significant side effects and unproven health benefits.

Headlines: EMA Panel Backs Combo Drug for Hyperuricemia in Gout Patients
Teaser: Duzallo contains two medicines in one pill to address both the underelimination and overproduction of uric acid. The FDA approved the drug in August 2017.

Headlines: Penicillin Allergy Linked to MRSA, C difficile Infections
Teaser: Patients with documented penicillin allergy have a greater risk of developing new methicillin-resistant Staphylococcus aureus and Clostridium difficile infections, a study has found.

Headlines: Public Citizen Calls on FDA to Pull Gout Drug Due to CV Risk
Teaser: The nonprofit advocacy group says there is 'overwhelming evidence that the serious cardiovascular harms of febuxostat outweigh any purported clinical benefit,' citing CARES postmarket data.

Headlines: 50% of Patients With PD on DAs Develop Impulse Disorders
Teaser: Almost half of patients with Parkinson's disease who take dopamine agonists develop impulse control disorders at 5 years, a large longitudinal study shows.

Headlines: Rx With Depression as Potential Adverse Effect Widely Used
Teaser: New data suggest prescribing doctors should warn patients of this potential adverse effect and possibly assess users for mood disturbances.

Headlines: Low-Dose Antipsychotic Effective in Late-Onset Psychosis
Teaser: Treatment of late-onset schizophrenia-like psychosis has been insufficiently researched. This study suggests a role for antipsychotics in reducing psychosis symptoms in this condition.

Headlines: Aspirin Plus PPI Prevents Esophageal Cancer
Teaser: Barrett's esophagus doesn't commonly progress to cancer, but there is a risk; chemoprevention with aspirin plus proton pump inhibitor (PPI) works, but also carries a risk.

Headlines: Taytulla Birth Control Pills Recalled Due to Packaging Error
Teaser: Allergan has recalled a single lot of Taytulla oral contraceptive sample packs provided to US doctors because of a packaging error that placed placebo capsules out of order.

Headlines: Oxytocin Not Best for Postpartum Hemorrhage Prevention
Teaser: Future researchers should place more emphasis on concerns expressed by patients and families, the authors say.

Headlines: No Reliable Predictors for Ipilimumab-Induced Hypophysitis
Teaser: Study results highlight the need for endocrine monitoring of all patients receiving checkpoint inhibitor immunotherapy.

Headlines: Vitamin Cocktail for Sepsis Getting Wider Test
Teaser: A simple vitamin cocktail to treat sepsis has shaken up the medical world, raising hopes of a more effective treatment for one of history's great killers. But will it stand up to tougher tests?

Headlines: Severe Bleeding Tied to Synthetic Cannabinoids, CDC Warns
Teaser: More than 200 people in nine states have developed serious, unexplained bleeding linked to synthetic cannabinoids thought to be laced with rat poison.

Headlines: Fertility Often Preserved in Female Childhood-Cancer Survivors
Teaser: Most female childhood-cancer survivors (CCSs) show normal hormonal and ultrasound markers of ovarian reserve, according to Dutch researchers.

Headlines: Unsafe Ocular Stem Cell Treatments Prevalent
Teaser: Experimental stem cell therapies for eye conditions have resulted in serious adverse events, including blinding complications, and should be avoided, investigators caution.

Headlines: FDA Panel Votes Against Recommending Mepolizumab for COPD
Teaser: An FDA panel recommended against mepolizumab as add-on treatment to inhaled corticosteroid-based maintenance treatment in patients with COPD guided by blood eosinophil counts.

Headlines: Congo Declares Ebola Flare-Up Over After Rapid Response
Teaser: Democratic Republic of Congo on Tuesday declared an end to an Ebola outbreak believed to have killed 33 people after what experts hailed as a swift response to the flare-up in one of the world's most difficult environments.

Headlines: Chinese Vaccine Firm Hit With Probes as Beijing Seeks to Tamp Down Outrage
Teaser: Changsheng Bio-technology Co Ltd, the Chinese vaccine maker accused of falsifying data, plunged deeper into crisis on Tuesday with police detaining its chairwoman and the country's top graft watchdog launching investigations into the firm.

Headlines: Trial Halted After 11 Infants Die in the Netherlands
Teaser: Researchers were testing whether sildenafil could improve growth among fetuses with fetal growth restriction by increasing blood flow to the placenta; all related trials have been halted.

Headlines: Women Tackle Tough Choice After Dolutegravir Birth Defects
Teaser: The antiretroviral taken at the time of conception has been linked to neural tube defects in babies, but a blanket ban of the drug for all women of childbearing age strikes some as discriminatory.

Headlines: Spikes in Aflibercept Inflammations Worry Specialists
Teaser: A recent increase in inflammations associated with aflibercept injections is puzzling investigators, who report that some patients lost at least two lines of vision.

Headlines: Do You Recommend Probiotics and Prebiotics to Your Patients?
Teaser: Although many Americans use products that contain live microorganisms, there are few safety data about them.

Headlines: Synthetic Cannabinoid Cuts Agitation in Alzheimer's Disease
Teaser: Nabilone taken daily significantly reduced agitation and improved overall behavior in patients with moderate to severe Alzheimer's disease.

Headlines: Prince Harry, Elton John Launch Global Coalition to Halt HIV
Teaser: The Duke of Sussex and Sir Elton John shared the stage Tuesday in Amsterdam to launch a billion dollar global partnership designed to expand the diagnosis and treatment of HIV infection.

Headlines: Bayer to Halt US Sales of Essure Permanent Contraceptive
Teaser: Bayer will voluntarily halt sales of its controversial Essure permanent birth control implant in the United States at the end of this year, citing business reasons.

Headlines: Mersana's Cancer Drug Trial Put on Hold by FDA; Shares Halted
Teaser: Mersana Therapeutics said on Thursday an early stage trial testing its lead cancer drug has been put on partial hold by the U.S. Food and Drug Administration after a patient's death was possibly linked to the treatment.

Headlines: L-Glutamine Benefit Patients With Sickle Cell Disease
Teaser: For people with sickle cell disease, oral twice-daily L-glutamine reduces hospitalization and trims the number of sickle cell crises compared with placebo, whether or not they are also receiving hydroxyurea, according to details of the key test that resulted in U.S. approval of the treatment just over a year ago.

Headlines: Adalimumab May Help Maintain Remission in Non-Radiographic Axial Spondyloarthritis
Teaser: In patients with active non-radiographic axial spondyloarthritis (nr-axSpA) who achieved remission while taking adalimumab, researchers saw fewer flares among those who continued taking the drug than among those who stopped taking it.

Headlines: Delayed Adverse Skin Effects After PD-1-Inhibitor Therapy
Teaser: Eczema, psoriasis, and lupuslike reactions can occur even months after starting or stopping these drugs, so patients need to be monitored on an ongoing basis.

Headlines: Benefits, Risks of Dolutegravir Center Stage at AIDS 2018
Teaser: Potentially game-changing data on HIV treatment will be presented at the International AIDS Conference, but policies that make treatment and prevention difficult will also be discussed.

Headlines: Fixed-Dose Bictegravir-Emtricitabine-Tenofovir Maintains Virologic Suppression in HIV
Teaser: Fixed-dose bictegravir-emtricitabine-tenofovir (Biktarvy) maintains virologic suppression in adults with HIV-1 who are switched from dolutegravir-abacavir-lamivudine or from boosted protease inhibitor-based regimens, according to results from two noninferiority trials.

Headlines: Cutaneous Basaloid Squamous Cell CA Regressed After HPV Vaccine Treatments
Teaser: Combined systemic and intratumoral human papillomavirus (HPV) vaccine administration resulted in complete regression of multiple cutaneous basaloid squamous cell carcinomas, according to a case report.

Headlines: Rheumatologists Cautioned to Avoid Overtreatment
Teaser: Six common approaches to treating inflammatory rheumatic diseases might lead to overdiagnosis and overtreatment, an expert warns. Another expert says overdiagnosis is less common, however.

Headlines: First CAR T Cells Approved in Europe
Teaser: The European Commission has approved the first CAR T-cell product, tisagenlecleucel, for the treatment of certain leukemias and lymphomas.

Headlines: AAP: Counsel Pregnant, Lactating Women Against Marijuana Use
Teaser: In a clinical report, the AAP says an emerging body of evidence supports warning new and prospective moms about the risks marijuana use poses to pregnancy and neonatal outcomes.

Headlines: Novel Agent Dramatically Cuts Oral Mucositis After Radiation
Teaser: A first-in-class synthetic superoxide dismutase dramatically reduced the duration of oral mucositis in patients with head and neck cancer  receiving radiation therapy.

Headlines: Toxin At Heart Of Drug Recall Shows Holes in Medical Safety Net
Teaser: A toxin inadvertently produced in the manufacture of the widely prescribed medicine valsartan but not spotted for years raises questions about regulators' ability to detect risks in a sprawling global drug supply chain increasingly reliant on factories in China.

Headlines: Antibiotic-Related AEs Tied to 70,000 ED Visits by Kids
Teaser: Children 2 years and younger accounted for approximately 40% of the visits, and amoxicillin was the most commonly implicated antibiotic among children aged 9 years and younger.

Headlines: Dual Immunotherapy a Winner for Melanoma Brain Mets
Teaser: A combination of two checkpoint inhibitors (nivolumab and ipilimumab) achieved 'clinically meaningful' efficacy in patients with asymptomatic, untreated melanoma metastases to the brain.

Headlines: Risankizumab Effective in Moderate-to-Severe Plaque Psoriasis
Teaser: Risankizumab, a monoclonal antibody that binds to the p19 subunit of interleukin-23, is effective for treating moderate-to-severe plaque psoriasis, according to results from two phase 3 trials.

Headlines: The Best Therapy for Cryptococcal Meningitis, According to Cochrane
Teaser: Interim results of a large phase III trial showed that patients treated with a cetuximab regimen has worse survival than those treated with cisplatin plus radiation therapy.

Headlines: No Change in Standard of Care for HPV+ Oropharyngeal Cancer
Teaser: Peer comparison letters sent to high-volume quetiapine prescribers led to a significant reduction in the number of prescriptions written for elderly patients.

Headlines: Peer Pressure Tactic Successfully Curbs Overprescribing
Teaser: The European Medicines Agency (EMA) said on Friday that a second Chinese contract manufacturer, Zhejiang Tianyu, had produced a common blood pressure and heart drug with an impurity that could cause cancer.

Headlines: EU Says Second China Company Made Tainted Heart Drug
Teaser: Prenatal tetanus, diphtheria, and acellular pertussis vaccination did not increase the risk of having a child with autism, according to a study.

Headlines: Prenatal Tdap Vaccine Not Linked to Autism, Study Finds
Teaser: A wave of medical research is providing fresh evidence that marijuana may help dogs and cats cope with arthritis, epilepsy, anxiety and other maladies without the side effects of traditional drugs, but veterinarians are afraid to prescribe it for fear of running afoul of federal laws.

Headlines: Pot for Pets: U.S. Federal Law Puts Vets Into a Quandary
Teaser: Certain oral contraceptives may increase the risk of drug-induced Torsade de Pointes in women with preexisting risk factors, a new study suggests.

Headlines: Antiandrogenic Birth Control Pills Tied to Higher Risk of Drug-Induced Long QT Syndrome
Teaser: The FDA has granted approval for mogamulizumab-kpkc for adult patients with relapsed or refractory mycosis fungoides or Sézary syndrome.

Headlines: FDA Approves New Drug for Cutaneous T-Cell Lymphomas
Teaser: Small increased risk of blistering skin disease seen with some DPP-4 inhibitors, such as vildagliptin and linagliptin, but not others, such as sitagliptin.

Headlines: Type 2 Diabetes Drugs Linked to Bullous Pemphigoid
Teaser: Pushing LDL cholesterol below current targets further reduces risk for major cardiovascular events without serious adverse effects, a new meta-analysis finds.

Headlines: Additional Benefit From Lowering Already Low LDL
Teaser: In a large population-based study in an Australian population, statin exposure was associated with idiopathic inflammatory myositis.

Headlines: RedHill BioPharma Has Positive Results From Crohn's Disease Trial
Teaser: The recombinant zoster vaccine Shingrix prevents shingles, and if people do contract the virus, it reduces the severity of illness, two company-funded studies suggest.

Headlines: California Sues AbbVie Over Alleged Kickback Scheme for Humira
Teaser: The complaint was prompted by a 'whistleblower' who said AbbVie allegedly hired nurses 'nationwide' to represent themselves as patient advocates when they were really company ambassadors 'hired to...keep patients on a dangerous drug at any cost,' according to the state's insurance commissioner.

Headlines: New Guidelines: Antimicrobial Prophylaxis for Cancer Patients
Teaser: ASCO and IDSA have jointly issued updated guidelines for antimicrobial prophylaxis for adult patients with immunosuppression associated with cancer and its treatment.

Headlines: ADHD Boosts Risk of Early-Onset Parkinson's, Other Diseases
Teaser: Patients with attention-deficit/hyperactivity disorder (ADHD) may have an increased risk of developing Parkinson's and related diseases, particularly when treated with stimulants, preliminary data suggest.

Headlines: Fatal Toxicity With Immunotherapy: Rare, but Increasing
Teaser: A large meta-analysis reveals that reports of fatal toxic events with immune checkpoint inhibitors are still rare but are increasing as the use of these drug increases.

Headlines: White-Noise Therapy for Tinnitus May Have Adverse Brain Effects
Teaser: Maryland on Thursday charged Insys Therapeutics Inc with deceptively marketing a powerful opioid pain killer so that it was prescribed inappropriately beyond its intended use with cancer patients.

Headlines: Antidepressants Lack Effectiveness for Depression in Dementia
Teaser: Severe disease at baseline may be one of the factors associated with the development of conjunctivitis following treatment of atopic dermatitis with dupilumab, according to a small retrospective study.

Headlines: Maryland Charges Insys With Engaging in Deceptive Opioid Scheme
Teaser: Clinicians should consider nalbuphine for patients with opioid-induced urine retention who do not respond to alpha-1 blockers or who want to stop bladder catheterization, the authors of a case report suggest.

Headlines: Severe Dermatitis Tied to Dupilumab-Associated Conjunctivitis
Teaser: Although sunitinib improves disease-free survival in high-risk resected renal cancer and adverse events are manageable, many patients discontinue therapy, and its role is a matter of debate, say experts.

Headlines: Nalbuphine May Be Option for Opioid-Induced Urine Retention
Teaser: About one in eight essential medicines in low- and middle-income countries may be fake or contain dangerous mixes of ingredients that put patients' lives at risk, a research review suggests.

Headlines: 'Jury Still Out' on Adjuvant Therapy in Kidney Cancer
Teaser: Cutaneous adverse reactions to hydroxychloroquine in patients with dermatomyositis appear to be associated with autoantibody phenotype, according to a new study.

Headlines: Fake, Low Quality Drugs Come at High Cost
Teaser: Climbers who take zolpidem at high altitude may put their performance and safety at risk, a new study from Europe suggests.

Headlines: Hydroxychloroquine Skin Eruptions in Dermatomyositis Tied to Autoantibodies
Teaser: More people in the U.S. are dying from self-inflicted harm, including suicide and drug overdose, than from diabetes, a new study suggests.

Headlines: Radiotherapy for Some Brain Tumors May Hamper New Memories in Kids
Teaser: Nearly one in five American children uses at least one prescription medication, and roughly one in 13 kids takes more than one prescription drug, according to a new study.

Headlines: Taking Zolpidem at High Altitude May Be Unsafe
Teaser: Antibiotics are effective in children with wet cough that lasts longer than four weeks, a new Cochrane review suggests.

Headlines: U.S. Deaths From Self-Injury Surpass Those From Diabetes
Teaser: Early results from a trial of JAK inhibitors for hair loss will be unveiled at the upcoming dermatology meeting. Specialists will also delve into the adverse skin effects of immunotherapy.

Headlines: US Children at Risk for Severe Drug Interactions
Teaser: With more and more states legalizing marijuana, whether for medical use, recreational use, or both, increasing numbers of Americans are using cannabis. A new survey finds that one in seven had used marijuana in 2017, with smoking being the most common manner of consumption.

Headlines: Antibiotics Effective in Children With Chronic Wet Cough
Teaser: Post-stroke intrathecal baclofen (ITB) is associated with less spasticity-related pain and improved quality of life on some measures compared to conventional management with oral antispastic drugs, researchers say.

Headlines: Olanzapine Effective for Chemo-Induced Nausea, Vomiting
Teaser: Oral olanzapine likely helps reduce nausea and vomiting in patients undergoing chemotherapy, but the optimal dose remains unclear, according to a new Cochrane review.

Headlines: More Evidence TNF Inhibitors Raise Risk of Peripheral Neuropathy
Teaser: A large epidemiological study provides more evidence of a link between tumor necrosis factor inhibitors (TNFi) and peripheral neuropathy (PN).

Headlines: No Significant Safety Concerns With Bivalent HPV Vaccine, Study Finds
Teaser: Most older women who get chemotherapy for breast cancer do not experience problems with cognition in the first two years after diagnosis and treatment, a new study finds.

Headlines: Most Older Breast Cancer Patients Do Not Suffer Mental Decline After Chemo
Teaser: The World Health Organization (WHO) said on Monday that there was minimal risk of children contracting the polio virus in India from a tainted batch of vaccines.

Headlines: WHO Plays Down Risk to Indian Children From Tainted Polio Vaccine
Teaser: Most patients with chronic diabetic macular edema (DME) who received a fluocinolone acetonide intravitreal implant did not require additional therapy to lower their intraocular pressure (IOP), according to a registry safety study of the implant (Iluvien, Alimera Sciences).

Headlines: Fluocinolone Acetonide Implant Effective for Refractory Diabetic Macular Edema
Teaser: Persistent red-tinted vision and cone photoreceptor damage were reported in a patient who had taken a large dose of the erectile dysfunction drug sildenafil.

Headlines: High Dose of Sildenafil Tied to Long-term Retinal Damage
Teaser: Prenatal exposure to anti-tumor necrosis factor (TNF)-alpha therapy does not appear to affect immune system function, growth or development in young children, according to a new study.

Headlines: No Ill Effects With Prenatal Anti-TNF-Alpha Exposure in Young Kids
Teaser: Antiangiogenic agent could slow lesion growth in von Hippel-Lindau disease, sparing patients multiple surgical resections and deteriorating quality of life.

Headlines: Pazopanib Shows Promise in Rare Cancer Syndrome
Teaser: Pediatric inpatients labeled as allergic to antibiotics have worse clinical outcomes than hospitalized children without this label, new research from Australia suggests.

Headlines: Labeling Hospitalized Kids as Antibiotic-Allergic Tied to Worse Outcomes
Teaser: An experimental GlaxoSmithKline vaccine could prevent tuberculosis developing in half of those who receive it, making it potentially the first new shot against the global killer in a century, researchers said on Tuesday.

Headlines: GSK Vaccine Success a Milestone in TB, but Room for Improvement
Teaser: About one in five older patients with advanced cancer report financial difficulties, which in turn, take a toll on their mental well-being

Headlines: Financial Toxicity Prevalent in Older Cancer Patients
